Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelinggirl
Reviews.Content: Got to stay here one night and loved it. The rooms are spacious, very modern, very clean, with lots of extras. The bath area was very modern and very nice. The mini bar is quite expensive, as they all are and the lighting in the bathroom could be better for us girls to put make-up on. Those are truly the only somewhat negative things I could say. The staff was very efficient, courteous, and fast. I would definitely stay here again. It is directly across the street from the Hard Rock Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover99
Reviews.Content: We had a great night at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Anything we asked, including was answered with specifics, ie good breakfast recommendation also came with good directions on how to get there. The hotel itself is a a superb location, walking distance to all the best of Boston. Went across the street and were right in Fanueil Hall, short walk to Boston Common, North End, and Newbury Street was a nice stroll. Waterfront just a minute away. Can 't ask for much more. The hotel itself was very clean and the beds really comfortable. We had a nice small balcony overlooking the pretty view of Fanueil Hall lit up with twinkling lights at night. Black Rose short walk with some great Irish music and drinks. Really fun and great night!

Reviews.Title: “useful for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Roman1956
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location. The clean business hotel with the good atmosphere. Trimmings from many types of wood are giving the additional warmth and the effect of the relaxation

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: derekUS
Reviews.Content: Pros: -modern, classy room decor -rooms were very clean with no weird odors that hotel rooms always have -location was amazing it was literally on top of Quincy market yet not far from downtown shops and frog pond -price was good because i was checking around (don't pay more than $200 after hotel taxes for a base room) -good for anyone (lower, middle, upper class - lifestyle) Cons: -if your a light sleeper you may have issues because there is music until about 12am downstairs. I didn't have an issue as we had TV on and the windows closed. -base level views out of the windows are sort of terrible, lol I was looking at a warehouse or something I am not quite sure (but really..... go outside your in Boston, stop hanging out in your room) -parking prices are insane! Advice: -if your there for a weekend. Drop off your bags (of just carry them like we did) and go park in the 75th street parking garage (its not on 75th street look it up before you travel) for $15 all day parking on Saturday. Same price for all day Sunday. (there's no extra charge for overnight, if your car is there till Sunday at 12:01am then u just pay for Sundays all day rate) Cheapest around. Not sure what you want to do for weekdays but i know some garages have weekly specials but be prepared to drop a fortune on parking otherwise. ($40 a day is average)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mollleeeeee
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is its location. It is comparable to other prices in the area but it is just not quite there when it comes to validating the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there a long time ago”
Reviews.Author: canadiencyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a long time ago for work, I have stayed in many hotels since, not in Boston but this is still my favorite out of all. Service is exellent, you have the grat terrace where you can have drinks and snacks delivered, the views and location are great, the rooms are the cleanest in all the Hotels I have ever stayed. I recommend this hotel wihout a single doubt. Thank you. I would love to go back! Nothing but good things to say about this hotel. canadiencyn@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: EandG75
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night for my wife's birthday, in part because we were able to get a dirt-cheap rate and because it is only a 5 minute walk to the North End. The entire hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. I expected to get a minimal room for the rate we were paying, but in fact we were upgraded to a great corner suite. Couldn't be happier with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ben64
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and another couple spent last weekend (Feb 17 â€“ 20) visiting Boston for a long weekend of sightseeing and relaxation. We travelled down from Toronto by plane on Friday afternoon and within minutes arrived at our hotel, The Bostonian Millennium. In choosing this hotel I was most interested in location. My chose proved to be a good one. Right outside the hotel doors is Faneuil and Quincy Markets along with an abundance of Irish Pubs with plenty to see and do right there. To the east was the water front and two blocks northeast Little Italy. Macys and other retail shopping is a 10 minute walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel on location alone! Prior to arriving I had a small request regarding our rooms and Mr Rivers, the GM, looked after it personally to our complete satisfaction. The front desk staff also should be commended for their dedication to Customer Service. Everyone one of our requests was met with a smile and positive results. Finally the Chief Consignor, Gabriel Toussaint, was able to assist us in all of our restaurant reservations and also worked endlessly to assist me in finding a specific item in Boston. Thanks Gabriel! The hotel itself is remodelled and clean. Shower in bathroom is huge and our room also had a â€œmakeupâ€� area right at the entrance to the bathroom. Our room overlooked Faneuil Hall and part of the Boston skyline. Room cleaning was prompt and efficient. We ate at Fisher Hall, Legal Seafood and a quaint Italian place in Little Italy. All meals were excellent, though a little pricey, (but we were on vacation). I believe we could have spent the entire weekend, (or weeks for that matter,) in little Italy...our travelling companions had just returned from Venice and they felt that the selection and quality were on par. Thanks to Mr Rivers and all the staff at the Millennium for assisting us in enjoying our weekend in Boston and I know we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelsavvypr
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, great location

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: funsandiego
Reviews.Content: Good location across Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market and the Government Center. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and comfortable although it was quite small for a suite. Our room had a nice balcony with table and chairs. Although the bath anemities were generic, they were a decent quality. The bathroom was very spacious. We were on the 8th floor and there are only 5 rooms on that floor which made for a very nice and quiet stay. Decor throughout hotel is simple and minimal. Room service was excellent - the English muffins are made at the hotel and are wonderful. The hotel restaurant was also very good with very reasonable prices. Cons: Our towels were pretty shabby and should be replaced; our balcony had tacky "plastic" greenery in the planter boxes; in order to reach our room on the 8th floor, we had to take two different elevators - the first lets you off on the 7th floor and you wind around the 7th floor to reach the elevator that takes you to the 8th floor. The hotel does not have a gift/sundries shop. Valet parking is $45 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Doormen Around”
Reviews.Author: Willtravel4winenfood
Reviews.Content: It's not often one gets the chance to recognize the doormen, but in the case of the Millennium Bostonian, they simply have the very best. We stayed two nights at the convenient site, and were offered guidance, help and direction from doorman that not only were professional and courteous, but also, savy enough to lookup and remember my name. Classy. We would recommend and will certainly stay again. PS. The front desk was very good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LikeToLeave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a vacation. Perfect location to walk to almost everything interesting or catch the T. Great to grab something to eat at Quincy market before/after a day of sightseeing. Quick taxi to/from the airport. The hotel was nice & felt safe. The room was clean & big enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “great location near Boston's North End”
Reviews.Author: Maurdunn
Reviews.Content: medium sized hotel 5 minutes walk from Faneuill Hall and Quincy market shops, bars & restaurants. 10 minutes will get you to the city's North End with it's history and geat Italian shops & restaurants. The hotel has recently been refurbished and has a comfortable lobby and nicely furnished bedrooms. My room only had a shower but it's roomy and powerful The Fitness centre is small and not brilliantly eqipped so at busy imes it's difficult to get on machines. There is an Aveda spa & salon attached - I had a great massage from a therapist called Autumn - highly recommended for keeping jetlag at bay!

Reviews.Title: “nice location rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Very close to the airport and right across from Quincy market. The rooms and buildings lay out in a maze and it can be hard to navigate thru the hotel and find your room. Rooms are small even by Boston standards but clean and updated. There was some sort of drunk domestic issue right in the hall outside my room at 1am when a couple could not find their room- security actually had to remove them- very odd experience and due to that not sure as a woman traveling alone I would stay at this hotel again (for sure not if I am alone!)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel. Great location. At the Faneuil Hall.”
Reviews.Author: TM_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Overall, hotel is comfortable, newly-renovated, convenient and very well located. Great value for the price. Rates are not so attractive for budget travelers, though. Pros: 1. Location. Safe, easy to find and easy access to anywhere downtown Boston. Across the street from the Faneuil Hall Marketplace. 2. Room size and sleep quality. Rooms are big, with a king size bed, comfortable mattress and high thread count sheets. I stayed at the 5th floor and no noise was listened from the streets. 3. Wireless internet. Fast and reliable (including in the rooms). 4. Refrigerator. There is a refrigerator in the room, with drinks and food available for purchase. 5. Hotel amenities. I used the hotel's gym and the one of its various meeting rooms. Great place both to work and/or to work out. 6. North 26 Restaurante and Bar. Great food and breakfast (not complimentary). I did not try room service. 7. Friendly staff. Staff is great, well trained, educated and ready-to-help. Cons: 1. View. The room have a very large window. However, the view from my room was the backside of the hotel and some of the old harbor-like streets in this area. I completely recommend this hotel both for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Boston Millennium”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I completely enjoyed our stay at the Millennium. The location was awesome, right in the heart of Boston. Our room had a beautiful view of the city, and was very clean and comfortable. The atmosphere in the lobby was inviting, and beautiful. Very pretty with the fire going in the fireplace. We've had both dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaraunt, and the food was excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jsc0626
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December, 2011. Although the lobby was mediocre - it was really OK but nothing special - the room we had on the 5th floor was beautiful! Exceptionally clean (I'm a bit picky) with an exceptional view of Quincy Market and a tiny step-out balcony. The bathroom was nicely appointed (could have used 2 sinks), nice toiletries offered, and nice HD TV (could have been slightly larger), although they did not offer HD service so the TV could only transmit in Standard Definition. What a waste. The concierge was helpful if asked (Gabriel gave us a recommendation for a fantastic French restaurant, within walking distance). The hotel is within walking distance to many of the sights and we just left the car - did not use it for the 2 days we were there. Beware of two things though: 1)parking is expensive! But I understand there is a parking lot across the street that is much, much cheaper! 2) The Internet connection IS NOT free. This little fact is hidden deep in their website (although we couldn't find it at all). It's not THAT expensive ($10/day) but still, it made us angry that there was a charge and it wasn't evident on the website for the hotel. That really angered us. All in all though, we had a great stay and would absolutely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: njchristiansen
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location to check out a fabulous city! Right across the road from Qunicy Market, it is a short walk to Boston Common one way, and the North End (A must for dinner every night!) the other way. Staff are quiet and friendly and the room was clean and modern. Nice comfy bed too!

Reviews.Title: “I could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Mike14wa
Reviews.Content: Despite previous reviews, we found our experience at the Millenium Bostonian to be outstanding. We booked a standard room using their PPCLICK promo code and paid only $135 per night. We ended up on the 7th floor and we had a very nice city view with the North End and Bunker Hill Monument in the distance. The room was very clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. The bellman and front desk staff were very welcoming and kind. The hotel is directly across the street from Quincy market so the location could not be better. The government center is the closest T stop which is roughly 3 blocks away. We enjoyed the short walk to the North End and Hanover street. We also enjoyed "Churchhills Cigar Bar" which is adjacent to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel as our experience was excellent. I am typically very hard to please, but found no flaws with the Millenium Bostonian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Greenskeeper19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time for a night in october and I can't stay enough about the hotel. The location is right next door to Fanueil Hall and walking distance to the TD Garden, the waterfront and the North End. It is probably the only hotel in the city that has balconies for each room, they are small but kind of nice. The staff was very nice and accomodating. The rooms were top notch. We were able to get a good deal through the hotel's website (under $200) and will stay here every time we go to Boston if we can obtain a rate that good. The Intercontinental which is closer to the waterfront used to be our "go to" place but it might be the Millenium from now on.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JennyOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium for my best friend's wedding on New Year's Eve. First off, they were very accommodating to her in providing more than reasonable rates for the room block for visitors. It made it unnecessary to search for a better deal in the heart of Boston. We stayed in room 517 and our view was fantastic. The Zakim bridge, the fruit market and the old charm of the brick buildings of the area. The bed was SO comfortable!. The room was large and had ample space including a vanity area, closet and modern bathroom. We asked for a small refrigerator which they were quick to bring to our room, free of charge. We also asked for a crib (we were traveling with a newborn) which also came quickly and was free. (The crib, however, was so gross that we didn't use it with what looked like tatty discarded used bedding that GoodWill wouldn't have accepted as a donation. It was very surprising as it didn't fit with all other aspects of the hotel). The room service was prompt and quite reasonably priced, we had one breakfast and one dinner during our stay. There is also an Aveda salon next door where I grabbed a last minute pedicure before the wedding. They are affiliated with the hotel, you only need to dial 888 to get through to make an appointment. All hotel staff were quite helpful and our stay was more than comfortable. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who wants to be in the heart of Faneuil Hall to explore the beauty of downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great night out around the holidays.”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night out in mid-December. The hotel is in the perfect spot for the holidays. Right across the street from the shops and restaurants of Faneuil Hall and the tree is all lit up at night. Great restaurants are all around and you don't need your car once your checked in. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, modern and the very clean. Location can't be beat in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service, great location”
Reviews.Author: 52Overtherainbow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart of Faneuil hall and Quincy market. We stayed there for the new year celebration. Great location. We used the valet parking but didn't take time to check the ticket which read - car retrieval can take 20 minutes. I wish they had verbally told us this and recommended that we call down earlier on the day of departure to make sure out car was ready. When it was check out time the valet service told us it would take 45 minutes because so many people were checking out. This should not be a surprise to them since it was CHECK OUT time. They should staff appropriately for that hour or two. Check in time was 3 but our rooms were not available until after 4. The rooms were clean and up to date with large flat screen TV's, bathroom amenities,...etc. The hotel feels very safe; after midnight hotel staff checks guest entering through main door. Breakfast is not included in the hotel room. Coffee is put out in the morning but swiftly taken away by late morning. Everyone was nice but service was not seamless.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, amenities at an additional cost”
Reviews.Author: whynotbookit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights to see the sights in Boston. The hotel has a great location right next to Faneuil Hall and a short walk to the north end. Also a short walk to the T which can connect you to the rest of the city. Our room was good sized with a comfortable bed and nice walk in shower. The "balcony" was tiny but it didn't matter too much in December. The closet was positioned in the hallway leading into the bathroom which was awkward but it was nice to have an in room safe in the closet. Did not use the valet parking at 42 dollars per night or the wifi at 10 per night or eat anything from the minibar which was also pricey.

Reviews.Title: “sad windowless room”
Reviews.Author: SanFranLawyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights on business (the room was booked through our corporate travel group). It was really one of the worst 'nice' places I have stayed. Its a nice enough hotel - cozy interior, great location, clean. But really the worst room ever. First - there was one tiny slit of a window that looked over a roof full of air vents and the like. The set up was terrible- first, the TV hung on the wall to the left of the bed. You either had to lay sideways or perch on the edge of the bed to watch it. The shower head was set not at the long end of the tub (as every other tub shower I have ever been in anywhere in the world) but on the wall mid-way down! You had to stand mid-tub and try and shower width-wise. In the main part of my room - I could hear every (yes, every) noise from the bathroom next door. The closet was a half closet - that is, the hangers were set at chest level (so, long Boston-winter coat had to be slung on the desk chair). They charge 10$ a day extra for internet PER DEVICE!! yes, that's right. For wireless internet - if you log in with your computer and another device (phone, iPad,etc) you are charged 10$ per day for EACH! Housekeeping woke me at 9a.m. on Sat. Room service breakfast of oatmeal and coffee took 40 minutes. The fitness room is very very small, stuffy and windowless - but all I needed was a treadmill so it was sufficient. All in all,given that there are a number of nice hotels in this part of town - I'd recommend you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Your Service Saved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Megan S
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to have the opportunity to visit the Millennium Hotel in Boston for an overnight stay. The hotel is beautiful, the location was perfect, especially for the purpose of our trip which was to attend a Bruins game. My daughter and I were able to walk to the Hard Rock Cafe for dinner and stroll through Faneuil Hall, while my husband and son attended the game at the TD Garden, also within walking distance, which was very much a relief considering our original experience with arriving in and driving through Boston. My family and I missed the exit for 93 and spent an hour driving around the city before finding our way back to 93 now in the early stages of rush hour traffic. We arrived in Boston to realize we had forgotten to bring the directions to your hotel and not having a navigation system contacted the hotel for assistance. I would like to express my sincere appreciation for three members of your team who were incredibly helpful in assisting us in arriving at your hotel and making it to the game on time. At the time of our arrival, after what should have been a two and a half hour drive from North Conway that turned into a five hour ordeal, I don't think my family or myself completely expressed our gratitude to Eyassu, your doorman, Paul, your valet or Brendan your valet manager. Both Eyassu and Brendan assisted us with directions to the hotel, Brendan even stayed on the phone until we actually arrived at the front door. When we arrived a little frazzled and running late for the game, our car was unloaded, we were escorted to the check in desk, our bags were carried off to our room and Paul was waiting for us outside the doors to our units when we arrived up on the 3rd floor. Paul made sure we were settled, gave an over view of the room, set the heat to our liking and left us to decompress after our adventure. My husband and son arrived at the game on time and had a fabulous night. My daughter and I had a lovely evening at the Hard Rock CafÃ© and Faneuil Hall, within walking distance of your hotel. Every time we exited or entered your hotel we were greeted very warmly by Brendan and Eyassu. What started out as an exciting preholiday family trip to the city could have been cancelled completely, as we almost turned around feeling we would surely miss the game had it not been for the incredible service of your team. As the Front Desk Manager at a resort, I can only hope that I and my team handle ourselves as well as your team did in making sure my family and I fully enjoyed our trip to Boston. Thank you again to you and your wonderful team for turning a disaster into a fantastic adventure.

Reviews.Title: “love is in the air”
Reviews.Author: shawnt90
Reviews.Content: We visited on valentine's day. The city is beautiful. The location steps away from quincy market. The hotel was beautiful. And comfortable. The box on the roof outside our window was like a tractor trailer but I have relax and sleep sound app on my phone so problem solved.

Reviews.Title: “Moderno y bien ubicado”
Reviews.Author: tripcarlo
Reviews.Content: Aunque no esta en el meollo, esta muy bien ubicado, justo en frente del Quincy Market, y a pocos minutos andando del puerto, del Boston City Hall, del metro y del centro. Es un hotel moderno, limpio, con amplias habitaciones (no recuerdo el nÃºmero de la mÃ­a, pero como hacÃ­a esquina, tenÃ­a ventanas a dos lados y era muy espaciosa). Estuve en Abril 2011. Mi Ãºnica queja es que la seÃ±al Wi-Fi no llegaba bien a las habitaciones, asi que pare descargar los emails habia que bajar al lobby del hotel, que por otra parte, es muy agradable. Definitivamente muy recomendable y espero volver.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: key05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December as a couple Cons: The incidental fee. They placed a $100 hold on my account for â€œincidentalsâ€� i.e. room service, mini bar, internet which they return if you didnâ€™t use or buy anything. Internet service was $10 for 24 hours. Also, our room overlooked a outdoor fresh produce market that took place on Fridays & Saturdays behind that was a street (though we did have a nice view) and we heard a lot of noise from the market and the street (tons of sirens). While the noise did not bother us, but I can see how it would bother someone who is a light sleeper. Pros: LOCATION! The location of this hotel was perfect for us. Right across from the Quincy Market with tons of shops, restaurants, entertainment we practically walked everywhere we wanted to go! You can walk to the market, to the North End where all of the Italian restaurants are, to the Old State House and the site of the Boston Massacre. We made reservations at the Union Oyster House one night, which was right around the corner. We also walked to a stand where we were able to buy tickets for the Old Town Trolley Tour, which was fun. A quick taxi ride from the airport as well (cost about $25). The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was also complimentary Starbucks coffee in the mornings and warm apple cider in the afternoons which was great during the cold month of December. The fireplace in the lobby was on the entire time as wellâ€¦ making the lobby nice and toasty. Which felt great walking in from the cold. The hotel is decorated nicely as are the rooms. I didnâ€™t use any amenities so I cannot comment on those. But we found the rooms to be very nice and clean. Not overly spacious but it was just big enough. In all the pros 100% outweighed the cons and next time I go to Boston, I plan on staying at the Millennium Bostonian Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: IMF57
Reviews.Content: Very good location, room can be quite noisy if it faces the main street. Close to lots of restaurants and attractions and a short walk to TD Bank Gardens. Hard to beat the location, rooms were clean, service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BKT48
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its proximity to the airport, good restaurants, and routes north, and we were not disappointed. A few minutes and a trip through the Sumner Tunnel got us there. Check-in was easy, and our smallish but very pleasant room had a tiny balcony overlooking Faneuil Hall. At dinnertime we walked the few blocks over to Salem St. for an old-fashioned North End Italian meal. The beds were fine, and the shower was outstanding. Breakfast at North 26 the next morning was great (though not cheap), with attentive service. Finally, the valet gave us good directions for getting on Rte 1 North. The only downside to the whole stay was the $42 tab for parking (for one night!), but I do realize that parking in Boston is always expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Former Regulars Turned Off by Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: EmilyK655
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I come into Boston a lot for hockey games, special occasions, etc., and often stay at the Millennium Bostonian Hotel. Typically we have a pretty good experience until this past weekend. Within five minutes of being in our room we noticed a really strong cigarette smoke smell in our bathroom. We called the front desk to complain and they said they would send someone up immediately to check it out. No one came in the next hour that we were there. When we came back later that night and complained yet again, they acted like it was the first they had heard of it and would "look into it." We stayed two nights and the issue was never addressed and in fact got worse. By the time we left, the whole room smelled like cigarette smoke. While checking out, we mentioned it again and yet again they acted surprised. They apologized but offered nothing to alleviate the situation - they could have even done as little as remove the $5 water charge from the room. But they literally did nothing. It will definitely be our last stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine75
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over the labour day weekend and the city was busy. The rooms are beautiful and the bed is very large and comfy. I loved the bathroom, modern and clean with a parlour just outisde for the ladies. There was also free cold lemonade in the lobby in the afternoon and free coffee in the mornings. The breakfast in the restaurant was excellent and a good price, the service was also very good. As I booked over the labour day weekend, the price was high but on a 'normal' weekend I think it would be better. The hotel also had a wedding going on whilst we were there and some of the banquet rooms are directly across from some bedrooms so the noise did bother a little, but not too much, I am very noise sensitive too. The location is excellent and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: loracVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot beat for its location to alot of the local attractions. The service staff were very helpful and courteous. When we first checked in we were given a room that overlooked the street where they were doing construction work right outside out window. The noise was very irritating. After reaching someone at the front desk, they finally agreed to move us to a side of the hotel where it would be more quiet. This took about an hour. The room we received was smaller than our original one and had a giant bathtub that was hard to climb in and out of. If it wasn't such a hassle, I probably would have moved again. There are not too many breakfast places nearby (other than Mc Donalds or DD) and their restaurant was good but a little expensive for breakfast everyday. Overall a good property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for first-time visitors+awesome showers!”
Reviews.Author: Mayoeats
Reviews.Content: We "named our own price" on priceline and lucked out with this hotel! Walking distance from North End and all of downtown Boston. It's also 1 block away from subway "the T" so you can get anywhere. The rooms were spacious, beds comfortable, and showers were AWESOME. Our only complaint was that they didn't have free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “meetings: location good, but watch costs...”
Reviews.Author: hellovakay
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up for a nice hotel with a good location for meetings if you are in boston for business. Thumbs down for some non negotiable, surprising costs: A word to the business-wise, if you need to a projector for your presentations, it is cheaper to buy one easily nearby ($650) than rent one from the Millennium for $900 for AN HOUR AND A HALF! Another expense that the hotel makes unavoidable, is the wireless internet for the meeting room is $120 addition to the room rental. An option is the( boutique) Collanade Hotel, which was easy to deal with, and much more reasonable in costs.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ARIEL D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the fall of last year. It was amazing. We had a great view of Fanueil Hall and the clock tower from our room. The rooms were very updated and modern (which we love)!! The service was great, and the staff was friendly. Though, we didn't have any issues that we really needed assisting with. We will definitely be coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Sam6689
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and want to save you the trouble of a terrible stay. Once they screwed up our reservation, they choose to save face and blame us for the mistake. As a result, I had to sleep on the floor. Stay away from this place. There is no customer service. Unless you get lucky, you will hate your stay here. I won't even get into the uncleanliness and discusting bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pick! Wouldn't choose anyplace else in Boston”
Reviews.Author: jeijei80
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've ever written about a hotel. A friend and I stayed at the Millennium August 16 to August 18, 2011, to attend a game at Fenway and to sightsee. I was a little concerned when reading some of the reviews, but booking this hotel definitely panned out. It was my first trip to Boston and upon arrival at the front desk, I asked for a room with a great view facing Fanuiiel Hall. I was given a wonderful room (I believe on the 5th or 7th floor), which was basically a corner room and had a little juliet balcony. The view was great!! Thank you (belatedly) to the woman at the front desk for obliging! The Millennium is a perfect location for first timers to Boston and i can't imagine staying anyplace else if I ever make it back to Boston. Also loved the modern decor in the rooms :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, Conveniently Located.”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo1317
Reviews.Content: This is an expensive hotel located across the street from Fanueil Hall and within walking distance to most of the history of American Pre-Revolution history. It is only a $20 ( with Tip ) taxi ride from Logan and there are some terrific pubs and shopping within one block. Excellent food court right across the street in the Old Market square across the street. The rooms were sufficient, we had a "Superior King" with a small balcony that afforded us a nice view ( 6th floor) of Fanueil Hall and a lot of fresh air that came with a lot of street noise, but the thick glass doors cut it right off when closed. The staff is just OK, not bad but not really great, the housekeepers didn't speak a lick of english and it was hard to request supplies or speak to them in any way. But God bless them as they were doing the work that the "Occupy Boston" crowd a few blocks away are too good to do ! The front desk always had fresh fruit, the mini bar expensive but well stocked, in room coffee was excellent, and the TV a BIG flatscreen. It is a great place to not have a car and walk, or bike, around town, as there is a great urban bike rental 1/2 block away. They allowed us a late check out, which is great! We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMcG12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in March. We also used their conference room and had dinner catered one night as well. The food was very very good and was never in a short supply! The rooms were very spacious and the bed was huge and comfy! Unfortunately I did not have that much time to explore the area but there were definitely bars in the area. It was a great hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: HRHREDHEAD
Reviews.Content: The Millennium Bostonian is a beautiful hotel directly across from The Quincy Market and Faniuel Hall. It was also within walking distance of the Little Italy area of the city and a $5 - $7 cab ride to Beacon Hill and Boston Common. We walked several blocks along the harbor walk to the Aquarium. The concierge, Gabriel, was very attentive and helpful. In every instance we were delighted with his recommendations for shopping, dining and sightseeing. If you want to rest in luxury in the "heart of it all" the Boston Millennium is the place to be. This Pittsburgher is going back as fast as she can.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location!”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline622
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the absolute best location, as everyone else on here has already stated. It's right in the heart of Faneuil Hall. The closest T stop (Haymarket) was only like 2 blocks away and we found that the lines (green and orange) were the most convenient to getting to the major sites if we did not want to walk. Service was great - especially the valet and bag handlers. Valet was expensive ($42/day), but that's expected. Check out was at noon, but you were able to leave the car without an extra charge until 2pm, which was nice for continuing to explore the area in the morning. We checked out earlier than 12 because we were afraid we would not make it back before then so the front desk held our bags for us. When we returned to leave, the valet guys even packed our car for us! It was an easy walk into the North End (go to Mike's Pastry - AMAZING cannolis in like 10 different flavors!) and an easy walk into downtown via State and Washington streets also. The rooms were spotless and very modern. I didn't hear any outside noise at all and I stayed on Friday and Saturday nights. The value here is absolutely unbeatable and I'd love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0547
Reviews.Content: What a great find. I've stayed at many world class hotels and the Millennium Bostonian is as good, if not better than any. The rooms were very modern, quiet and spotless. The towels, linens and bedding were of the highest quality. The staff were wonderful and accommodated every request. Whether business or pleasure I will only stay at the Millennium on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Best location ever. Rooms spotless and close to all the attractions. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Basic Boston”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: We were off to a rocky start as we were put in the noisest room on the planet (rm 241) where we had to endure loud techno music on the Friday from 10 pm to around 2 am. We called down once and then asked to move. They were very accommodating getting us the exact same room two floors higher and all was well. They also sent up a bottle of Champagne whihc was a nice touch. The hotel is more than adequate but has no soul. Service is fine but not extraordinary. The breakfast room is great and cheap for a hotel. I had a nice view of Fanueil Hall outside the window. This is a pretty touristy and noisy part of Boston but you can walk to the great restaurants in the North End. Check in and out was smooth so no complaints there. Suite was expensive but this is almost a major US city. Would I stay there again--sure. Would I recommend it--sure. Was it great--no.

Reviews.Title: “"The Only Place We'll Stay in Boston"”
Reviews.Author: Cid911
Reviews.Content: A coworker of mine suggested the Millenium Bostonian Hotel to me last December and we ended up staying there for 3 nights. This has to be absolutely the best place to stay while visiting Boston. No need for a car, just put it in the onsite garage. The daily charge is reasonable and worth it. Walk to the Fanieul Hall Marketplace, the North End, the waterfront, the metro and countless pubs and restaurants. Super clean rooms and fabulously professional staff. They make you feel like you're in a small scale family owned hotel while it's really a classy, large scale establishment. We were celebrating a special occasion and they took care to provide us with a beautiful room overlooking the stunningly Christmas lit Fanieul Hall plaza. Ms. Mercado, one of the managers, was more so professional and helpful. The concierge, Mr. Gabriel Toussaint, was uber professional in every way. He went way above and beyond, effortlessly, in every regard to make our stay special. We stayed again this past August to take in one of the North End weekend street fairs and our stay was just as pleasurable as our first stay. Great room, super clean, courteous and professional staff. I almost don't want to rave about it too much thinking perhaps I might have difficulty booking it the next time!! Again, the concierge, Mr. Gabriel Toussant, found it easy to make our stay even more memorable than the first. He's indeed a real class act and a true credit to this hotel. I have to also mention the remarkable food at their North 26 restaurant right downstairs!! Their high ratings on are 100% deserved and on point. Amazing that a hotel should have so many terrific aspects. We can't wait to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: This is really a great place to stay and has the best location. Right next to Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Freedom Trail, North End and much more. The T is also close and you can get easily to Fenway Park, Harvard, and many other locations. I only wish they had ice machines available. If you would like ice, you have to ask! Service is great and staff is very helpful! It is a little pricey; however, location and service are awesome! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: CTKath
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel in Boston. I felt the price was reasonable and the location was absolutely stellar! We had a corner room on the top floor in the back. Our view was the green park area and the North End and right across from the Hard Rock Cafe. The room was lovely. I loved the sliding door in the bathroom, it allows for more room. I'm even thinking about doing it in my own house! Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great tourist's hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogocop
Reviews.Content: Have read mixed reviews about this hotel, but reserved it through Priceline and didnt have any choice. All I can say is that our experience was terrific! Amazing location - only a $20 cab ride from Airport and located right next door to Quincy Market and across from Long Wharf. Easy walking distance to Little Italy. Rooms were modern, clean and bathroom was oversized with a great shower. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely good value hotel in centre of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn A
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Boston and stayed in the Millennium Hotel. It's great value for money, in a great location and the rooms are very well decorated, modern and clean. It doesn't look beautiful from the outside but it's lovely inside and far more comfortable than some of the other hotels in the city. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying there”
Reviews.Author: Eric G
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Millenium Bostonian Hotel. I really enjoyed my stay there. The room, the location (close to Faneuil Hall), the service and the food were all excellent. I will definitely be back. It reminds me a bit of the Nikko Hotel in San Francisco. The bed was really nice and I slept really well. This is a completely different experience to staying in a big chain hotel like the Westin. I would say that the Westin is more generic and the Millenium Bostonian is more Organic. I hope you have a chance to meet both Kerry and Burak. They were both brilliant and really nice. This hotel was worth very penny I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: puteshestvenitsa
Reviews.Content: We have booked a room via hotwire. Hotwire did not allow us to select whether we wanted 2 beds or 1. After we booked it, we called the hotel to change our reservation to 2 beds. They refused, saying that we did not book a room through them and that Hotwire needs to modify the reservation. We called hotwire and they were stunned at the response. They called the hotel and requested 2 beds. We arrived and the hotel said that they do not have a room with 2 beds available. We asked for a roll-out bed and they promised to deliver it to the room. We spent a day in the city, came back late only to find out that noone has delivered the bed. We asked for the bed again, the hotel staff promised to deliver it, we went out for dinner and came back to a room with no roll-out bed. We did not feel like arguing and I spent my night sleeping on the floor

Reviews.Title: “Great Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: DO_O30
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend here recently for my first trip to Boston. The location was great it's right across the street from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market and an easy walk to the North End and the dock. There's a nice little green way across from the hotel with fountains and tables if it's a nice day can grab something to eat and sit there to enjoy. If you're coming as a tourist I suggest coming earlier than your check-in time because you can valet park the car and the hotel will hold your bags until your room in ready. They do charge to park your car but you'll have a hard time finding parking on the street. Check-in was at 3pm and we got there at 12pm and had no issues. Room - We ended up on the top floor with a view of Faneuil Hall and it was modernly decorated. The bedroom was on the smallish side with the King bed but comfortable enough for the two of us. Huge bathroom with an enormous shower probably could have fit six people in it lol. WARNING about the minibar do not touch anything in the refrigerator unless you plan on buying it. It has senors so as soon as you pull something out it gets charged to the room. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was good but expensive I suggest going to any number of the other local places and save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff not so great....”
Reviews.Author: Kingfish1949
Reviews.Content: I keep coming back here because of th location, but only when I can get a deal on a room. Last time I booked through an outside booking agent and was treated poorly by the front desk staff since I didn't pay full price. One call to the booking agency however cleared things up. Apparently the problem was staff related and not policy. Rooms are smallish but nicely appointed. I'm hoping for a better experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: curlz83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium during the summer for a couple of nights with our kids while on a quick trip through Boston. It is in the absolute best location if you are doing sightseeing in the old part of Boston. It's right off the Freedom Trail, almost in the middle of it. It is literally right across the street from the Quincy Market area with it's great and varied food shops, shopping, and street performers galore! We were also very close to the harbor too. My kids loved this area. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating. Our rooms were spacious and clean, and the beds were comfortable with nice bedding. We got two rooms. I liked the setup of the rooms sharing an entrance door from the hallway with a shared entry area, but then each room had it's own door off the entry area. It allowed a little more privacy for my husband and I than the room-to-room doors. While the hotel didn't have a pool (which is normally very important to the kids), there was so much to do in the area, we didn't seem to miss it. Further most hotels in that part of Boston don't have pools. One afternoon, tired and hot from shopping and touring, the kids put on their suits and ran through a charming ground fountain park right behind the hotel--one of many in the area. One of our best family trips ever!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury...Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: One of my top 3 hotel stays of all time! I booked this hotel at the airport due to my flight was delayed 4 hours and I was going to miss the last Ferry of the day to Provincetown. I normally read all the reviews and search for the best price but obviously there was no time for this. It was close to Loganâ€™s Wharf where the ferry departs from so I booked it. The cost was a bit expensive but it's Boston and the prices weren't any more or any less than any other hotel in that same area. Needless to say, I was really impressed once I arrived to the hotel. The lobby was very updated and decorated in a modern traditional style. The front desk staff and the doorman were super helpful and nice...it took the desk less than 3 minutes to get me checked in and sent on my way. Once I arrived to the room I was blown away with how large the rooms were...was I really in Boston with a room this size? There was a very large closet, a separate space for the sink and bathroom, and I had a balcony overlooking the Clock Tower, the Pier, and Downtown Boston. The true king size bed was very plush and amazingly comfortable with large firm pillows that provided for excellent sleep throughout the night. I decided to order room service and it was a bit costly but the food was excellent and sometimes you have to indulge. The next morning I woke up pretty early and opened my balcony door to be greeted by the Farmer's Market right in front of the hotel. Wow, what an amazing site to see and smell all the fresh fruits, vegetables, homemade desserts, and fresh baked breads. This unplanned Boston overnight stay turned out to be one of my best hotel experiences ever. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to other travelers and I plan to go back and miss my ferry to Provincetown just so I can stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: makubre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip to New Hampshire, I wanted to be close to the airport for our departure. We loved the location the view from our windows :-) I think it's a bit overpriced for what you get, but I have come to realize that most hotels really over rate their value. Having to pay for wireless internet is a bit ridiculous considering how much the rooms cost.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: Irishdevil04
Reviews.Content: I had lived in Boston for several years while going to graduate school and while I never stayed at the Millennium Bostonian, my perception was that the hotel was in a great location and would be nice for a stay. My early perceptions were largely correct when I finally stayed at the hotel over Labor Day weekend while back in town for a wedding. The hotel's greatest asset is its location, across the street from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Markets it is right in the center of what most tourists come to Boston to see. It is a short walk to the North End, Boston's Italian neighborhood, and to the New England Aquarium and boats that will take you on whale watching trips. You are at almost the middle of Boston's freedom trail which goes by the corner of the block the hotel is on. The hotel is easily accessible by car from the airport, the train station or from the highway (which is a plus in Boston's colonial era mish-mash of streets). The lobby is nicely appointed and the front desk is fairly helpful and efficient. The bellmen were very helpful in getting us a cab when we were leaving and taking care of our luggage. Our room was a superior plus, but was still relatively small. This is probably to be expected in a city hotel, though I have stayed in other hotels in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood that were more spacious. The room had a small balcony and looked out on Fanueil Hall. This could be concerning as in the evening the area can be noisy, particularly on weekends, but the windows were well insulated and it didn't bother us. The bathroom was nice with a good sized shower (no bath) with one of those rain-like shower heads that was great. The layout of the room was also a bit weird, with the closet basically in the bathroom. The room was also in a second building connected to the hotel which required a twisty walk to get to from the elevator. Not a tremendously long walk, but the housekeeping cart was always nearly blocking the narrow hallway and there was a maintenance closet next door that they seemed to be working in regularly. Small complaints to be sure, but it did detract somewhat. We didn't spend too much time in the room itself, but the a/c unit wasn't the best and the cable signal on the TV was terrible. You shouldn't be staying here to watch tv, but it was annoying when you had the tv on in the morning or evening. We tried the hotel restaurant for breakfast on our last day. It was very good though expensive, like most hotel restaurants. As another poster mentioned, you are close to a lot of good restaurants in the area that you may want to check beforehand, but you won't go wrong if you do. Overall, a nice hotel though a bit expensive. It's in the touristy center of the city, so is a good base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: srk3465
Reviews.Content: Great location literally across the street from Fanuel Hall. This is a nice boutique hotel. Rooms are good size, well equiped and furnished (great big tv). Bed very comfortable. Front desk staff seemed on the ball and provided good service. They boast about their restaurant but honestly- there are so many places around the corner or across the street at Fanuel Hall, not to mention that the North End is a 5 minute walk, I'd recommend trying local fare. I come to Boston twice a year for a meeting which is held at this hotel and I look forward to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location was everything”
Reviews.Author: KAREN J
Reviews.Content: The Millennium met my criteria of safety, close proximity to the sites, close to public transportation, bathtubs, etc. The staff was very accommodating. Our group arrived around the midnight hour. I had booked three adults to each room. The beds were a little smaller than expected, requiring us to get another room. The hotel honored the original price we had locked in a couple of months earlier. The views were exceptional. The rooms were clean. Worth it all the way around. Definitely would return.

Reviews.Title: “My go to place for a trip to Boston”
Reviews.Author: Malphaba
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Millennium, and I will keep coming back. This most recent time was for a girl's get away with my sister, before she left for college. The hotel is in an ideal location, in walking distance from the train station (also TD Garden where we were seeing a concert) and directly across the street from Quincy market. There is also an Aveda spa right next door. The service was fantastic, and the staff was always pleasant and willing to help us out or give us directions. The room itself was wonderful with very comfortable beds, and great showers and bathroom, with an additional vanity space to get ready (always a plus with more than one traveler, especially women!) My only small issue was that there is no dining options after 11 (even a bar menu... or anywhere in the area after a concert let out!), and we ordered late night room service, which consisted of sandwiches that I think had been sitting in the fridge for awhile, and I'm not even sure are what we ordered... It did the trick that late at night though, and was the only thing that made me raise an eyebrow the entire trip. True there are cheaper lodging alternatives in the Boston area, but truly the location cannot be beat, and being so close to everything you will get your moneys worth for your Boston experience

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatUNH1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium for 2 nights and it was great. The room was somewhat small, but for a city hotel, that is to be expected. The staff was amazing, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the location can't be beat. I would recommend this to anyone looking to spend a few days in Boston sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. It was just across the street from Faneiul Hall and Quincy Market.”
Reviews.Author: GraceLovisa
Reviews.Content: This was a great location, service was wonderful, rooms very well appointed and the restaurant was also very good. It is an upscale place but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Management Response”
Reviews.Author: Madison G
Reviews.Content: We had 4 teenagers with us. One of them left a hundred dollar bill in the bathroom when we went to breakfast. When we came back, the housekeeper was in the room. The child went to get her money and it was not there. We asked the housekeeper not to leave the room, but she went running out of the room, down the hallway.. When we reported the incident to the managers, Scott and Andrew, all they could say was that the housekeeper has worked with us for 17 years. Management did not appropriately handle this situation. When you stay at a hotel, one wants to know that management will take a report of theft seriously and thoroughly investigate. We tried to follow up on the results of their investigation, with 3 separate phone calls. Although we left messages, NO ONE returned our calls. I will not stay in a hotel that does not take my safety seriously. As convenient as this hotel is--in this case, location is NOT everything!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but multiple problems from the start”
Reviews.Author: travelinmama1731
Reviews.Content: I am really unsure if I would stay at this property again if given the chance. First I will start off with the positives. 1.Mostly everyone was very friendly 2. You can not find a better location in my opinion. We were directly across from Quincy Market/ Fanueil Hall and the haymarket. Also very close to the North End/ Little Italy (if you like cannolis you must try Mike's Pastries in North End), and the aquarium (did a whale watch here but we did not see anything.. money wasted b/c we had to return home the next day and could not use the vouchers) 3. I must not be a light sleeper b/c the haymarket was right below us and yes they are loud early in the am but we only noticed it on Sat and we are on vacation to get up and sight see/not sleep in, so we didn't mind. I really didn't notice too many other sounds but you are in the city and yes, there are police cars and emergency vehicles. 4. We paid for connecting rooms (one w/ 2 doubles which had a great view and a small balcony for one person) and one room w/ a king. All rooms were very well appointed although 1 very small towel rack, which I thought was absurd.. We had no where to hang our towels. The rooms were very clean and had everything that one might need. (except for places to hang towels. .there was one very small rack but you can't hang 4 towels on that when there are 4 people in a room) 5. I called a few months ahead for a reservation and chose to do the AAA Advanced Purchase rate which could not be cancelled or changed. Closer to the date I realized that the price had lowered drastically. When I called and spoke w/ someone at the front desk to see if I could get any sort of credit I was repeatedly told NO. However, I later phoned Garth in reservations and he was more than happy to accommodate me. Although I could not get a refund, he was very pleasant about issuing me a 'credit ' to use in the hotel. With parking being $42/day we were able to apply some of the credit here. Now, for the bad points 1. I had noticed repeated reviews on TA commenting on the A/C not working. When we arrived the a/c in the one room was fine but we noticed it was very warm in the connecting room. The temp was set at 68 and it was 78 in the room... not too uncomfortable but it was getting warmer by the minute. We notified someone at the desk and were told that is 'how the unit operates' and that we should simply turn it off, wait and turn it back on again.. WE did this and it worked for about an hour and then stopped working again. We called the front desk again and they sent someone up immediately. He looked at the unit and cleaned out 'black water' from the tube, hoping that would help. He was extremely helpful and friendly. We went out but when we returned, it was even hotter. That evening we had to get up almost every hour to 'reset' the thermostat. When we told the morning staff at the front desk, we were again told "that is how the unit works." They sent another engineer to our room who told us that we MUST keep the unit set on 68 and it will keep the room at 68. We explained that was way too cold for us. Although we were hoping to keep it around 74 we were forced to keep it at 68. Reluctantly we set it at 68 just to have it eventually creep back up to 80. Again, back down to the front desk to complain. It got to the point where we got the feeling they were tired of hearing our complaints. We heard "I'm sorry." but that was it. During the third day the same thing happened again, at which point they sent the engineer back who had been there the first day. He said there was definitely problems with the compressor but it could not be fixed until Monday, the day we were checking out. The problem continued all 4 days that we were at the hotel. Finally the manager did offer to move us but we had a connecting room b/c my parents have medical issues and they were in the other room so we couldn't move. I don't fault the hotel for this b/c they did offer to move us but I am upset and a little unnerved that they refused to believe there was an issue and we were treated like it was no big deal until the engineer himself agreed that there definitely was a problem w/ the compressor. At this point the manager did offer to refund one night. We greatly appreciate that but it was very annoying being told multiple stories by the front desk staff just so we would stop complaining. It was obvious they had no idea what they were talking about. 2. Another huge annoyance- the room keys provided worked the first time we entered the room but not after that. We had problems with the keys not working EVERY time thereafter. We would attempt to enter the room just to find the key not working. At that point, I would once again head to the front desk to get another key made, to bring it up and find that key didn't work either. Finally one of the gentlemen at the desk came up with us and realized that we were right and none of the keys were working. Although this seems like a minor problem it gets very annoying to have to get keys reprogrammed 4+ times a day. 3. When we had the multiple problems w/ the a/c and the key cards one of the gals at the front desk was very apologetic. She expressed how sorry she was and wanted to offer us a free breakfast on one of the days. She said that our letter offering such would be put under our door that evening. We awoke on Sunday and nothing. Same with Monday-nothing. Yes, we could have asked for it but she was not on duty when we realized that she had made an empty promise. 4. Parking $42/day and they park you on an open lot next to the haymarket. At least we could see our car but at that cost I would hope it would have been in a garage somewhere. Wifi- $9.95/day. My son needed this to finish an online course so he had to go to a fast food restaurant to use the free Boston Wifi. Overall this very upscale hotel basically has the location going for it. Mostly everyone was pleasant but I eventually felt like I was being a huge inconvenience b/c I expected our keys and a/c to work. We were in room 615 and were told the a/c would be fixed on Mon so hopefully for future travelers the hotel will take care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and well appointed!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen9726
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston for college visits and some family time. The location of the Bostonian was perfect for getting the T, heading to the North End for dinner and a walk and for all the shopping the area affords.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boston stay evah!”
Reviews.Author: Elyse802
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be located more conveniently - right across the street from Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall! Easy to access off the highway too. Upon check-in, they even upgraded us (didn't even have to ask) to the top floor with a balcony overlooking Quincy Mkt. and the historic Hall! The hotel was gorgeous, clean and the service definitely 4 star! I would stay here again and again, and highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ldotybrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 20-23, when it was very (103) hot. Previous issues noted about the air conditioning, must have been corrected by the time we arrived. But the complimentary lemonade in the lobby was a lovely touch. This was our first trip to Boston, and we were total tourists. I'd recommend the Millennium to anyone who fits that bill. We had read that cars are more problem than they're worth in Boston so turned in the rental car as soon as we arrived, which apparently saved us $42 a day. The front desk staff was warm and helpful. Our housekeeper was an absolute delight. I can't think of anything negative about anyone who works there. We arrived about 11:00 AM and they held our bags until check-in. We walked across the street and bought tickets for the trolley tour, which was a great way to get acquainted with the city. Being right across the street from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, was very convenient. Around the corner to the right are many old, delightful pubs. We walked to the North End (Little Italy) for dinner or pastries quite easily. It is just one block off one stop on the Freedom Trail. We stayed Wed.-Sat. and the farmers market was there just Friday and Saturday. I don't know if it remained through Sunday. The room was fabulous. We faced Quincy Market, but didn't have any issues with noise that you wouldn't have in any major city. I don't think I was woken at all during our three night stay. We stayed on the 7th floor and had a great view of the market area and city. Although I like to try new things on a repeat visit to a city, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jmw6
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 of my children, just to do the touristy things in Boston. I couldn't have asked for a better location. This hotel sits right across the street from Quincy Market. As others have said, the room was a bit noisy at night, but I think if you're staying in-town in any city, there's going to be noise. The hotel front desk staff helped us schedule our sightseeing, provided valuable insight about the best way to get everything done on our agenda, gave us local maps with routes highlighted, and made us reservations for a duck tour, all done with smiles and well-wishes. Nice. The room was spotless, modern and extremely comfortable. Coffee and tea were provided in the room (I love that). We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, even though it looked great. With so many food options around the hotel, and with so much to see and do, we just ate on the run. The taxi ride from the hotel to the airport was just over $20. Don't bother getting a rental car if you stay here. Get a T pass if you must, but there is so much within walking distance that a car just isn't necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: grdube
Reviews.Content: Was there's for business for one night. I liked it. Very welcoming and warm. Rooms were nice and had great beds. The restaurant attached to it was very nice although I did not like the crab cakes at all. It is a very central location Boston. Can't ask for much better. The price was ok, but I checked later and it was far more expensive then what I paid. Bad: $42 parking a night and they put your in the back alley (I could see it from my room) - absurd!! Wifi charge for every device you own and want to connect (I had three, phone iPad and laptop). I manage to get two for the price of one but in this day and age, come on!!! Room facing Hay markert are noisy early in the morning (5AM) because of delivery trucks.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2trippersIBX
Reviews.Content: Front desk was extremely helpful, even fixing my husband's eyeglasses (screw had been lost). Nice lobby to sit and relax in, with books and fireplace and comfortable sofa. Hotel was convenient to all downtown waterfront activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tahlula13
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for touring around Boston! It's right off of the Freedom Trail which makes it very convenient to see the sites. We walked everywhere and there are a ton of great restaurants and activities in every direction. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was delicious. The room was very comfortable, the bed was good and there were good amenities. We had a problem with the safe a couple of times, but someone was sent to the room very quickly to fix it each time. My only complaint is that our room had a skylight and this made the room very bright when the sun starting coming up around 5:30 each morning. It looks like most rooms do not have the skylights so if you like to sleep in a little, be sure to request a room without one.

Reviews.Title: “It was O.K. but I won't go back anytime soon...”
Reviews.Author: Bedandbreakfastfan43
Reviews.Content: I normally donâ€™t write negative reviews when there is nothing major to complain about, so Iâ€™ll consider this a small checklist of things that this hotel can do to improve. First off, let me start off by saying we booked a room with two double beds. My first complaint is these were the smallest double beds I have ever seen. Myself, my twenty four year old nephew and 13 year old son were hard pressed to make this work as the beds were THAT small. I went to the manager at the front desk and to her credit she acknowledged this complaint from others numerous times and she gave us a roll-a-way bed for our room at no charge (normally it is $20.00 per night for one). She really did right by us and I appreciated it. The other issues are of personnel choice as and nothing the hotel did wrong. Anytime we wanted ice we would need to call the front desk and have it delivered to us as there are no ice machines on any floor of the hotel. Secondly, there was no A.C. on at all in the hallway (of our floor at least), and I couldnâ€™t understand why, but still not something Iâ€™m going to hold against them as maybe with the heat wave they were trying to conserve from somewhere. The location is as good as it gets being next to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, so that is not an issue. Concierge service was always wonderful and professional. All in all, the best way to summit it up is that it was like a date with someone that nothing major went wrong, but there just werenâ€™t any sparks to make you want to go out with that person again. Note: Wi-Fi in your hotel room is $9.95 for 24 hours if you choose to purchase it.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: SWMinmetroNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend. Suffice it to say, we were not too happy. We go to Boston a lot and normally stay by the Commons. The hotel is in a superb location, but that is all you can say that is nice. On our first night, we walked back from the north end (Little Italy). Immediately outside the hotel and to the left (as you go to Little Italy) are produce vendors. At night, on the way back, you find some unsavory characters. One followed my wife and I for a block and sort of ruined the night. Later that same evening as we tried to go to sleep, the noise from the street below was pretty bad. We stayed in a superior room which has a tiny balcony. You can hear everything...ambulances, cars, general traffic, etc. The hotel needs some sound proofing. The following night (7/16) a security alarm went off in the night twice. It went on and on and on. LOUD!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The hotel said it was from across the street, but it's hard to believe. Let me top this review off by noting the fee for overnight parking is $42. I'm use toit being from NYC metro area, but what I am not use to is getting my car back covered in bird droppings. I paid $84 plus taxes to have a car loaded with dung.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NittanyL
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a four night business trip and have to say that I enjoyed this meeting tremendously; mostly due to the location of this hotel. The location was great. It is right by Faneuil Hall which is a hub of history, restaurants, and shops. As for the hotel itself, it met all basic needs. The hotel has a "smaller" feel to it which I thought gave it some charm. I had a room with a king-sized bed that was comfortable and the room was clean. I would recommend staying at this hotel if you want a hotel that is near this area of town.

Reviews.Title: “A/C problems, 78 degrees at 4a.m.”
Reviews.Author: briandressler
Reviews.Content: BIG problems with the room a/c. It was about 85 degrees outside during our walk in Boston our first day of arrival 7/2/11. The room thermostat was set to 68 and when we got in the room around 3 pm I turned it down to 66 and closed the window shades. At that point the thermostat read 74. Going to bed later that night it was at 74 and got hotter during the night. We woke up at 4 and it was 78!!! At 8 am I called and a technician was sent. He "re-set" the system and we left it on 68 during the day with window shades drawn. Day two when we got back after our tour it had only gone down to 74. We asked for another room and still had problems. The staff was curtious but the problem wasn't ever solved. Very dissappointing to spend ourone holiday vacation in the heat, inside and out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Novice276
Reviews.Content: Although small, this was a very nice hotel across from Quincy Marketplace, blocks to N. End and Aquarium area. Rooms were clean, of moderate size and nicely decorated. Balconies are small but lets you step out into the fresh air, unlike most other hotels in the area. Parking fee was a bit steep and there was no free internet in the rooms. A/C and safe issues in the room during our stay were corrected immediately. All things considered, we would probably stay again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: LisaZ_11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels and this was by far the best hotel I've stayed in. It's beautiful, remodeled, contemporary and couldn't be in a better location if you want to see Boston! Directly across the street from Quincy Market and The Waterfront area. The services was exceptional. When I first got to my room, the room had a shower only. I called asking for a room with a tub and was not only given a better room, but the bellman met me in front of the room so I didn't have to come back to the front desk with all my luggage and back up again. $40 a night to park is steep but that's to be expected anywhere in the area probably and worth it frankly considering the hotel, location, and service. All in all, a wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GoDucks99
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. Five minutes to the North End. One minute to Quincy Market. Ten minutes to the Long Wharf. Service was very good. The odd thing: No towel racks in the bathroom. But towels were changed out daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... nice place.”
Reviews.Author: mattscards
Reviews.Content: The Bostonian is in a great location. That is the 5 star of the 5 stars there. Within walking distance all around you is where the city began. Lots of history. The Boston Massacre, everything. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance and nice bars close. The hotel was a little different. It was not too hot when we went, but the air conditioner did not work too well. When you go in and the a/c is set on 66 and it is 76 degrees, I get concerned.. after an hour it never cooled off, I asked for another room. I am not going to wait around for the maintenance man to "change filters and see if that works" I finally had to settle on the 3rd room, the first 2 the a/c was not up to par. I am 6-1, 190 pounds, so I am not a large man that needs 40 degree weather. I just want to be able to sleep without sweating. The front desk was nice about it. They simply changed rooms. It was the maintenance man that is in charge of telling them the room is good. Other than this, Everything was great. The bed was nice, the pillows were 5 star quality. The room was very clean, and because of this, the a/c thing, which was corrected did not leave too bad of an impression. Next time I go to Boston, I would stay at this place again, but I would ask about the a/c up front. Valet Parking is not cheap, so get ready for that.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality for the price! Not so good for children!”
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was beautiful and in a great location, there were too many quirks and poor customer service that made it an overall nuisance to haved stayed here! I stayed here with my two small children and would not reccomend it for families! First of all there was a "prank" fire alarm that woke us up at around midnight and scared my two children. In the morning no apologies from the staff and I would have thought a "sorry letter" to appear under our door would have been a classy touch to a "4 star" hotel, but no just our overpriced bill! Again no aplogies even when we checked out the next day. Also the street is rather noisy so once we woke up it was hard to get everyone back to sleep. Even still we awoke at 9 am to hear a "squeaky bed" going at it in the room above! Again not really classy especially for children! Another thing I noticed was when our room was being cleaned the service lady washed our used glasses in the sink and once she left you could see our lipmarks still! Gross! Again not very 4 star! Okay so now we are checked out and waiting for our car which we valeted. Not a wise decision perhaps! It took over an hour when the ticket says about 20-30 minutes! Even at the 30 min mark we were brushed off and so finally at the hour it took 3 hotel staff to figure what went wrong even though we were waiting right in front of the front desk the whole time! You would have thought they would have noticed something wrong, but no again, the hotel fails at customer service. They were nice but not too good at their jobs something you would expect for the 4 star rating. So here we are at home and noticed we were charged twice! I called but got a machine. Again not very professional in my opinion they should straighten out mistakes like this right away and so we will see if it will be anything like our car! I already expect the worst at this point! SO PLEASE DON"T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE! I think next time I will stay at the Marriot Long Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, friendly and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: eertpit
Reviews.Content: We took the train from New York to Boston and walked the short distance from South Station to the hotel. It's a very good hotel and we had a penthouse room with balcony, room 805. Superb views across Quincy Market to the harbour. Everything was nearby, including Underground (100yards), North End restaurants, takeaways, street entertainers, good bars, the lot really. Boston is a great city to walk around and it's relatively safe too. Our room was excellent although the carpet has a history. The balcony was large with good quality table and chairs to take in the sun at most times of the day. Stayed here before and will stay again. Even use of PC internet in the Business Centre was free for flight check-in and printing boarding cards. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler55
