Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable hotel with a modern flair in a great location -- literally across from Faneuil Hall. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Would stay here again when doing business in the Boston financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: mhomelvig
Reviews.Content: Stayed at many wonderful hotels up and down the East coast these past 2 weeks. Really appreciated the extra attention we received from Parvena. With my mom in a wheelchair, she made sure our stay was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2Tris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our anniversary. The location is perfect. You are right in Faneuil Hall and the North End is just a short walk. The staff was friendly and helpful. The beds are comfortable & the room was clean and nicely decorated. The rooms are a little loud, but we just left the fan on on the air conditioning system and it drowned out the noise from outside. And the "walk-out balcony" is very tiny so I would not recommend paying extra for a balcony room, although it was nice to step out and look around. I don't think two adults could comfortably be on the balcony at the same time! We enjoyed our stay very much & would stay again on our next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Boston Best”
Reviews.Author: TashaLin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 30th anniversary. Almost immediately the hotel became my favorite in Boston. Not only was our room perfect - facing Fanieul Hall, with a walkout balcony - but the staff was just wonderful. From the moment we arrived the staff out front, the bellmen, the people behind the desk - they all treated us as though to say "you are important to us." The we were sent a bottle of champagne, flowers and a box of chocolate truffles along with a Happy Anniversary card. We also enjoyed the cafe in the hotel. There is a lovely library in the lobby with a fireplace. In the middle of all the action - yet quiet. This will be my hotel of choice in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but many problems”
Reviews.Author: cityslicker3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days and two nights to attend a wedding that was held at the hotel. The weather was hot during most of our stay, and our room's air conditioning (set at 72) only kept the room between 76 and 79 degrees on the second and third days. We called and had service people come three times in attempts to fix the air conditioning, but nothing worked. However, that inconvenience paled when compared to the conditions in the room where the wedding and subsequent dinner were held. Temps felt like they were in the high 80's or low 90's in the room, and the air conditioning had clearly not been working properly for hours before the ceremony. While every couple wants their wedding to be memorable, I doubt this was the memory the bride and groom anticipated. At checkout, I mentioned my unhappiness due to the air conditioning problem in our room and was given a very modest discount on the charge for that day. Some of the staff were very helpful, others were not helpful. The internet charge ($10 per device per day) strikes me as outrageous since even budget motels offer free internet access. Room was somewhat noisy, but given the location I thought that was to be expected with the crowds on the street below.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: hitowr
Reviews.Content: Location was excellant. Service was so-so. Front desk staff not friendly. Rooms very small and we felt confined. TV channel selections terrible, halls dark, no free amenities at all, no paper, coffee in lobby picked up by 9am.. Won't go there again, will try another downtown location next time. For the price, very overrated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: widtml
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Millennium Hotel with family for a graduation. We enjoyed our stay very much. The location is great, directly across from Faneuil Hall - lots of great restaurants nearby and a lot of activities going on. We originally were looking for a hotel in the Copley Place area but being graduation season there were no openings. However, after our stay at the Millennium we were very pleased with our accommodations and its great location. The rooms were slighly on the small side but still very adequate, the bathroom and closet area was good size, no bathtup but nice shower. We had a nice view of the Haymarket (Farmer's market). From the top floor we could see across the historic buildings all the way to the bridge. Since it was graduation weekend, the staff was busy but still very friendly and accommodating. The restaurant in the hotel is a little pricey but there are so many great restaurants in the area that there were a lot of other choices. Would recommend this hotel for a great stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Harmony177
Reviews.Content: Hotel was directly across from Fanuil Hall Market place so it was very convenient. Rooms were nice even if on the small side. Bathroom was spacious, but no bathtub. Lobby area, public restrooms, and bar (North 26) were all nice. The hotel was a little pricey, but may have been due to the timing of my trip (college graduations and cubs vs. red sox game). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance in a vibrant location”
Reviews.Author: DrewKnightWV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium Boston Hotel for one night while in town on business in May, and was thoroughly impressed with the quality of the experience. It has been ten years since my last stay at this property, and I must say, both the hotel and its environs seem to have come up several notches. The room itself is furnished as you would expect in this class: granite and marble bath, dark wood and soft surfaces all in rich materials, a comfortable king bed strewn with pillows, and a flat screen TV. However, it was the overall design -- an understated elegance -- that stood out. The Milllennium is now on par with the Intercontinental in terms of room quality. It was a lovely place to lay one's head. The area surrounding the Millennium Boston has also enjoyed a substantial upgrade with the removal of the elevated central artery highway... Ten years ago, this hulking, rusting green monument to bad city planning cast a literal shadow over the Haymarket-Fanueil Hall neighborhood. Now, the area seems much lighter and brighter. The air just seems, well, clear. A few words about Fanueil Hall: I lived in Boston and environs for 20 years, and Bsotonians love to sneer about Fanueil Hall as a tourist trap no Bostonian would stoop to visit... Which never accounted for why you'd run into friends and colleagues having fun there every time you would visit. In spite of the "down economy" -- or maybe because of it-- Quncy Market was packed with people both Thursday night and Early Friday morning during my visit. I suspect both residents and tourists still love Fanueil Hall because you can go, stroll, people watch, window shop, eat, drink -- and not have to spend a fortune. It is a vibrant, fun place, Boston snobbery notwithstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rafterlover
Reviews.Content: Clean room. Great maid service. Quiet. Awesome location to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, nice (but small rooms). Overall, will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: JJamon
Reviews.Content: The absolute best location in Boston. Right next to Fanuil Hall and the Haymarket. You can see the red line for the Freedom trail from the hotel. A 5 minute walk to 2 different metro stations. A 5-10 minute walk to the North End with all that it has to offer. The hotel itself is nice (not particularly trendy), but clean and very nice. It's not luxurious per se, but professional and as expected for the price paid. The rooms are small, but well laid out. Bathroom was actually quite large for the overall size of the room. Comfortable bed. Shower could have more pressure and the temperature fluctuated a bit (but this is a problem at pretty much every hotel). We didn't really need the staff, but they seemed friendly enough (always welcomed us to the hotel, opened the front door for us). It is not a very tall hotel and so with it's great location, it is a bit noisy. Ask for a high floor. The area isn't a super busy spot at night, but it was still a bit noisy. Overall, not a huge problem, but if you are an incredibly light sleeper, may do better elsewhere. Some rooms have balconies, but these are literally only big enough for one (maybe 2) people to stand on. No furniture on balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MJG2011
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel allows you to easily explore Boston if your schedule is limited. The rooms were very well maintained and up to date. The staff was very attentive. We were able to explore the North End prior to picking up a cruise ship in the afternoon. Very short trip to the cruise pier.

Reviews.Title: “great- loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: sjpat
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and comfortable. All the staff was friendly and helpful. The food was good and reasonable priced. Great location. The only thing I can say bad about the whole experience is -they need a better housekeeping staff. The room was uncleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and cozy!”
Reviews.Author: RebusGirl
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel In a great location close to everywhere with professional and friendly staff. Modern room furniture and nice lobby area. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Too many glitches”
Reviews.Author: jamesm0m
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th time at this hotel, and the first time it wasn't a love fest. The air conditioning broke the first night, was fixed for the second night, and then down again for the third night. The night manager said the air was not turned on yet for the building, but that wasn't true as we had air the second night. Also, we asked for directions to Boston U., but were given directions to Boston U. Medical Center--so we missed our son's appointment (but the manager gave us free breakfast coupons for the goof up). Also, our key cards NEVER worked. We had to get maids to open our door in spite of getting replacement cards each day. Also, the maid left us no t.p. or clean glasses one day. And the front desk staff was not overly friendly Grrr. Having said this, the room was pretty and the location is great and the restaurant staff was super.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and clean”
Reviews.Author: lala422
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay over the last weekend. This hotel is immaculate. The bed is clean and comfy. The pillows, and lots of them, are very soft and comfy. This is the first hotel I've stayed in that didn't feel the least bit dirty. The location was perfect, walking distance to shopping, restaurants and attractions. We did not eat in their restaurant as it seems to be a little expensive for us. The staff is super nice, helpful, polite, professional. I can not wait to stay in this hotel again. I won't even shop around, this is the one for me. The one downside for me is the price of the snacks in the room. 6.75 for a bottle of Fuji water???? I just wish the snacks and such were more reasonable, then I might buy them.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the city”
Reviews.Author: 2havtrav4
Reviews.Content: We wanted a special evening away to celebrate an anniversary. From the valet staff to the front desk and bellman staff, we were made to feel that we were the most important people at the hotel. Our room overlooked Fanueil Hall and has a small balcony. I enjoyed the slightly circuitous route of hallway to get to our room. The hotel was quiet, the halls clean. Our room was lovely. I spent far too much time in the waterfall shower just absorbing the luxuriousness of it. We also dined in the hotel and enjoyed the vibrancy of the restaurant. The waitstaff accomodated special dietary needs without a second thought. I would stay again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: enez
Reviews.Content: I am from the Boston area and now live out of the country. Whenever I am in transit to visit family and need a layover in Boston my husband and I always stay here for a night to ourselves and a little pampering. The rooms are beyond comfortable and the balconies overlooking Fan. Hall are so charming. The staff is beyond helpful and the food is delicious. It is one of the rare places we have had room service that is table fresh. Everything about the hotel is luxurious but at a very reasonable rate. Cant wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: ejbauch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 5 year wedding anniversary. The hotel was fabulous, rooms very large and spacious. Bed very comfortable. Location is GREAT! Except when the bars get out then the location is not so great. We were on the 2nd floor on the street side and the noise was ridiculous. It at times seemed as if the people were right in our room talking/screaming/yelling. We would stay here again in a heart beat but would request a higher floor off the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and rooms - a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: This_too_shall_pass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium twice in 2010 on business and loved it both times. Location (near Faneuil Hall and some wonderful restaurants) is a plus. Rooms are not huge, but are well-appointed. Staff is very solicitous, from the valets (who opened the door for me - and everyone else - every single time we went in or out) to the front desk (who searched high and low for the appropriate cell phone charger) to room service, housekeeping and restaurant wait staff. Management has developed a very friendly and service-oriented culture at the Millenium.

Reviews.Title: “Some major disappointing mistakes”
Reviews.Author: JungleKatPC
Reviews.Content: Though this was a rather pretty hotel, with plush beds and modern baths, there was serious oversight with the staff. When I checked in I was given a key to a room that was still occupied. I do not mean that house keeping had yet to come, I mean that the previous guest had yet to vacate. I do not understand how this happened, and my questions through the hotel's website go unanswered. I was honestly uneasy staying there. If they could so easily issue me a key to another guest's room what was stopping them from giving the key to my room away. I expect such antics from a hostel, not from a well appointed hotel. I also expect management to respond to such serious issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touch...nice hotel....great location”
Reviews.Author: rmcpnh
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! This was our second time staying at the Millenium Bostonian, the first being 7 years ago. The hotel has done significant renovations and everything was different, but still great. We told the concierge it was our anniversary and not only received a nice upgrade, but they also sent up a bottle of champagne, flowers and sweets!! Very nice surprise! We will definitely stay here again. Only downside....we checked in early (4 hours) and were charged an additional $12 for parking. I wasn't shocked, but I had asked how much the parking was and wasn't told there would be an additional charge. The room upgrade, the champagne, etc. more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Lincharl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city. We were greeted by a very friendly and efficient staff and were promptly taken to our very clean and modern room. Beds are supper comfortabe and after a day of sight seeing it was nice to come back and relax. The only down side to this hotel are the vegetable vendors outside but once inside the hotel all that disappears and the serene beauty of the hotel takes over. Will stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to spend Christmas”
Reviews.Author: limwy
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, we walked to dinner in the North End on Christmas Eve, had lunch accross the street at a great seafood restaurant and Christmas Dinner in the hotel restaurant. Staff were friendly and helpfull and both times we rang for ice it came within five minutes. A very pleasant and relaxing Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & People”
Reviews.Author: EllieB06
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in the Millennium Bostonian - great experience. Great staff - concierge, door men - all very helpful with all types of requests. Our flight was delayed and they gave us our room for an extra three hours. The North 26 restuarant was very good for breakfast. Had dinner there once, was very good and had great cocktails. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. We stayed two nights at the beginning of a trip to Cape Cod. It is centrally located to everything, which was wonderful, but the room and bed were exceptional. Pleasant and comfortable; staff were friendly and very helpful. I would readily recommend this hotel for a Boston visit! A rained out Red Sox/Yankees game forced another night, which was unavailable, but Concierge Gabriel went above and beyond to find us another hotel. Looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel, doesn't honor trip advisor discount & charges for wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: msg62
Reviews.Content: Very chic, contemporary hotel near Faneuil Hall. Nice room, nice restaurant, bed not equal to Starwood or W in comfort but adequate. Booked hotel through trip advisor advertised rate plus additional 10% click-on discount. Hotel looked into at my request but denied knowledge of additional discount deal, saying my rate of $179 was far lower than typical in any case. Didn't appreciate the insinuation I was being greedy as opposed to taking advantage of advertised deal. There was, in fact a lower rate of $169 through "Perfect Getaways" discount service but I went with Trip Advisor deal since I'd never heard of the other service. Also think it's greedy for upscale hotel to charge you for wi-fi these days when Holiday inns are giving it for free.

Reviews.Title: “a great location to see Boston”
Reviews.Author: sahibbibi
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in Faneuill Hall and downtown Boston.Some rooms have a better view overlooking market so ask for them. Centrally located for seeing the harbor, downtown, Chinatown. We stayed for 3 days after my son's graduation and went to nearby Cambridge, ate at Legal Foods and spent quite a lot of time in Faneuill Hall

Reviews.Title: “A surprising value!”
Reviews.Author: Irish89
Reviews.Content: What an incredibly pleasant surprise. I travel for business a fair amount. I am pretty familiar about what you'll get for the money. When I discovered I could get a hotel in the heart of Boston for around $200 a night, I thought it might be OK at best. Boy was I wrong! This hotel obviously has some years on it (although I wouldn't consider it historic), but it has apparently undergone a major renovation within the past year or so. Very updated. Very modern. The lobby is very contemporary. It's a pleasant surprise from the otherwise bland exterior of the building. The rooms are generous and comfortable. Nice beds. Great views. Stocked mini-fridge. Ridiculously big bathtubs. And the service! Awesome. Everywhere I turned, people were opening doors for me, smiling and letting me know how welcome I was or just being generally helpful. Also, when I can in at the end of the day, my ice bucket had already been filled and the beds turned down. Certainly not the kind of service I would have expected in the center of such a prominent city in a hotel that's only $200 a night! Location: Also wonderful. Close walking distance to practically everything. Just across the street from Fanuiel Hall -- a wonderful market of shops and restaurants. Numerous historical buildings and monuments are no more than a 10 minute walk in any direction. Finally a note on the meeting space. I was here for meetings. The meeting rooms are lovely. Not the typical barren walls and stiff chairs. The meeting facilities are a bit expensive. (Maybe that's where they make up for the inexpensive rooms). But with everything else being so great, it was worth the price of admission. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PancakeRoll
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find walking (less that 10 minute stroll) from the Long Wharf having taken the water taxi from Logan. Location is superb - adjacent to Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall for shopping and eating. Old Trolley Tours start point is 10 mins away near long wharf. Within easy 10 minute walk of several tourist sites and only 20-25 minutesfrom others. The hotel has been refurbished and is reasonably stylish inside. There is a restaurant inside which serves breakfast (about $20 buffet), though plenty of cheaper options inside Quincy Market (only 12-6 Sun). Rooms are not huge but more that sufficient for 2 people. Rates are reasonable BUT not cheap. Very clean and reasonably maintained . Bathroom had no bath only walk in shower so request this when booking if you need a soak. Bed was very comfortable though it needed to be in order to compensate for the noise from Saturday night drinkers and the Sunday clean up lorries. Our view was towards Quincy Market so was inevitably going to be a little noisy. The room has a very small balcony which was very secure with narrow guard rails which would prevent children slipping through. Hotel has internet access and a free PC in the lobby for checking in for your flights/printing boarding cards. The only negative we could find for the hotel was the door staff who were inattentive and easily distracted. Other than that it was a great stay in a comfortable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want To Leave”
Reviews.Author: karen726
Reviews.Content: I spent hours researching hotels in Boston. My son and I were doing college tours and taking a little extra time to see the city and surrounding area. I hadn't been to Boston since 1987 so I was not familiar with the city at all. I read reviews. I went to every single hotel booking site. And then I went to Millennium's home page and found the best rate in the city for a well reviewed hotel. Room rate before taxes (and they are hefty) was 260. Parking was astronomical at 42 per day. Wireless is less than posted - ONLY 9.95 for 24 hours. The hotel is right across the street from Faneuil Hall and there are places open for breakfast despite everything you read. It is a 2 block walk to Hayward Street and the fabulous Italian restaurants as well as Mike's Pastry and Modern Bake Shop. Our room was HUGE! It was clean. We did not have a quaint balcony, but we did have plenty of space to spread out, a huge, updated bathroom with tub/shower (note to hotel, put a circular shower curtain rod in and the guests will stay warmer and you won't have to worry about flooding the bathroom). There was a lovely vanity table in an alcove outside the bathroom which meant I could do my hair and makeup while my son showered (total privacy). Housekeeping was a tad iffy during our stay. The ice bucket was left full of water for tree days (we decided to see if the housekeeper would notice it before we left - she didn't.) Powder spilled on a table was still there when we left. The room was spotless when we arrived, however. The staff could not have been more helpful (even running to my car one AM to grab some paperwork I needed) or courteous, but I did get some of the WORST directions ever from a front desk employee. The street she directed us to did not intersect Congress and we walked forever before realizing that we were almost in Connecticut. The T can be picked up behind Faneuil Hall or take a very short walk to Government Center and pick it up there. It is a short walk or an easy subway ride to Copley Plaza. I will always price shop for hotels, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JudyAC
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! - Location - If you like action, this is a good place. Lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Street performers. Farmers Market. Shopping. History. The T. - Rooms - we had a great room (not on the market side ;-)) The bed is very, very comfortable, the room a good size. We had a handicap room, so the shower was a little weird (like standing in a tile room, not a bathtub) and the vanity light was low - but so what. (we were only there three days) It was right near the elevator, but we never heard any noise. - Lobby - The lobby was very welcoming and comfortable. I mention this because each morning we went to Dunkin Donuts and the farmers market, then ate our breakfast in the seating area. (couches, chairs, tables, books) - Concierge - The Concierge Gabriel was great. I am not sure how we would have ever found a restaurant in all the restaurants in North End without him. - Treats - This was a special trip for us (birthdays and anniversary) and on our second night we received a complimentary cheese plate and bottle of wine in our room! (a little weird - no card with it) What we didn't like - front desk staff. NONE of them were very helpful or knowledgeable. They were not unpleasant, just not very good. Anyway - great hotel is you want to be in the action. Like other reviewers say - make sure you get a room on the right side of the hotel so it isn't too noisy. We had room 629 â€“ if you don't mind the handicap bathroom, ask for that one.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked nice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and it has been completely renovated and is better than ever. The location is perfect for touring Boston, at Quincy Market and steps from the Freedom Trail. Our room overlooked Faneuil Hall with a cute step-out balcony. These rooms have a great view, but can be noisy with the street below so consider this if you are a light sleeper. The room was large and comfortable, with a huge walk in shower and separate dressing room. There were some luxury touches- soft, thick towels, upscale linens, bath robe. I would stay here again for the fantastic location, right in the middle of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Not a restfull weekend!”
Reviews.Author: jolahiff
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying, the hotel is beautifully renovated and centrally located to Quincy Market, North End and T stops. What we didn't know is that the Hay Market which operates on Fri & Sat was going to be bellow our 3rd story window. They started setting up at 5am on Saturday morning! Needless to say we were cockeyed for the rest of the day! Looking for an early night and a good night sleep on Sat. night, we were again disturbed by the Hard Rock Cafe patrons hooting and hollering until way past 3am. Then there's the THIN walls of the hotel.....toilets flushing, doors closing, people talking in the next room, etc. We finally fell asleep after 4am from shear exhaustion! I think they should have invested in soundproofing during they're renovation! Very noisy hotel....will not be back!

Reviews.Title: “We've found our Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: HouTraveler
Reviews.Content: We are recurrent visitors to Boston and have stayed at a number of properties. The Millennium is our new home. It's flashy and comfortable at the same time. We booked a standard room, but were highly impressed - large with plenty of room to spread out, a great walk-in shower and an impressive view of the North End. We slept like babies in the large king bed. Given how quiet it was, it was hard to believe it is right in the middle of Boston's most touristy area. On a pure cost basis, it's not cheap, but with Boston's insane hotel prices, it's a real value. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, well located”
Reviews.Author: vanholt
Reviews.Content: Although a little on the high end for the current hotel market, what this hotel has to offer is location, location, location, not just in relation to the tourist areas like Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market and the wonderful North End Italian section of Boston, but it is in walking distance to T stops, bus routes, train stations and downtown. The staff was just adequate, nothing great. Although the concierge had sent a pro forma email before our arrival, no one responded when I asked questions back. We had to figure everthing out ourselves. The hotel is clean, comfortable, with small rooms and small windows. When I was given a near windowless, dark room because of late night arrival, the front desk was very accomodating about moving us the next morning. The price could be lower for what you get, but that factor is outweighed by the convenience of its location. The bar tender at the in house restaurant was very accomodating and the ambience very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Celeda51
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott fan, but the reviews of the affordable Marriott's were not that great. So we decided on the Millennium. We paid an average of $266 per night and higher-end Marriotts were in the $300 range. We took the T from the airport to the hotel for $2 each - a piece of cake! Email me if you need help doing this. It will save you about $30. It is in the middle of all the action; plenty of food, bars and shopping. Lots of Irish Pubs and North Boston (Little Italy) is only a few blocks away. Most of the tours originate near the hotel. Our room was cozy, clean and decorated nicely. The mattress and pillows were really cozy & comfy. Paid $9.95 per day for WiFi. We hope to return next year when FSU plays Boston College.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler47
Reviews.Content: Bostonian Millenium Hotel The BM Hotel in Boston is the perfect place to stay especially for first time visitors to the City. The hotel's location is a short walk to Fanieul Hall, the subway to go to Fenway Park, The freedom Trail,the North End for great Italian food, and the Harbour for fresh seafood. No need for a rent a car! There are dozens of small restaraunts and shops right around every corner. The Hotel itself is top shelf, very nice rooms, great service, and again, great location....I would highly recommend the BM to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: njoytravel3333
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! Stayed for one night with my boyfriend and enjoyed every minute of it. The location couldn't be any better. Walking distance to the North End, great bars and tons of shopping at Quincy Market. We found a great deal that included parking and breakfast! We really like being able to stand on the balcony and look out over the city. It was extremely clean and the staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sightseeing Location”
Reviews.Author: bglhvn
Reviews.Content: Located across street from huge Quincy Market with shops, restaurants, and an indoor 2 block-long food court. Try the macaroni and cheese with lobster. Hotel on block that the Freedom Trail crosses and if you can walk without difficulty, it is within easy distance of most historical sights. Room was comfortable with a separate room containing the closet with safe, dressing table, and access to the bathroom. Large walk-in shower. Easy to use thermostat kept room temperature just right; it was very hot and humid ouside and we always run the fan at night to block outside noise. Staff pleasant, especially the doormen who always opened the double set of doors for all guests. No problem at check-out removing beverage charges for the cans we moved out of the the small refrigerator to store our water. Don't like this setup, but it may be convenient for some guests since there isn't a lobby store to purchase beverages or snacks. Room wasn't ready for check-in, even after 6 p.m. arrival. Toilet not securely bolted to floor and rocked but didn't leak. Sliding bathroom pocket door wouldn't stay shut. Didn't hear noise from farmer's market being setup outside for Friday and Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have picked a better place.”
Reviews.Author: Firefighter4
Reviews.Content: Out the front door and across the street and I am in Fanuil Hall/Quincy Market Place. Two blocks in the other direction and I am in Bostons famous and historic "North End". First night had great meal on the waterfront, then fabulous italian the next. Walked to both places. Hotel was really nice, clean, and centrally located. Staff was wonderful. Only had evening drinks and breakfast in their restaurant and both were superb. Super comfy bed, very quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How About That Location!”
Reviews.Author: beau3636
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The Millennium Bostonian is a very nice, boutique-like hotel that sits in the middle of all the best Boston has to offer. The front door is literally a crosswalk away from Quincy Market and Fanueil Hall, and less than a 5 minute walk to The Aquarium and wharf. There are countless restaurants in the Italian district just up the street (next to Paul Revere's House) where we chose to dine on the recommendation of the concierge, who was professional, pleasant and helpful. Our room, number 518 was on the front side of the hotel overlooking the entrance court. The room was modern, clean and comfy with a quaint little balcony with doors that opened to let in the fresh air. It was a little noisy at night with late night revelers walking down the street just outside, but nothing unbearable. The room had a large flat screen that played the $13.95 movie-on-demand just perfectly (a new release no less, not even an adult). I guess in room movie prices have increased dramatically since I last ordered one. The only thing that disappointed me about this hotel was the "business center". When I inquired where to find it so I could buy Sox tickets online, I was directed to the second floor. Upon arriving, I found two pay-by-the-minute computers. Now, I was happy to have internet as I only needed a few minutes, but I found inserting dollar bills for internet access to be a touch Motel-6-esque. Not something I would expect from a resort that seemed to roll out the red carpet in every other department for each and every guest. All in all, I enjoyed this hotel and it served all of our needs very well. I found it to be about the right value and in line with the spendy cost of Boston at $209 (about $250 once all the taxes are included) per night. If I choose to drop into that part of town again, I will be more than happy to check into The Millennium Bostonian once again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: mootz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a trip to Boston for our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Finally decided upon the Millenium and thank heavens we did. Upon check-in I mentioned the reason for our visit, and would an room upgrade be possible, to which the reply was "yes". We were given a large, beautiful room with a working wood burning fireplace (yes, a real fireplace, not gas), unbelievable king bed, and the largest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel. After check-in we decided to walk around the city and upon our return we discovered a chilled bottle of champage, chocolate covered strawberries and a very thoughtful note from the staff. The hotel is in an excellent location across from Faneuil Hall and outstanding staff. We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: kelb
Reviews.Content: We spent a three day weekend at the Millenium last weekend, and had a wonderful time. I would say that the previous 6-8 reviews here are right on the money. We managed to score our room at the Millenium for $200/night which was a bargain considering the quality of the hotel and the amazing location. You could stay here and never use a car and have an amazing time in Boston. In fact, if you are interested in nightlife, you can have an amazing time here without venturing more than three blocks from the hotel! If you are willing to endure a ten minute walk to the North End, you will find a limitless array of great restaurants. The subway stop is right around the corner, and will take you to locations such as Harvard or the Charles River in a few minutes. We hold off the fifth star for the following reasons... - Friday night is just very noisy in this area. If you want serenity, go elsewhere. By the time the last partiers were winding down around 2:30 AM, the first vendors for the farmers market were arriving to set up their awnings for Saturday morning. The noises were non-stop all night long. So take ear plugs...what do you expect when you are in the middle of Boston fun? Saturday night was much more quiet since there is no market on Sunday. - We were advised to allow 20 - 30 minutes when requesting our car from valet parking, but a 45 minute wait on Saturday evening almost caused a missed dinner reservation. Also a request to check some packages overnight at the valet area caused way more trouble and confusion than should be necessary at a hotel of this quality. Everything else about this hotel was positive. We will return, and would find it hard to try any other hotel in Boston based on the wonderful time we enjoyed here. We also wanted to give a plug to the bar/restaurant in the hotel. Decent service, good food, and the prices are not cheap but certainly not out of line. We also found that the male host at the outdoor portion of the restaurant doubled as a superb concierge to help us decide where to go and what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: MM3_HartfordCT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with our 2 year old. Beautiful room, comfortable bed, spacious bath, clean and updated. We had a corner room with plenty of windows that overlooked the park and quincy market that kept my son busy any time we were in the room. Dunkin Donuts is right next door for a quick coffee or breakfast. We will most likely make this our regular hotel from now on for our Boston visits. There is a parking garage across the street, but we opted for valet ($42 per night) and was very happy with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston - everything is in walking distant from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurtlemomMiami
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough good things about this hotel, great location, great staff & great rooms. Hotel staff is friendly & willing to help you with any request. The lobby looks like a library, 2 walls full of books & art pieces with the feeling of a luxury living room. The rooms are decorated with modern style furniture, rooms are very quite, black-out curtain are really black-out, AC works superbly & the bathroom is spacious with a wonderful shower. By the way, they also have the yummiest pillows, comforter & mattress that you could every ask for. And most important, everything is in walking distant from this hotel:

Reviews.Title: “The best I ever stayed in....”
Reviews.Author: Stevo49
Reviews.Content: This place is it - it's right across from Fanueil Hall and it's easy to just walk out and check out the shops, and great bars and restaurants at Fanueil Hall. It's also easy to catch a taxi to anywhere. The staff are so awesome and helpful from the doormen to the front desk staff. The feel of the hotel is like a posh coffee house in the lobby area. They have a fireplace and there were a whole bunch of coffee table books which makes it nice to sit in the lobby and read while sipping coffee. I love music and there were some great books on classic rock which I read for a few hours while just enjoying the warm lighting and homely feel of the lobby area. The rooms were spacious, well kept and clean. There was a flat screen TV, and the bathroom was quite large and had recess lighting. I also found the cool powder-area cool and I have not seen this in other hotels. I would always stay here - I like the feel of the staff, the room and the area. Also as an added bonus - North 26 - the restaurant is awesome. Great martinis and the waiter remembered me. The breakfast is quite expensive, but it's the best I've had in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: agbbrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights. Our room was very clean. Very nice modern decor. We were very comfortable there and the location was fantastic. Across from Quincy market. What was even better was how close we were to the North End (little Italy). So many restuarants and pastry shops. Close to parks with water features. We would go back to this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: alyth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, and it is a relatively easy walk to the harbour, Boston Common and most of the historical sites. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby. Rooms are a good size, are very comfortable and with all the facilities you would expect. Large bathroom with excellent shower. Efficient and friendly staff. If you are looking for a base to explore the city this is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Rooms - Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: M0mfr0mMI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, was in a great location, safe neighborhood, close to the waterfront, next to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market. The rooms are nicely decorated. We had a room with two double beds and very uncomfortable mattresses. The front desk folks were helpful. Check your final room charges -- if you move a beverage in the in-room fridge, you'll be charged for it. We were allowed to leave our luggage with the bellhops after we checked out so that we could see a bit more of Boston before it was time to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay....”
Reviews.Author: AllieB27502
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just across the street from Quincy Market and Fanuiel Hall. The T is a short walk away which was important to us. It is very close to the North End and all the fabulous restaurants. Our room was a double and very spacious. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, staff most courteous, but noisy on street side”
Reviews.Author: BermudaMom1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Wednesday and Thursday night. Room very nice, clean and comfortable. Very much like that in addition to the typical duvet there is also a top bed sheet as I hate the weight of a duvet and some hotels I've recently stayed in only use a bottom sheet and duvet. The room was on the third floor street side. There was a problem with a knocking sound from the A/C which was a nuisance at night. It was hot in Boston and so needed A/C. Ended up chilling the room down then turning it off. When room heated up after a few hours, turned it on for about 10 minutes till it was cool enough to sleep again, and so on through the night. Spoke to the hotel staff early the next evening when I got back to the hotel after work and they sent someone to see to it. He said he knew right away what the problem was and that I needed to move the wall control from auto to just "on" for about an hour and that would fix it. Was skeptical but don't like to make a fuss. But, same problem. Just gave up and did the on off thing. Then, around 2:30am there was a lot of noise outside with some guys shouting, things scraping across the road, "beep beeps" from trucks backing up and so on. Had a look out and right below they were setting up canopies and unloading crates from trucks. This went on till after 4:30am and it was impossible to sleep. I asked the receptionist in the morning what this was and it seems there is a farmer's market or something setup during the night on the sidewalk for Fridays. Not sure what months this occurs. To summarize, nice hotel and yes, I would definitely recommend staying there. Location is wonderful. But, check the A/C and ask for a room away from road side if you are there on a Thursday night!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: pennsbury9230
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in until we departed we were treated warmly by friendly,courteous staff. The room was excellent, comfortable, clean and well maintained. This hotel is convenient to everywhere in boston. You really do not need a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - NO air conditioning - terrible service”
Reviews.Author: LNG
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and the recent updating is beautiful. Rooms are small - beds are very comfortable. We did not have working air conditioning in the room. We called immediately upon check-in and were instructed to reset the AC, which we did. Upon returning from dinner, the room was still hot - this time the hotel sent up what appeared to be a bellman who did nothing more adjust the thermostat as we had done previously. A 4:45 AM call yielded no help and no offer of a different room or even a fan. Finally, after a night of no sleep, we went to the front desk. They denied any knowledge of any of the 3 previous calls but said they were full so there was no room to move us. Finally, a day after reporting the problem the first time, a repair man was sent and he opened the master unit and found and repaired the problem. Hotel offered free drinks and finally, $50 off. Too little, too late as a night of no sleep ruined the weekend. We checked out. Most disturbing was the total lack of concern on the part of the employees and the failure to track the problem after it was reported. It appears we were just "blown off".

Reviews.Title: “How I wish I could have slept in...”
Reviews.Author: Pulpo_Grande
Reviews.Content: With an early morning flight, I needed a place to stay in Boston on my return home from the Cape. The Millennium had one of the best rates for this caliber of hotel in downtown Boston and the bed made me wish I could have slept in till noon vs. getting up at 4:30 a.m. to go to the airport. It has to have been one of the most comfortable beds I've ever been in with soft, gorgeous linens. The staff was helpful and nice and the location was great to walk over to the North End for dinner. The only thing I can even think to criticize is that there was a charge for the wi-fi (didn't want to pay $10 just to check in for my flight) but otherwise, everything was great. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: jp1040
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with our daughter and granddaughter for six nights during the week of July 4. We couldn't have been more pleased with the rooms and service. There was a problem with our air conditioning when we checked in and we were immediately moved to another room to solve the problem. The restaurant is excellent and a good value for the location and quality of the hotel. Service was especially personal and helpful at breakfast. For tourists the location is hard to beat. This hotel is a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for tourists”
Reviews.Author: watso2jl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights over the 4 th of July! Perfect location, clean, good service! There is no need to stay anywhere else. Look for a great deal on priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brayball
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at the Bostonian (19 years ago, 14 years ago and then last month). The hotel service was perfect - front desk very helpful, restaurant/bar staff were friendly and housekeeping did a great job. The Bostonian is in a perfect location across the street from Quincy market and about a block to the wharf and a short walk to the north end. We thoroughly loved the hotel. It was a very relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunseeker22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel primarily because of its location. The hotel is central and within easy walking distance of most of the main attractions. The location of the room within the hotel will determine the quality of your experience as some are noisy and others are very dark - suggets that you look at a room before accepting it and negotiate if necessary for a room with a better location. The restaurant is pricey and OK however as Boston has so many great places to eat would suggest that you give this a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Infomaniac_1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel mainly due to its location. There are many restaurants nearby, plus Quincy Market, and many more to choose from within walking distance. The staff - front desk, concierge, bell, bar and restaurant - were very pleasant and helpful and the service was very good. The food in the restaurant, North26, was excellent. We ate breakfast and lunch there at some points during our stay. Our room was quite spacious, though the closet was very small and directly to the left, at right angles, of the bathroom door. Directly to the right, and opposite the closet, was a small table with a lamp and a stool - presumably for make-up etc. The problem was that anyone wanting to go into or out of the bathroom couldn't get past if someone was sitting on the stool or getting something out of/putting into the closet. A very poor design, in my opinion. The safe in the closet was so high up you couldn't see what was in there and anyone who is short would have to stand on a chair to open and close it. The large shower head was excellent, but there were no grab bars and the bath ws fairly slippery - a potential danger for those who have physical disabilities. I was not too happy about all the extra charges made for services which many comparable Boston hotels provide as standard - e.g. charging $9.95 per night for internet/wi-fi access, $4 for 10 minutes computer time in the business center, and $20 for a refrigerator in our room. Having taken the wi-fi package the service was very unreliable, disappearing and re-appearing with frustrating regularlty. The front desk did what they could to help, as did the engineer, but it didn't improve. They gave me a phone number to call for more advice, but it was constantly busy and I gave up after a while. Our room overlooked a narrow alleyway, and the noise from the market place just across the street was quite loud during the day, and at night it was noisy from people walking through the alleyway. I much prefer the Back Bay area and don't feel inclined to return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with comfort”
Reviews.Author: conniefarmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Hotel overlooks Quincy Market & Faneuil Hall. Always lots of activity in the area (including live music), but noise did not affect our stay. Food court in Quincy Market was good for breakfast and lunch, but there are many great restaurants in the area for dinner. Just about everything was w/in walking distance. Took the very clean T (only a 5 min walk) to Fenway. Hotel bed was sooooo comfortable. Staff very pleasant. Valet parking was $$$, but worth it. We didn't need our car. Walk towards the government center, but make a right at the first intersection for some amazing Irish pubs. We will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rottieluver
Reviews.Content: Had three nights lodging. The checkin was easy and staff was nice. The floor plan was twisting and confusing. The room faced another building with no view. We carted all our luggage out of the cab without help while the staff fell all over the people in the Mercedes and Lexuses. Room was very small. The dust behind the covering for the heater was at least 1/2 inch thick. The tub was 24in high and 9 in wide without any grab bars. Would be impossible for someone elderly or with orthopedic problems to get in to. You can stand up from the toilet and look in the mirror. Showerhead was loose and had water all over. Toilet paper holder fell off wall. Safe in closet about 7 feet up and not user friendly. The location is outstanding....that is the only positive thing about the hotel. When the farmers market on the side street was done, it was filthy and smelly with rotting veggies in the gutter. There are other hotels close by the are less expensive withi a couple of blocks of Fanueil Hall. No complimentary business center but can print out boarding passes. Avoid the Millenium!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly dissappointed with the this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hsfhu
Reviews.Content: First the Pro's. The location is excellent, outside you are a short walk away from restaurants and key sites, we left the hotel and had no issues finding the freedom trail which is a bit of history any newcomer to Boston shouldn't miss. We loved that there are several restaurants nearby so you're not wandering confused, and hotel itself is decorated beautifully, even the rooms. The Con's. We only stayed two nights, but found it rather uncomfortable. The fire alarm went off twice, once during a downpour, and the other time right before we headed to bed, I think around 10-11ish. The message on the alarm said to take the fire exit and walk down, but then a live person came on and told us to stay where we were while they figured out what the cause of the alarm was. I don't know about anyone else, but I've always been taught that when a fire alarm goes off, you leave the building. It was disappointing, so much so that people were just standing in the hallways confused. In addition, the first morning there, We stopped off at the front desk to grab a map. The receptionist was helping someone in front of me, which we understand, but then a group came in to check in, and rather than help us, she finished up helping her customer and turned to the new check-ins. I don't know about service but we waited about 5 - 10 mins. Finally we got so annoyed, I had to step in and tell her that we had been waiting before them. For a morning where only one person was at the front desk to help and only one person was in line, I figure she wouldn't think we were standing at the front desk for fun. Lastly, the wireless internet which was working for us for about an hour decided to cut off, the maintenance person came up, and unplugged and replugged a few wires and when that didn't work they told us to call tech support. Tech support couldn't figure out what was wrong so no wireless. They didn't charge us for the wireless, but when we look for a hotel one of the requirements is wireless. We had a 3rd day's stay but rather than rebook here, we went elsewhere. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: wrongwy
Reviews.Content: We needed an extra night stay in Boston near Freedom Trail and liked the location. We loved it. Front staff was friendly and helpful. Room amenities are top notch. Shower was gorgeous. Bathroom was immaculate. Bed was comfortable and everything felt new and fresh - no stale smoke smell anywhere. We had to sign a no smoking agreement. Room layout user friendly. Especially loved desk and nightstand lamps which had on/off switch AND two electric outlets on the base to plug in your laptop or cellphone. The room overlooked the lively square so there was some local entertainment noise but that drifted away as the night ended. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Usually Hit - Sometimes Miss”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times over the past few years. It often has very good promotions and packages available which justify the relative cost of this (as well as any Boston) hotel. And the staff has always been top notch, making the service component of the visit quite good. But the infrastructure and maze-like design of the hotel is a challenge which seems to lead to inconsistency in room attractiveness. This last trip, I was given an "upgraded" room on the fourth floor with a nice view of the marketplace and a fireplace (in May???); I didn't get to the room until late in the evening and then found that its geometry was such that its king bed took up most of the entryway, and the tucked way bathroom (very nice) was designed so that it also included the clothing closet (odd). But the real issue arose when the HVAC system turned on. It was binary, either on or off, so no adjustment in fan speed was possible, and when running it sounded like a small aircraft was operating in the room. To worsen matters, the placement of the vents produced vast torrents of air which you couldn't escape given the room configuration and the crammed bed placement put your head within three feet of the noisiest component. I was forced to turn the system off, crack the patio doors to get some fresh air, and listen to the sounds of Boston through the night and early morning. Given the time of arrival and the sold-out status of the hotel (and city), I didn't try to change the room, but would have been more than happy to revert to the standard room I'd booked and stayed in and enjoyed previously. Message here: if possible, see your room early and be sure it works for you. OTOH, there's so much going on in the city that your room time should be minimal....

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Celebrate Your Birthday”
Reviews.Author: JAEK
Reviews.Content: Since I am becoming an old codger, ones birthdays take on more significance. I chose the Millennium Bostonian for this special weekend. Another couple joined us for three days at this Gem of a Hotel. From the moment we arrived we were treated as special guests. They allowed us into our upgraded rooms early. They even provided free of charge a nice bottle of Sparkling Wind from Spain as a gift to me, chilled and ready for us when we returned from shopping. The desk staff is SUPER, with Carmen and Valeria providing directions, information and even doing our airline boarding sign in for free, printing out our boarding passes. Each person, from the doorman to the waitresses in the "26 North Bar and Restaurant" attached greeted us daily, checked if we needed anything, went out of their way to assist us. The rooms were immaculate and recently refurbished. We had a fireplace in our room and a BIG plasma TV. The beds are great, and clean. The bathrooms are terrific, rain shower head, with wand and nice toiletries. They even have an umbrella in each room. This hotel is right at the action, with Faniel Hall, Quincy Market, Aquarium, Boat Tours and the famous Hanover Street eateries. This hotel is near the T stops you need and it is only 2 miles from the airport, a cheap cab ride and a cheaper $2 T ride. I have stayed at, at least 6 other hotels, from the Copley Area to the Parker House to the Long Whart,....THIS IS THE HOTEL.... Priced right and the stay and the food are excellent. I will return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for first time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wifey21
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good about this hotel, we had a wonderful time in Boston and this hotel helped make that happen. We came up on amtrak so we did not have to worry about parking but needed help navigating the city, no problem, we were given maps , directions and even a printed card with directions for getting to Fenway the day of the game. The location is ideal for seeing and doing all traditional Boston highlights. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again myself

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sarcar345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium with a girlfriend who has a 9 month old. The hotel could not be in a better location. Every single staffer, from the doorman to the concierge were incdedibly helpful, accommodating and polite. There were no hidden costs and the rooms were clean and spacious. Definitely a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love with the Millenium Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Helloooooo
Reviews.Content: After having a few cocktails at Durgin Park at lunch and having so much fun we decided on the spur of the moment to spend the night in Boston and walked over to the Millenium totally expecting to hear them say they were sold out as it was Valentine's Day weekend. We were soooo excited to hear they had rooms and promptly checked-in. The location is perfect. Our room overlooked the Hard Rock Cafe. The lobby was beautiful with a very cozy fireplace and comfy chairs. The room was spotless and very very nice. The bed was huge, great TV, sitting area located outside the bathroom. I went down to the hotel bar at North 26 and had an awesome bloody Mary that Rick the bartender made. He was a great conversationalist so I stayed for a couple of more beers and tried the lobster deviled eggs that were very tasty. The bar menu has several $5 munchies on it that all sounded wonderful. Room service on Sunday morning was very prompt and Floyd was very courteous and friendly when he delivered it right on time. It was presented very nice and had a fresh flower on the tray. I never thought I'd stray away from our usual Kimpton Boston stays, but Millenium you rock!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SueLeeT
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!! Room and bathroom were spotless & bed was very luxurious and comfortable. Very quiet hotel, too. North 26 (on site restaurant) is WONDERFUL!!! I promise, this is NOT your typical hotel restaurant - breakfast was heavenly! Perfect location for Fanueil Hall & Quincy Market (directly across the street), Freedom Trail, Aquarium, etc ~ all within a 5 minute walk. Hard Rock Cafe is next door with a parking garage above with reasonable rates. (Hotel does have it's own valet service as well, if you choose.) Plenty of restaurants, shopping and history nearby. Excellent choice when staying in Boston!!! I'd give more stars if I could!! Only one disappointment though ~ no free WIFI ~ $9.95 per day, per laptop!! That was unexpected and annoying, but even so, we still give it 5 stars - truly great place!!

Reviews.Title: “The very best location for North End and Quincy Market; Very friendly, top-notch service.”
Reviews.Author: NuffSed
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Stayed here for two weekend nights in early Feb. because we wanted to tromp the Northend restaurants, Quincy Market and the Freedom Trail . This is far and away the most convenient location for that. The rate was very competitive, the service was so friendly we couldn't believe we were in Beantown, the room was very nicely appointed in a contemporary style, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Nice fireplace and seating area in the lobby, where they serve hot cider in the afternoon and good coffee in the A.M., also complimentary Globe and Times. Our major gripe was that the Haymarket sidewalk produce vendors, which are adjacent to the hotel, leave a mess on the street, both during and after their sales hours. However, being next to the vendors afforded a fantastic people-watching experience and a chance to grab some great buys on fruit for our breakfast in bed. It is real slice of city life to see the locals stopping by the stalls on their way home. Other than that, our only gripe was that the hallways were too chilly, partly because of the large windows and because the temp was set too low for comfort in frosty February. As an added plus, the North 23 Restaurant was superb for dinner. All in all, this is a very fine hotel to stay in if you want a great North End experience and want to see a bit of how this part of Boston really used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravelnyc
Reviews.Content: I usually try to stay at a Marriott or Hilton to rack up my points, but their rates were just way too much for my few nights. an agent at Quikbook.com suggested I try this hotel because it is one of their top booked hotels in the city. I was not to pleased that they did not offer complimentary internet or even a little breakfast, but I was very satisfied with my location and the room. I had an amazing view of Faneuil Hall, and a lot of space for just one person. I really liked that I was also close to the T, I was able to navigate the city fairly easy and the staff was very helpful with my restaurant choices. Overall, I think it was well worth the rate I got, and I would consider staying in another Millenium Property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jayemcee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in this hotel because it was recommended by friends. We were not disappointed. Good location, nice rooms and very good staff. It was our first visit to Boston and after a couple of days we would have liked to have stayed longer. We intend to return to this city and will probably return to the Millenium Bostonian.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a really warm welcome.Kind and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MilanoRoberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights in this excellent hotel.We had a very warm welcome and helpful adivices about our staying.The King Superior room was extremely comfortable with a romantic view on the market place.Very good position in the historic town.Everything was working and the cleanliness was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill . . .”
Reviews.Author: flhexe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel more than a month before our stay in Boston. I selected it for its location next to Faneuil Hall Marketplace and North Station. I made the reservation on the hotel's website and pre-paid the etire amount in order to receive a specific rate. The room was clean and the bathroom well stocked. It was very cold but the temperature did not increase even upon resetting the thermometer. The location is directly across from Quincy Market. However upon checking out, the front desk attempted to increase the price for the room. We pointed out that we had pre-paid the full amount and they could not increase the rate at this time. The front desk agreed and did not charge us. A week later, a charge showed up on our credit card for the increased rate. Again we called and explained we had pre-paid the ENTIRE AMOUNT and that there should be no additional charges. After a few minutes, the situation was resolved with the amount being removed from our credit card, however it left a bitter taste - once is a mistake, twice is not. There are too many good hotels in Boston for this to occur twice.

Reviews.Title: “A warm hotel for our COLD stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: gre345
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great staff that was wonderful enough to change our room to the Quincy Mkt view; take care of all requests that we had (nothing unreasonable but done with efficiency); housekeeping was out of site our whole trip! Location is great and the rooms were nicely renovated. We had breakfast once at North 26 - very good. Cons: The flagpole outside our room made noises all night long! Granted it was a windy Boston night but management should think of coating the metal pieces. I can't imagine we are the first to have experienced this. Front desk seemed to shrug it off and we didn't get the impression it would be mentioned to mgmt. Wifi - there's no reason for this to be an extra cost Overall, a great hotel that we would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY, RENOS ARE AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: canuckpump
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, staff and service were wonderful, wtih the exception of one older parking grinch. Renos are amazing and the location is second to none. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite...”
Reviews.Author: The_Lost_Continent
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week. The hotel is nice, it's very smart and has been recently renovated. Negatives: The fire alarm went off three times during my stay. Although I was told to stay put by the speak system, it was a bit unsettling. Housekeeping seemed to want to clean my room at 8.30am which I found a tad early - not that I wanted to lie-in all morning in such a wonderful city, I just felt pressured to get out of the room. The internet is ridiculously expensive. Most hotels have complimentary WIFI now. $10 a day is too much. Positives: nice modern rooms. Overall I would recommend the Harborside Inn (better value and free WIFI) and the Charlesmark (better value and much better location).

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: lgalio17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 5th trip to Boston. We have always stayed at one of the big hotels on the harbor but decided to give the Millennium a try since we were going to be spending time in the North End exclusively. Well, talk about a great location! It was perfect - actually convenient to everything, but it is the understated elegance and exceptional service that sets this hotel apart from the rest. The door/bell staff especially seem to take great pride in ensuring their guests leave with a good impression of Boston and of their hotel. Needless to say we will always book our stay at the Millennium on future trips to the beautiful and friendly city of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Was That Stogie Stench in Our Room?”
Reviews.Author: travelsnoop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights for our anniversary. Upon entering our room, we were greeted by a funky, what-the-heck-is-that smell, prompting some quick window-opening maneuvers. After looking at each other, noses crinkled and grimacing, we decided to call the front desk to request another room, preferably one without an offensive odor. The apologetic guest services rep called a short time later and offered to upgrade us if we were willing to move to a lower floor. I booked an upper-floor room after reading in my trusty travel guide that this area of the city might have some lingering construction going on, and an upper floor would be more quiet. Of course we jumped at the better room, which had a little balcony and overlooked Faneuil Hall, rather than a dreary back street. The rep personally showed us to our superior, pleasant-smelling room and opened the curtains to expose a lovely view of the twinkling lights around Quincy Market. Ahh....much better! I do want to warn the light sleepers out there that this was not a quiet room. Haymarket, a bustling outdoor marketplace, is directly outside the hotel, is open Friday and Saturday, and vendors set up their stands well before dawn. That said, the location of this hotel is hard to beat; it is convenient to all parts of the city and adjacent to the shops and restaurants of Quincy Market. This is a boutique hotel so don't expect to have employees fawning all over you. The staff that is present is efficient and cordial. We only came into contact with doormen and the front desk clerk. That was fine with us. Oh, I almost forgot. The fire alarm went off late one afternoon as I had just pried the shoes off my Freedom-Trail-weary feet. A recording told us to stay put until further notice, saving us from hobbling out into the street, now filled with fire engines. I downgraded the cleanliness based on the funky smell in our first room and my husband's discovery of some crud on the down comforter in the second. Otherwise, it was very clean and housekeeping kept our room tidy, replenishing everything each day. Concerning value, my husband commented he has stayed in nicer Hilton Garden Inns and Marriott Courtyards. Frommer's rates this hotel two stars in the "very expensive" category. Expensive, yes, but it does not measure up to Four Seasons or Fairmont hotels. Finally, we found it interesting that there was a cigar bar located seven floors below our original room. Is it possible the acrid stench of stogies could permeate the walls and waft up seven floors?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Skibsted
Reviews.Content: Great location and the hotel itself was nice too. Clean rooms and friendly staff. You cant beat the location. Close to everything. I liked the hot Cider in the afternoon at the lobby. However I just cant seem to accept the fact that internet is 10 dollars per day! Even internet in the lobby was expensive. A hotel in this price range should have free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: khvenable
Reviews.Content: We are from Louisiana and neither of us had ever been to Boston. We had no idea where to stay. For the first time our room looked exactly like the internet pics. We were in room 535. It was beautiful and extremely clean. The view we had was of Faneuil Hall. The Millennium Bostonian is not far from the airport and is at the center of everything. I will be back for another visit to Boston, and I would not even dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium was the best choice we could make!”
Reviews.Author: trippk
Reviews.Content: After reading many hotel reviews here, I decided to book at the Millennium Bostonian. It was the perfect choice! We stayed Saturday to Monday and had a great time. With Quincy Marketplace across the street, numerous pubs within a block and the North End a short few blocks, we were able to walk everywhere anytime of the day or night. The hotel itself was great - clean, well appointed, friendly staff, very nice rooms (loved the huge shower and comfortable bed). I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 82ed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last weekend and found the location and the service excellent. People were helpful and friendly, they seemed to really like their jobs. If you are interested in North End restaurants, this is the place for your. But it is also on the Freedom Trail, Quincy Market etc. My only complaint is that they needed to provide FREE INTERNET service in the lobby. They are nickel and diming their customers for no good reason!!

Reviews.Title: “Bags stolen. No apology from hotel.”
Reviews.Author: movemovemove
Reviews.Content: What would otherwise have been a good stay turned into a nightmare when I realized that $400 worth of shopping was stolen from my valet parked car. I was encouraged to leave my car in valet parking by the door man who said paying $40 per night was worth it because of the safety factor. I parked it with them over 2 nights $80). After we checked out and loaded up our car we drove off not even thinking to check through our stuff in the car. Only when we arrived at the next destination a couple hours away did we realize that the bags had been pinched. I was apalled that even after alerting the hotel they provided no apology and totally feeble compensation. They did not even offer to take off the cost of the parking. Their solution was to fob me off to the valet company and leave them to solve it..... I was shocked at the Bostonian's unprofessionalism and careless manner dealing with this. Thumbs down! You would never find this at a true world class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Lovely Property, Small Rooms, High Price”
Reviews.Author: bryanwyoung
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, and the property itself was lovely. The staff was typically solicitous and helpful, but were kind enough to get out of the way when I didn't want a bellman. The view from the room was fantastic, the bathroom and guest room were top notch, if a bit small. I did find it galling to pay $10 per night for Wi-Fi when I had already spent $350 on the room for one night, but so be it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lots of character”
Reviews.Author: ariuna001
Reviews.Content: For a chain hotel, we expected it to be nice, but a bit of a cookie cutter experience. Quite the opposite - it was lovely, with lots of character. Gorgeous lobby, really friendly and helpful staff, perfectly equipped room. The location is very convenient as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fascinating City”
Reviews.Author: DBueche
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights at the Millennium Bostonian Hotel, located adjacent to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market.. Can't beat the outstanding location. The room was spacious and marvelously appointed. We had an early check-in and late check out, a real plus. Super staff, very quiet and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: kudieball
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of the action. Rooms are big and brand new! I searched all the 4 star hotels in the city and this one had the best rate with the most to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: chuggerbuff
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with this place. The location is ideal, right next to all the markets in the centre of town. The room we had on the 7th floor had a balcony with great views of the city scape and was very spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff were very helpful and welcoming. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it. Location is the only thing it offers. Try the Marriott Wharf instead.”
Reviews.Author: NDakotaQueen
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in the circular courtyard for valet service. The wait was long. My wife unloaded the luggage and began to make her way to the door (she tired of sitting the in the car.) The valet approached her as she neared the door and in a rather rude tone, asked her if she was checking in. Thought it rather obvious suitcases in tow, heading for the door and she had just exited the car in line for valet service. Finally the valet came for the car, there was no assistance with baggage, the door, etc. My wife then noted that as we were heading through the door our car had been left running with the drivers door wide open and no valet near it at all. I was traveling with sensitive work items and spoke to the valet that the car was to be parked and locked, not left open and running with no one near by. (The street with people is only a glance away and anyone could have entered, hopped in and left with the car.) We paid the additional fee for an upgraded room (meaning step out balcony). We had requested it overlook F.H. however we were placed on the side that overlooked the North End. Okay, we could deal with that, but.... and this is the big but, directly below our step out was what appeared to be a shanty town (a farmers market apparently in disquise.) It did however look like a shanty town, trash from the fruit/vegetables all over, torn tarps, ropes and pieces of plywood abound. Not to the mention the individuals who decided to setup another "spot" at one in the morning banging and clanking around. The worst part of this however was the rats that we could see darting in and out. Yes I said RATS! Absolutely disgusting. The service was non-existant at this hotel, the valet service was rude, a doorman was no where to be found, nor was a bellhop to assist with the bags. A complete disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again anytime”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBex
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, we were right in the middle of the Sunday market, and the staff were courteous and helpful. The rooms are well fitted out and very comfortable. The room we checked into was very noisy (not their fault) and they moved us to another room straight away. After checkout there was a problem with the bill (charges to our account that we didn't incur) and the hotel corrected those very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff, NOT for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: NYCween
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Boston on business and had the misfortune of being placed in this hotel. Although it is in a good location for touring Boston, it is not convenient to the financial district. The rooms are semi-spacious, and well designed.
