However, what the hotel really lacks is knowledgeable and helpful staff with any understanding of customer service. The staff refused to book cars to the airport (had to wait 30 min. for a taxi), made egregious mistakes on my bill and were outright hostile when I had to ask for assistance because my room key didnâ€™t work. Also, the neighborhood immediately around the hotel takes a seedy turn at nightâ€”I wasnâ€™t entirely comfortable walking around on my own. Needless to say, I will never return to this hotel and donâ€™t recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: bwings2000
Reviews.Content: The upgrades done in this hotel recently were great. The bathroom had the spa fell like you might see on HGTV, only smaller. We found the room to be very clean and comfortable. Our only complaint was that they charged to use the PC in the lobby. It ended up costing me at least $18 just to check in and print my airline boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: kif8skip
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel , in a excellent location in old Boston......... The hotel was clean , modern and comfortable - the staff were awesome and every request was met with a smile and a YES WE CAN ........... We loved the room which was roomy and clean - the view was great and with Faneuil Hall across the street you cannot go wrong. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a good hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: miapia
Reviews.Content: My brother and his wife, and my husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Bostonian on our first trip to Boston. The hotel is nicely located between three T stops. We were able to visit Fenway, the Sam Adams Brewery and other sites without walking too far to a stop or having to transfer. Our rooms were beautiful and always clean. The concierge, John, was very helpful with any questions we had and was always ready with a map or a suggestion. Many of the great Boston restaurants are within a few blocks. The North End is a short 6 blocks away. We are going back and plan to stay at the Bostonian again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: MissNJTravels
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading the reviews of the hotels I was expecting a lot. Well needless to say that hotel definietly lived up to all the great reviews I read. I am hoping to get back to Boston and I will DEFINIETLY be staying at this hotel. Everything from the shower to the decor is awesome. The hotel is literally in the middle of everything, food, shopping, parks, waterfront, aquarium, you name it and it's probably right around the corner or across the street. My mom and I walked everywhere and were never to far from the hotel. I was a little worried that come bed time it would be really loud since it's right smack in the middle of downtown. But it wasn't at all. I definietly recommend this hotel. It's the perfect place for solo travelers as well as a families. As for what the room looks like, it literally looks like the pictures online. Needless to say, I was impressed and so was my mom.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Sand55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millennium Bostonian in August,2009. The hotel gave us a free upgrade, to a front 4th floor room with a balcony. On arrival we were greeted by very friendly staff,all ready and willing to help with anything. They were polite,happy,and helpful. Every time we entered or left the hotel at least one or sometimes 2 doormen opened the doors ready for us. The reception desk was faultless, and efficient. The hotel was clean,and the daily cleaner even watered the flowers in the window box on the balcony. Our room overlooked the front,being feneuil hall,and quincy market. We could actually see the street performers from our room. The trees lit up at night and looked wonderful. Yes, we could here a " little " street noise,but this just added to the embience of the area. I must stress LITTLE noise. The hotel has recently been renovated and therefore it was all nicely decorated etc. The possition of the hotel is very good. ( As are many hotels in Boston ). As Boston is quite compact it is easy to get to anywhere. The T station is close by, and we used Haymarket stop regularly. There are others close by. McDonalds,Dunkin Donuts, Cheers replica bar ( there are 2 here ),and many more eating places are around. It is just a very short walk to the wharf for whale watching tours ( we did this - EXCELLENT ) the aquarium ,and other attractions. I would give the hotel 9/10

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Sun Deck”
Reviews.Author: Andrew029
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a couple of nights to relax between consecutive business trips. Hotel was perfect location for the tourist as it is across the street from Faneuil Hall market which seems to be the hub of tourist hot spots for drinks, meals and oddities in the small market style shops. Really helpful and knowledgeable bar staff (on drinks, food and Boston) too which impressed me. He gave me some tips of where to go and what to see during my brief stay. The shopping street with Macy's dept store is a short walk as is the water front... in fact I walked most of Boston center happily. Tip for a cheap and early breakfast was a few fast food places within a few hundred meters, coffee and Danish or Mc Muffin etc. Also check out the sun deck they have, I spent hours just sitting taking in the sounds of the city while relaxing with a few beers, which the bar bought up to me! It was so empty there except the odd person having a quick smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service with room assignment (nearly got stuck with air mattress!) and rude manager”
Reviews.Author: lafam
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage daughter We stayed here for 5 nights from August 6 2009. I found a great $159 deal on Travelzoo for a "superior" room with a balcony, and booked a room for 9 nights through Millennium's website. I specifically mentioned that I would need a rollaway for my daughter, and noted that there was no fine print about cancellation fees or charge for a rollaway. After making the reservation,. I called the hotel a couple times to inquire about any such fees. I was told by a pleasant woman that usually there was a fee (I think $25) for a rollaway but I could probably negotiate that with the manager when I arrived. When I later spoke to a manager if I could still have the $159 rate if I left for a couple days (to go to Cape Cod) and returned, he rudely told me that he would "not advise" my leaving the hotel and returning. Only after I pushed him further on the fact that the promotional fine print didn't say anything about fees for modifying the reservation did he agree I could have the same rate upon my return. On the date of my arrival, I called the hotel from the airport in LA to tell them we would be arriving around midnight late and make sure they would have a rollaway I got stuck with the same manager (easily recognizable due to his British accent). He put me on hold, sounded like I was bothering him and basically just said my reservation was on file. About 7 hours later, when we were checking in, the front desk clerk spent a long time saying they were short on the type of room that I was entitled to and which could fit a rollaway. It turned out that the rude manager was standing next to the clerk (I recognized his voice and accent). I politely addressed the manager, reminded him of our earlier conversations, including my call from the LA airport. Not only did he refuse to acknowledge our conversations or even say the customary "Welcome to our hotel" greeting, he just gave me a dirty look and failed to assist in the booking. Eventually, the clerk found a "junior suite" for us, warning that this was only for the first couple nights and that we would have to move to another room on the third day. When I was asked to sign the registration papers, I noticed there was a $50 "early departure" charge as I had told them I was leaving after 5 days. I then had to argue with the clerk to say the fine print on the reservation email and also the manager had said nothing about such a fee. He then finally took the fee off. The "junior suite" was nice and clean, but not really a suite. It was very clean and had a sitting area with a fireplace. The bathroom had a great shower and separate tub. The only problem with the room was lack of drawers for storing your clothes and not enough towel racks. As others on this forum have pointed out, the electronically wired mini-fridge (with usual outrageous charges) made it impossible to store your own drinks as just moving something would result in a room charge. We were lucky our room was very quiet as it faced an internal courtyard and not the side with the weekend outdoor marketplace. On the morning of the third day, we were told by the front desk clerk we would be moved to a different room. Later that afternoon, when we returned, we found that our new room had a king size bed but no rollaway. It also had no balcony, which we were supposed to get. I was willing to forego the balcony but called the front desk to ask for a rollaway. After some time, Housekeeping called to say they were looking for a rollaway but if they could not find out, we might have to get a "specially made" bed. I had no idea what that meant. I called the manager on duty (luckily not the rude guy). This manager was pleasant but then delivered the stunning news that we might end up with an air mattress as they had no rollaways. I told him that would not be acceptable and they needed to find a room with 2 queens or possible give us a second room. I questioned why they would have taken away the rollaway as we had already stayed there 2 nights and they knew we would need one for the next 3 days. He said he would work on it and call right back but didn't. After an hour, we stopped by the front desk to talk to him in person. He was very polite, professional and pleasant but told us they were now looking to borrow a rollaway from a nearby Marriott but had to find a van first. If not, we were going to be stuck with the air mattress. I told him that in all of my 25 years of business and vacation travel in hotels around the world, I had never heard of a hotel making a guest sleep on an air mattress. He acknowledged this but said that the hotel had no other spare room (hard to believe, in this economy, that any hotel has 100% occupancy....).Since we needed to go out for dinner, I gave him my cell phone number, and told him to call with an update. Throughout dinner, we did not hear from him and had no idea what the hotel was going to do. When we got back, we were so relieved to find a rollaway in the room. Although some people might say, "all's well that ends well", this whole thing definitely put a big damper on our stay. I did complain about this on the hotel's questionnaire and got an email apology but nothing more - such as discount coupon for future, etc. which I have received from another leading chain when I complained about something minor once. After we returned from Cape Cod, we stayed at the Copley Square Courtyard by Marriott and had a much more pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: notsofrosty
Reviews.Content: We ultimately chose this hotel, over some 5 stars, because of two reasons, its great location and its recent (under a year) complete renovation. The location is amazing. It's literally across the street from Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market and right in the middle of the Freedom Trail. The North End and wharfs are just a short walk away. And the nearby subway station (Gov't Center) makes the rest of Boston easily accessible. The new decor is stylish and room is extremely clean. The large bed, luxury Italian Frette linens and German Grohe fixtures definitely make a difference. The bathroom was spacious and has its own dressing room (which does take some space away from the main room). We did not have a tub (which may be an issue for some) but I found it marvelous. The shower is tiled in beige marble, has a seamless glass enclosure (no gross shower curtain) and a rain-style shower head with a separate handheld. We had a 5th floor balcony with an amazing view of Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall. Note that this is a large entertainment area and as such can be noisy at night, particularly on Fri and Sat. Even with new, dual glazed windows, be prepared to hear people, traffic and firetrucks. It's downtown Boston afterall. I thought it might be a problem, particularly for my young children, but it wasn't. In fact we found it added to the character of the city and my children found many things to observe, including surprise fireworks over the North End. If you need more quiet, request a room on the opposite side of the hotel, but note that the trade-off is the view (empty lot or colonial alleyway-which is sort of interesting in itself). We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Internet connection was $10/day and our taxi fare from the airport was a little over $20 with toll. We found we did not need a car in the city but wanted one for a day trip to Cape Cod and Newport RI. Enterprise Rental Car is a few blocks away and will deliver the car to the hotel for free. Millenium is a solid 4star hotel and very well priced. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sashpie
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to the USA we stayed for 3 nights and we found the Bostonian very comfortable and clean, the rooms are spacious but a little bland. The air con was not working as it should so the temperature never dropped , but the staff were friendly and helpful The location was fantastic with very easy walking distance of all the sites/attractionsand shopping. The hotel was a little on the expensive side, would I stop there again ? If we wanted to be in the center of everything and for the convienience then yes I would

Reviews.Title: “Wow a great start to our new england experience”
Reviews.Author: unnaturallyhappy
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here with our pre teen daughters and were so impressed with the superb location. We had views over the fountains and bridge (which before the big dig would have been highway) Great spot for shopping as next door to Quincy market and walking distance to harbour and lots of the historical trail. Due to the ages of our daughters we asked for adjoining rooms and we were given 2 rooms with an adjoining lobby so they had no access to the corridor except through our lobby. That was great as we felt really secure. The rooms were clean, quiet and sumptious oh and big, a king and 2 Queens ( the 2 Queens had largest room). Lovely bathrooms and a little dressing room. The friendly receptionist kindly warned the children not to touch the mini bar ( usual prices) Obverall the service was attentive but discreet We had a small problem with A/C one evening and engineer came straight away fixed it it 3 mins. Only slight downside on value would be the breakfast, we were tired our first morning and should have gone out but didn't. It cost around Â£60 for four of us, we didn't eat much so be warned. Overall I would stay here again and again given the chance, I'd just eat breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brad_Almy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium Bostonian for a long weekend trip from NYC in early August. The hotel has the best location in the city...across the road from Quincy Market, a few minutes walk from the North End and right in the middle of shopping and all the historical sites. Staff were helpful, rooms were great. We actually were asked to move rooms due to an air conditioning problem in the room below us, and the room we moved to was even better. Bathrooms are great. Overall, great hotel that doesn't just rest on being in a great location, which is refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect, except the noise at night.”
Reviews.Author: stxtraveler79
Reviews.Content: The place was beautiful. The bathroom amazing (there was even a separate dressing room!). The bed comfortable. The linens soft and wonderful. The view of Faneuil Hall terrific! The only problem was that at 12 AM a bunch of guys began erecting tents and unloading boxes of fruit. This lasted the rest of the night. Imagine poles and boxes being thrown out of trucks. Imagine loud music. Imagine shouting--all night long. If they fix this problem (somehow) I will be back in a heartbeat. I knew it was too good to be true!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more...”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachJack
Reviews.Content: Location - excellent. Decor - excellent. We asked for a bathtub since we have a baby and ended up with a fabulous corner room. A possible negative for some... we had a room at the front of the hotel and sometimes the noise from the street was a little loud. It didn't really bother us, though. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice views!”
Reviews.Author: CentralCATraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Millenium Bostonian because I have a broken ankle and wanted a hotel close to tourist attractions. I also chose this hotel because they provided a wheelchair for my use during my stay. We took a taxi from the airport and the hotel was right there after exiting the tunnel from Logan. Taxi cost about $18. We flew in on a red eye, and the hotel let us check in early (7:30 AM) and even upgraded our room. I had booked the Advanced Purchase non-refundable room since it was cheaper. The room was average sized with a small balcony overlooking Faneuil Hall. You could hear the crowds below cheering the street performers, but the noise didn't bother us. No tub, but a nice walk in shower. Large flat screen TV, but no free WiFi. Bottled water in the room cost $6.50...We had lunch at the hotel restaurant. It was Restaurant Week in Boston, so we were able to get an appetizer and entree for $15. The food was good and presented nicely. My husband pushed me around Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, but the cobblestone and bricks made it a bit rough in a wheelchair. Since the buildings were old, I wasn't able to get into some of them without crutches. The hotel is also close to famous restaurants like the Union Oyster House and Durgin Park. It was also right across from McCormick and Schmick's and the Hard Rock Cafe. The Aquarium was close by and you can pick up the Duck tour there. There was a spa right next door as well. On Friday there was a little Farmer's Market right out front! The doormen were very helpful getting taxis for us ($18 to Fenway Park, $12 to the Prudential building). Overall, we found the service to be good, staff friendly, and the convenience worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, renovation complete... but one major glitch”
Reviews.Author: Nachtmusik
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights in Boston as part of a longer trip. We were given a room with a single king bed, but our group consisted of two adults and two teenagers. After several conversations with different personnel at the front desk, we learned that: 1) When you book through an online site (I had booked hotels for this trip through Expedia, Orbitz, and directly through hotels), it turns out that it doesn't matter how many people you enter as a total -- Orbitz does not request the number of children, Expedia does -- they don't pass that information on to hotels, just the number of rooms you're reserving. I thought at first that this was an Expedia booking, so I was confused as to why they didn't know that we would need a room with double beds ... it turns out I was mistaken and the booking was through Orbitz., but it wouldn't have mattered which one it was in the long run. 2) I was informed that this hotel has a limited number of double bed rooms, so in the morning when room assignments are made, getting a room with double beds would be basically a matter of chance -- even if I had called to request one there would have been no guarantee of a double bed room. Given our conversations with different people at the front desk -- the first person said she was sorry, but we could have a rollaway bed for $20 a night (a manager waived the fee when I expressed reluctance at paying that) ... the next person assured us that there would be NO problem switching to a room with double beds for our next two nights ... and then in the morning a manager who told us that our reservation was "correct" (meaning "not our problem", I guess) and that we could switch to a double bed room for the second night (and pay an additional mystery amount for the privilege) but we would have to switch back to a single king room the next) -- my feeling was that there must be a heirarchy involved with room assignment, and online bookings would be at the bottom of the list. Just a guess. We chose to stay put, and one of my daughters slept on the floor with a makeshift mattress made from the comforter from the king bed. That said, the hotel was centrally located ... across the street from Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market, near plenty of restaurants and eateries, on the Freedom Trail, and walking distance to Boston Common, the Aquarium, and the subway. Our room was not facing the street and so had no view (except for the sometimes annoyingly squeaky mechanicals of the hotel in the back), but we often paused at the view from the picture window on the way to the elevator, which was some consolation. We didn't notice any noise at all from the street on the higher floor and location we occupied. The hotel has been recently renovated, and the room was nicely appointed. The bathroom area had a separate dressing area/vanity & mirror, with a closet where we could stash most of our luggage and a cleverly designed door that could double as a privacy door for the dressing area. The shower was a large walk-in and the vanity and sink area was roomy (though oddly, no towel bars except the shower handle and a robe hook). And if you want ice, you'll have to call Housekeeping to get it. Really. All in all, except for our particular situation and the handling of it, I would recommend this hotel, but NOT for families who want a single room.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - still good.”
Reviews.Author: rednotdead
Reviews.Content: Excellent large room with huge bed and a wet-room in the bathroom. Linens were clean as was the room and bathroom. Staff were helpful and polite. The mini-bar and restarurant/bar are expensive but literally over the road is Quincy Market with loads of eating/drinking places. By far and away the best thing about this hotel is the location - bang opposite Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall and literally on the Freedom Trail. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Room, Perfect Hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: CaptinEO7
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Millenium Bostonian at the end of July after researching a number of Boston hotels for many months & the second we opened the door to our room we knew we'd made the right decision. It's a short 5/10 minute ride from the Airport & on arrival the hotel looks ok but hardly impressive externally. The lobby has been created to provide the guest with a warm, cosy feeling with a small contemporary-style library in one corner which in fact contains a lot of rather impressive coffee-table type books. General decor throughout the hotel was modern & recently refurbished. The room we were allocated was as impressive as we would expect in a major city centre hotel without moving into the realms of sheer luxury which brings a much heftier price tag. Very tastefully appointed, the bedroom was large, with a lot of light filtering in through the large windows which opened up onto a balcony overlooking the always bustling Fanueil Hall & Marketplace. The Hard Rock Cafe was directly ahead with rock music blaring out adding to the hustle and bustle but once you'd closed the baclony doors the outside sound was virtually non-existent & after 10pm outside noise was at a minimal level anyway. The bed, bedlinen, pillows etc were heavenly. We had a "Dressing Area" bewteen the bedroom and bathroom consisting of large wardrobe/closet with free digital security safe & Dressing Table & Stool with space to store luggage, this was a lovely touch when travelling with four large items of luggage. The bathroom was very impressive, all fixtures were top quality with a huge shower & all very modern. Location-wise we felt was impossible to beat. As first time vistors to Boston, we considered three different areas to stay but on extensively checking out each of these areas when visting, we were extremely pleased we stayed at the Marketplace. A whole array of shops, restaurants & the amazing food on offer at Quincy Market is steps from your room, The Waterfront is 5 mins & Downtown Crossing is approx 10/15 mins walk as is Boston Common. Most places you'd want to visit are well within walking distance although if you did want to walk to say Fenway Park I'd guess this would probably take upto an hour perhaps, we visited when doing a trolley tour & walked to the Prudential Centre from there. We had considered staying at the Fairmont Copley Place & 2 other Copley Square hotels but whilst I'm sure they were fine, we were extremely pleased we'd gone with the Millenium. We'd also looked at the 2 Marriotts & Hilton and again were glad we didnt stay there. We found Reception Staff to be great & the guys at the door were always on hand with an umbrella or to help with luggage & cabs without coming across as tip-hungry. We didn't use the hotel bar, restaurant or mini bar as there are so many alternatives on your doorstep. Cost-wise we found most hotels of what we'd call a 4 Star level to all be around the same cost ($150 - $200 per night) during our stay & we were pleased with what we got for our money. Overall, we were delighted with our stay at the Bostonian and are staggered that as of July '09 it's only rated as thirtysomething in the list of hotels rated in Boston. This must reflect many reviews during a refurbishment or something similar as there is no way there are 20+ hotels better than the Millenium in this relatively small city. We weren't looking for a pool, gym, extensive number of public computers, "cool" coffee shop in the lobby during our stay. We wanted a great location with a great room & we got exactly this here at the Millenium Bostonian.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: szpal
Reviews.Content: I'm one of those people who researches extensively before committing to a reservation. Our family loves to travel, and we like to maximize our money and our experiences. This hotel was truly outstanding for enjoying the many things Boston has to offer. The location, in my opinion, was the BEST of the many other hotels we saw. With 2 teenagers and a toddler, we look for places with a variety of things to enjoy in close proximity, and it's hard to beat this area for that. The hotel was extremely clean. My only complaint would be that one of our connecting rooms wasn't ready at check-in and was cleaned late in the day the next day. I think that might have been a temporary personnel issue or something. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place for location. Nothing spectacular.”
Reviews.Author: Joizee_HD
Reviews.Content: We were here when spending an evening in Boston on our way to Cape Cod and Martha's Vineyard. Wanted to hang out in Boston for a day and night to relax and have some fun. Were looking for a hotel in a good location to sight-see during the day as well as shop and to sleep in after a night out. Location-wise a great place. Clean and well appointed as it was recently renovated. I found everything OK. There was nothing spectacular about this place outside of location right in town. Seems to get mostly tourist visitors as well. I found the gym to be fairly poor but most hotel gyms are. Parking overnight in their garage is also ridiculously expensive over-nigt. Just go to the parking garage across the street. Cheaper. Otherwise, I can't complain about much else.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive property in a great location”
Reviews.Author: xiphe
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in many other reviews, the central location of this property is hard to beat. The rooms were recently updated, but despite reserving a superior plus room, I found the room a little small, with a tiny bathroom. However, room had everything you could need, except an easy place to put your luggage out of the way. The decor was very nice, and the bathroom fixtures were notably good. The other negative I can think of is that the room's great location overlooking the market and an arterial street made things kind of noisy at night, particularly since there are several nearby late night type bars. The hotel restaurant was surprising good. Got a fair deal on the rate through quikbook.com.

Reviews.Title: “Every thing new”
Reviews.Author: cleoOhio
Reviews.Content: Great location, able to walk everywhere. Did get a 7 day charlie card so we could use the subway when we wanted........The Hotel is very upscale...........very nice modern rooms. The breakfast are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: LoisKOregon
Reviews.Content: Booked King Standard room through Quickbooks. Hotel is in great location accross from Fanueil Hall and within walking distance of harbor, downtown, North End and subway. Took subway from airport and walked and used public transportation to viist Fenway Park, Back Bay, Beacon Hill, Bunker Hill, Boston Common, Copley Square etc. Seven day MBTA pass is a bargain. If you get one, do not forget to take the water taxi. The views from the bay are spectacular. Back to the hotel. The room was very comfortable for city hotel. There was king bed, desk, large chair, anteroom between bedroom and bathroom. The bathroom had no bath but excellent shower. Linens are high quality and bed was firmly comfortable. Internet is extra, there are no vending machines and ice can only be procured through room service. Staff was distant but professional. Overall, this was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Suprise! You get charged extra for everything and no bathtub.”
Reviews.Author: portcity2boston
Reviews.Content: Continetal breakfast is atleast 15.00, Resteruants in hotel not as good or impressive as the swanky resteraunt we found on prince st. trattoria di monica, in north end. this little resteraunt was bigger than our room and was more impressive than the hotel resteraunt. there was no bathtub. I think I get it now four star means everything that could be a nice touch costs you extra and they don't have to work as hard as a three star to impress you and hey you get what you pay for and that's why there is no service with a smile. I would try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Millennium Bostonian”
Reviews.Author: carmelvalleymom
Reviews.Content: Originally booked room at Omni Parker House and was disappointed. Moved to the Millennium and had a wonderful stay. Valet, door and front desk staff extremely professional, nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Boston is a great city; this hotel is in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jmdc1
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff made this trip enjoyable. They were attentive without being obtrusive and helpful in addressing questions posed to them.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the location”
Reviews.Author: vjha
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than once, and everytime the experience is nice. It is located very well, accessible by the blue line from the Airport, and is right next to the historic Quincy Market and Fanueill Hall. You can see the activities of the street market from the room. The lobby has a quirky library where you can browse through books on quirky topics in spare time. Absolutely marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, loved the shower!”
Reviews.Author: da1031
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, location is great, right in an area with tons of restaurants & bars. Loved the remodeled bathrooms, very luxurious shower! Would definitely return this hotel if ever in Boston again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: alkel18
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay was fantastic, from the service at the front desk to the restaurant, North | 26. The renovation looks great, my king room was a great size with a little balcony, amazingly comfortable bed. Lots of dark wood, very pretty. Bathroom was beautiful and enjoyed the vanity area. I ordered room service from the restaurant and it came quickly, and the food was excellent (goat cheese tart, clam chowder, and coconut tart for dessert) and I thought a fair value for an upscale hotel and restaurant. The restaurant is beautiful itself, I wish the weather was nice so I could sit outside and people watch. I went back for lunch the next day and the meal was just as good. You absolutely cannot beat the location, directly across the street from Faneuil Hall. All in all a great stay and I will be checking this out again for future trips to Boston. So convenient and great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: lasvegaskid
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from an amazing 3 night stay over the Easter weekend in Boston. This hotel exceeded our expectations. We arrived on the Friday evening and checked in quickly. Our room was on the third floor and was spotlessly clean. The room featured a huge bed, 40 inch TV, inroom tea & coffee, nice big bathroom (no bath, just huge walk in shower) and a small dressing room area. Previous reviewers had mentioned about noise from renovations but this I think has now been completed as we never saw any signs of building work etc and we had a very quiet room. The location of the hotel is excellent right opposite Quincy market and is about half way along the freedom trail and also near the water taxi for great views of Boston. There are a lot of restaurants/coffee shops nearby and the hotel also has its own bar and restaurant. After a long day of walking it was nice to sit in the reception area in front of the fireplace drinking a complimentary cup of warm apple cider. The hotel charges for wireless internet but I was able to receive reception to another network that didn't charge. The closest subway (T) station was Government Center and this is an easy walk to the hotel. We also used the blue line from here which is only a few stops to the airport. If we could change anything about this hotel it would be to have free inroom wireless internet (although there is a PC in the lobby area which does offer this) and slightly softer beds but apart from that we would definitely return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: penelope333
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights in January 2009 while the hotel was undergoing renovation. Noise was a minor problem in the morning. The beauitful, spacious, well-decorated room to a high standard with one of the most comfortable beds (think Marriott type bed, only with higher thread count sheets (450 in my estimation)) made up for this. I could not believe the size of the room, much bigger than anyplace else I have stayed in Boston (and elsewehere with the exception of Chicago Hotel 71 Suite). For business with sneak in pleaure and sightseeing this hotel cannot be beat. It has an excellent 24 hour gym and is so close to many good restaurants, both for dining and take-out. There are two subway lines very close by, although it is a bit longer walk to the red line without interchange. Hotel staff from janitors to managers were excellent and professional. Although Boston is known for being expensive, this hotel was very reasonably priced (about $150). As a reference I have stayed at the Omni Parker, Seaport, and Renaissance Waterfront before. This hotel is similar in terms of size and quality of rooms to the Renaissance, only much closer to the city centre and with larger rooms. Althought I can afford a more expensive hotel, when I return to Boston this will be my first choice for accomodations. I don't see how it can get much better.

Reviews.Title: “couldnt be more central”
Reviews.Author: langericious
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on the second part of our honeymoon for 2 weeks when we arrived we had not been advised that the hotel had changed its policy to a no smoking policy when we had booked a smoking room so we asked for a room with a balcony this was in the middle of all the renovations wow did we strike it lucky with a beautiful room with balcony overlooking the the marketplace the staff were very friendly and this is an amazing location to walk everywhere to from downtown crossing to cambridgeside galleria to the cape cod fast ferry and only a 20 dollar cabfare to the gaa grounds in canton loved it would most definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Sandbanker
Reviews.Content: Nice new marble bathroom; pity there are no towel rails. Towels are piled on a low shelf under the hand basin. There is nowhere to hang them either near the handbasin or near the shower. Nice double bath and and comprehensive shower system; pity there is no hand rail. Nice big annex to the bathroom; pity the wardrobe isn't a bit bigger annd a bit more accessible. Generally it is a clumsy waste of space. Nice big new HD TV; pity the LD signal quality. Nice view of Quincy Market fom our 7th floor window; pity that when we arrived we were offered a room 2 floors below looking straight into the new dining room and glass lift. The room was nicely prepaired and cleaned; pity that when we returned to our room on the second night it was still in the state we had left it in the morning. Having said all that, if we go back to Boston we will probably stay there again if the price is right. (We were on a "Travel Zoo" promotion on this occasion) PS Transfer from Logan by "T" train was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kalma511
Reviews.Content: I stayed w/my fiancee at the millenium for only one night for valentines day. My fiancee booked the trip though priceline and when he saw the hotel had valentines specials he called to book. They would not let him book the valentines special because he booked through priceline and the 'computer' wouldn't let them do it. So basically they didnt want some extra money! Oh well no biggie. We arrived on the 15th afternoon and the lobby is great, it reminded me of a cigar room, very trendy looking. We stayed in room 340 and it was very different. The shower was big and there was a little room for the girls to get ready w/a make up mirror! In order to get ice you have to call the front desk, which we did because we had a bottle of champagne. They said we would have it when we came back to the room, so we walked around fanuil hall and that good stuff. We came back 2-3 hours later and we had no ice. SO we took the waters and juice out of the fridge to put the champagne in to be cold. That was a big mistake!!! When you take something out of the fridge, everything is weighed so the front desk knows when you take something out!!! So the next day checking out we had a $65 tab for the drinks that were taken out! But the front desk was very nice and courteous and obviously didnt make us pay, I think they get that alot w/the fridge! But overall it was a nice little vacation, the hotel was nice and the rooms were great!! Just stay out of the fridge unless you want to get billed! hahaha I would stay at the Millenium again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen94
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of it's location. Being a stroll away from so much of Boston's highlights and a 1 minute walk from Faneuil Hall, we hoped it would suit all our needs, being a family of 5, for our 3 days in the city.. It turned out to do that and more. The biggest unplanned part of the trip was the weather. The day after our arrival we had 8 inches of snow in half a day. We may not have been ready but the hotel was. From help-yourself hot apple cider in the reception area to several people outside helping open the doors and get you through the entrance, we felt so looked after. The reception was warm, welcoming and relaxed with a lovely 'library' feel. Breakfast was excellent as was the service. With all the snow the location really paid off. We were able to go out, shop, eat and be entertained within 3 blocks of the hotel. When we had adjusted we even went to the park with cheap toboggans bought locally. and took in a movie, being able to walk back to the hotel easily. We all agreed how relaxed we felt in the Millenium. As we left to go to the airport, without us asking, the receptionist even looked up our flight for us to see if it was delayed. The small negatives are few. The room wasn't enormous, (though it took us comfortably), the views aren't great, we looked out over the market, but for a city hotel it wasn't bad. And the restaurant downstairs was still undergoing refurbishment. However the temporary one on the 2nd floor was fine. None of these small points affected our stay one bit. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Changed - Beware”
Reviews.Author: CALmom51
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at this hotel many times. It was one of my favorites. However, my recent visit was not pleasant. First off - the hotel did not mention the fact that their multi-million dollar facelift was still in process. There were wires everywhere, the entrance was blocked off and there was the smell/dust of fresh sheetrock throughout the ventilation system. In addition there was no mention of a $40.00 per day parking fee. The hotel has also gone from a traditional architecture in the heart of Faneuil Hall to a modern Asian. It doesn't seem to fit the area. The final straw was that after we left our room for dinner - a hotel employee came into our room and left the "connecting" room door unlocked. When we contacted the hotel manager there was not even an offer of apology. He basically asked, "well what do you want me to say?" This is not what I would have expected from a high end hotel to a repeat guest. I was very disappointed and will be seeking a new favorite in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LucyMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a friend to sight see Boston and do the Freedom Trail. Hotel is across the street from Faneuil Hall Market place and around the corner from some very popular pubs and eateries such as the Old Union Oyster House. It is a very short walk to the wonderful North End with all the fantastic pastry shops and Italian cusine. The hotel is being renovated but it did not disrupt our stay. The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are the best I have ever slept on in any hotel! This is a great location to stay to see Boston. The staff was also fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: turtleSouthFlorida
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 16-18, paid $400 a night for a "premium" room, and I could only wish I could get my money back. Friday morning at 4am the large loud truck arrived outside my room (I was on the 4th floor). It was setting up the tents, with all the clanking and banging of the metal poles that entails, for the Farmer's market that surrounds the hotel for the weekend. Then there's the unloading of all the fruits and veggies. Oh yay! That also happens on Saturday morning but not until 5am, so you can sleep in. The noise does not stop! I asked for 2 queen beds since I was rooming with a friend and got a king. The front desk said I could RENT a roll a way bed! I guess the $400 a night wasn't enough. The room itself was nice and the decor comfortable and modern. You couldn't turn the TV volume all the way down. I've had better TV at Holiday Inn. The bed was a little lumpy. The bathroom was also nice, but small. The towels were rough and small. Just a side note: I had a FedEx package delivered to the front desk. They insisted it was never delivered. After calling FedEx and getting the name of the person who signed for it, did they actually look for it.... and they finally found it. For such a small hotel, that should not have happened. The best part of the Hotel was the location. It's close to just about everything. The worst part of the Hotel was the location. The noise was unbearable. I stay in about 5 to 10 high end hotels a month and this is probably the worst experience concerning the noise I've ever had. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOICE..NOICE..NOICE”
Reviews.Author: DDBBUYER
Reviews.Content: Don't expect to sleep in at this hotel...hammers banging early in the morning...scaffolding in front of the elevator doors...only 2 availbable by the way..better ask for a view because out of our window all we saw was some piping on the top of a roof..no view at all....front desk contacted about the hammering and they commented they didn't know where it was coming from???? very pricey considering the renovation going on...on a positive, the room was clean and the location was superb but would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but some problems”
Reviews.Author: marcopoloRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Millenium Boston for 3 nights for training. Had not stayed in any hotel in Boston before but have travelled extensively to other major metropolitan cities in Europe and Asia. The hotel was still doing construction around the entrance to the lobby but inside the hotel the construction was pretty much done. Was put in a room on the 3rd floor very close to the elevators and a restaurant/bar. While the room was pretty spacious for a city, soundproof is something that they did not have. My first and last night there I was awakened only after being asleep for 2 hours due to some noise outside, and stayed awake until around 4am. Throughout the time I was awake I could hear the sound of the vacuum cleaner (someone must be cleaning up the restaurant upon closing), of door closing / opening of adjacent rooms as well as of the elevators. While they put a nice 40" or 42" flat screen TV in the room, It did not appear they have any digital cable service as the picture was crappy. Also the TV volume was preset and the only way you could either turn it up or down would be to call someone. I can understand them locking the volume so you cannot turn it up beyond a certain point but to turn it down?? The bathroom was lovely, spacious and clean. That was probably the thing I liked the most about the hotel. They also provided good quality amenities, including a 1875W hair dryer (some places I know only provide 1500W). The shower head was really nice, it was removable and its height was adjustable. The only thing is, the shower head was located on one of the longer sides of the tub (had not seen such arrangement before). Nice area, lots of nice little places to eat and shop nearby. Short walk to downtown / financial district areas. Overall was a nice hotel but there are some areas they could have included in their renovation, such as putting better soundproof and oh btw the room could also use more lighting! Pretty dark in the room with only 1 light right by the door, 1 desk light and 2 other smaller lights on the nightstands.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Katiebird1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing renovation when we were there, but the lobby and the rooms were finished. The rooms are beautiful, and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: caper2
Reviews.Content: Best location for sightseeing-convenient to everything! Hotel was under construction for renovation, but should be top notch when completed. The rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Easy walking distance to most tourist places and close to the airport. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Boston for pleasure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LeeLeeGOP
Reviews.Content: Two 30-something couples from New York/New Jersey just returned from a trip to Boston -- and we spent two nights at the Millenium thanks to a great deal due to construction at the hotel. Even with the construction and a less-than-appealing makeshift reception desk, the stay was quite nice. The rooms were fabulous, with a gorgeous bathroom and a wonderful (but small) porch facing Fanueil Hall. Our only true knock is that on Friday and Saturdays there is a long-standing veggie market that sets up right in front of the hotel and above where our rooms were situated. Its hard to enjoy your porch overlooking the city when you are greeted with the stench of rotting vegetables and fruit. Not for the faint of smell! Other things to note -- if you don't valet, feel free to at least unload your bags on the side of the road. The valet failed to mention that to me when we came to ask where we should park. We didn't want to valet and used the lot across the street. When we came by with our large suitcases, he remembered that we could have at least unloaded. Also, make sure to let the hotel know that you are parked across the street. Although the valet told us to go there, they ended up being concerned that we could leave our car there overnight. They made a call and learned it would be ok, but I am supposing that they don't usually deal with non-valet drivers. Over all, a great trip and a great location. If you can afford the nightly cost, it's a sure bet. Just bring your nose plugs if you are staying the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Worldâ€™s Best View (if you donâ€™t mind hammering at 6:30 AM)”
Reviews.Author: HarryfromLA
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s almost unfair to be writing a review of a hotel in the middle of construction, but insofar as the Millennium Bostonian is in the game of renting their rooms out to the public, I suppose that my experience counts. Hereâ€™s what I can say about the Millennium Bostonian. For the leisure traveler who wants to be in the heart of Boston, I canâ€™t think of a better hotel to be in. After seeing all of the lousy economic news and knowing that it meant that hoteliers would start discounting like crazy, I waited until the last minute to book a midweek room. When my 50% off rate at the Westin Waterfront still ended up being $225, I went for the Millennium, knowing from the Tripadvisor reviews that it was under construction. My $200 rate would be discounted to $150 if I made my reservation non-refundable, which I was willing to gamble on. However, I did splurge and spend an extra $30 to be on the better side of the building, and I sent a little note asking if I could get a good view of Fanueil Hall. All of this for what I presumed would be a $400/night room once the renovation was complete, and I was again willing to take a chance on the noise. That extra $30 was the best money that I spent during my trip to Boston. The room was absolutely outstanding. I was in a corner room on the 6th floor with a balcony (which was equipped with a lovely flower box) overlooking Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market, and we could see the Custom House and the Old State House as well. For my 10 year old, this couldnâ€™t have been better. Now the noise which didnâ€™t bother me was the music, drum circles and general hubbub from the streets below, and that pretty much died out by 10 pm. The location was ideal in another way because you are so centrally located to everything in Boston, particularly because you can walk to any of three different subway lines. We were also in one of the newly renovated rooms which were very nice. I would describe them as boutique hotel contemporary. Not way out there, but tasteful and refined. What I liked were the bigger-than-it-had-to-be-but-Iâ€™m-not-complaining flat screen TV, the comfortable bed and sheets and the seating furniture in general. The clock radio had an i-pod hook-up as well. One disappointment was the $9.95 that they wanted for wi-fi access. The highlight of the room, however, was the bathroom. I give the shower an A+; itâ€™s one of the nicest Iâ€™ve used anywhere. My son who rarely takes showers actually took two in eight hours. The limestone tile and oversized shower area gave it a luxe feel, but the kicker was the Grohe hardware â€“ a combination raintree showerhead with a separate hand washer. It took a little while for the water to heat up, but thatâ€™s probably because of the low occupancy. Other than the shower, the bathroom was a bit small, and they couldâ€™ve actually claimed some room where they have a closet so that there would be a place to put my toiletries down. As it stood, the sink was the width of the room so my bag went onto the floor. Another amusing part of the room was the toilet which had a suction so violently strong that it could probably take off a limb. Finally, they had these frosted glass sliding doors separating the bathroom from the bedroom, probably to make the bathroom seem bigger, but theyâ€™re tough to keep clean so you see all the spots. I didnâ€™t mind the lack of a lobby or the fourth floor check-in. The areas which are being redone certainly needed it to get rid of the last vestiges of the motor lodge/rounded-high gloss-dorm room wood aesthetic. We didnâ€™t try the restaurant since there were so many better options around. I didnâ€™t really ask much of the hotel since thatâ€™s not why I was in Boston, but the service level seemed serviceable enough. Which takes me to the noise. I knew there would be noise, Iâ€™m someone who prefers a fan when they sleep because the noise puts me to sleep, but I have to say that I know of many other hotels that tell their contractors to not start until 8 AM when many guests could be sleeping, particularly those from the west coast who canâ€™t fall asleep until 2 AM. I wouldnâ€™t complain if the contractors worked until 8 or 9 PM because most people are out enjoying the city, but starting the hammering at 6:30 AM seems pretty ridiculous. So I was awakened by this huge vibration vaguely reminiscent of the 5.4 earthquake that we just had in Los Angeles, followed by incessant hammering, and not the loud whacks that my next door neighborâ€™s contractor back home uses at 7 AM to frame their McMansion. No, this was more of a â€œtap tap tap tap tap tapâ€� with a 10 second to 2 minute delay, then more of the same, ad nauseum. Then housingkeeping came by at 8:13 AM, by which time the hammering was perfectly acceptable, in my book, other than the fact that my son was still asleep, but fortunately the paper thin doors tipped me off and I opened the door just before the housekeeper knocked. What kind of housekeeping person comes by that early? In any event, it allowed me to see that the contractor had ripped open the ceiling a few feet outside our room. I said â€œGood Morningâ€� to the tapper, and he tapped right back at me. In the end, tapping or no tapping, I would definitely stay at the Millennium again because the positives definitely outweigh the negatives. What I will say is that that I wouldnâ€™t take my wife during construction because I know she would be furious based on how she feels when the contractor next door gets a little over eager at 6:53. Also, I wonder what happens to the Millennium when the new Ames hotel which I can also see from my window opens up (Ames, of the Hudson/NY, Mondrian/LA uber-swank fame). But for me to be in the heart of Boston with everything at my fingertips, the Millennium is near perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Bostonian!!!”
Reviews.Author: Torontotraveller13
Reviews.Content: our stay was absolutely fantastic. the concierge marianne was incredible! the rooms were beautiful and while the building was under construction, the staff did everything they could do make our stay wonderful - including putting us in rooms far from the work being done. ed the gm was awesome as well. and a great location!! stay here if you can!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: phillyshell
Reviews.Content: After a recent stay at this hotel I felt it was my responsibility to express my complete and utter satisfaction. Having frequented various hotels nationwide, I can honestly say that the service and hospitality at the Millennium Bostonian far surpasses anywhere I have ever been. The entire personel was cordial, gracious and eager to oblige. Valerie and Andrew of the hotel staff went above and beyond to personally ensure our comfort. I have never before written a review and only the exceptional service and beautiful accommodations have prompted me to do so. The rooms were beautifully furnished and pristine with amazing balcony views overlooking Fanueil Hall/The Market Place. If ever I am in Boston again, I will look no further then the Millennium Bostonian. This hotel experience only enhanced a wonderful trip to a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: twosoups
Reviews.Content: Walked in, no reservations on a Wed night. We were not planning to spend the night in Boston but were exhausted at 10pm after a long day of sightseeing and decided to get a room. We were a bit bedraggled from a long day of touring in 95* heat. We had no luggage and were carrying a bottle of wine not finished from dinner. We probably looked a little scary & rough but were politely escorted to the side door in an alley because of lobby construction. We were turned down immediately upon asking if a room was available. We were told they are busier on a weeknight than on the week-ends (huh?). The front desk clerk began listing hotels that had availability along with the prices of the rooms. When we said price was not an issue, he continued to quote prices. We politely thanked him and left, vowing to never try this hotel or any Millenium properties again. Checked their website the next day - rooms were available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sanvanoak
Reviews.Content: What a great stay, we were in Boston for the 4th of July. Great location. The hotel is undergoing a huge renovation, we were in one of the newly done rooms, beautiful job. Great bathroom and shower, excellent linens and pillows. We had a balcony over looking Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall. The hotel staff were so welcoming and helpful, the concierge always a great help and happy to help. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler0338
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under renovation and it is an absolute mess. It's noisy and the whole place is boarded up with plywood. I was horrified by the sight of the place -- I've seen many hotel remodels, this is definitely the worst. The front desk staff is rude - wow, the service was bad. When I expressed my dissatisfaction, one lady - tall w/ grey hair, had the nerve to laugh in my face. The only thing this hotel has going for it is location - do yourself a favor and stay somewhere comfortable with friendly staff who care about the customer experience. Millenium certainly doesn't -- I tried to call their Corporate Offices to tell them about my experience and they let all the calls go to a general voicemail box with no access to a live human.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: byuby5
Reviews.Content: It is a Motel 6 in a good location. Wallpaper coming off the walls. Dirty carpet, dusty curtins. Spider webs, Motel 6 beds, nice view of a brick wall, dark and a manager on duty Shawn must have just started working in the hotel business a week ago. All this a a four star price. Yes Boston is a great city you can do much better for the same price. If I could tell you something good about this hotel I would. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love Boston”
Reviews.Author: HakuMegan
Reviews.Content: Was at a great location. Boston is such a nice city, hard to find a bad spot. Front Desk girl was nice and able to help us with directions and show tickets. Rooms were clean and had nice view of city. Beds were comfortable as well. Was a very good value. Looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Mikar85
Reviews.Content: Recently stay @ Millennium. Upon seeing our room, it was not what I had a reservation for, and the front desk was more than accommodating - even putting the 4 of us in a suite at no extra charge! Lana, the concierge, was fabulous! Very knowledgeable and her dinner suggestions were spot on! Having her services was a distinct advantage! The hotel is being renovated, though it was not disturbing at all. The restaurant was average, at best, and service was a little slow. Location is great - across the street from Faneuil Hall and minutes to walk to The Garden, The North End, and a T stop at Government Center. We found it a bit noisy at night (late night), especially on the weekend-many bars are in the area. But all in all, and ok hotel. And by Boston prices, reasonably affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: purpleknif67
Reviews.Content: One has to take into account that Boston hotel rooms are typically smaller than most American hotel rooms. Pretend you're in Europe and you'll be fine. I was traveling solo so it wasn't too difficult. I stayed in room #536. My room was small but by far one of the most interesting I have stayed in--upon entering the room, there is a mini-bar with numerous snacks and beverages (I didn't use them). A couple of steps down you enter the "main area"--to the left was a small hallway with a safe, an ironing board and two fluffy bathrobes. There was also a separate sink/vanity and then the bathroom. I was rather disappointed that I didn't get one of the hotel's mini-round tubs, (like I have before) but the bathroom was excellently stocked with plenty of useful toiletries and fluffy, fresh, clean towels. I had a fabulous view of Faneuil Hall at night. Interesting skylight windows. I felt I was in a loft. By far, the best thing about my stay was how accommodating and professional the staff was. I had no car, and arrived at the hotel at 10am, expecting to drop off my baggage and check back later to see if there was a room available. I was really surprised when the front desk person told me that she had a room available for both me and my friend, on the same floor, just down the hall. It was nice to be able to drop my stuff off, clean up a bit and get going for the day. The only complaint was the ridiculous amount I had to pay for a phone call that lasted less than three minutes. (I had misplaced my cell phone). But I don't think the price was any different than any other hotel. The hotel is in the middle of renovating and I'm expecting great things. While I'm looking forward to the construction upgrades, I appreciate the great customer service always get when I stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKS2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned to stay at the Bostonian for 4 nights during Christmas. We booked this hotel based on their website photos and after reading some reviews. Most of the reviews were favorable so we went ahead and booked the hotel. Since we were flying into Boston during winter, I called ahead to the hotel and let them know that we would be coming in late. Our flight was delayed and we arrived at 3 am at the hotel. We were greeted by a friendly valet but the front desk person was rude and stated that he was not expecting anyone to check in althought we had a guaranteed reservation and had called ahead to let them know of our late arrival. We were finally checked in after some "discussion" and our "superior room" was on the second floor looking down into the common areas (loung and hallways). The room was small and very outdated with worn, dirty carpets. When I called to ask about another room, I was told that this was one of their better rooms. After two days, my husband and I checked out and moved to the Hyatt at Boston Common. Although the Bostonian is in a great location, there are much better hotels in downtown and Boston is small enough that everything is within a 15 minute walk. So don't bother with the Bostonian for its location.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: FraminghamBill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to get away for a night to shake off cabin-fever. At the last minute, I cruised the web and found that the Millenium had a room that night for $130! The hotel is right across the street from Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall and just a short walk to the North End (Italian area). We could even see Haymarket, where vendors of vegies, fruits, assorted cheeses and such, gather outside Friday-Sunday. The prices are a steal for you bargain hunters. Pomegranates for 50 cents! The hotel is hard to find from the outside, a pretty non-descript brick building. You drive into an enclosed rotary at the main entrance to check in and to valet your car if you want. We did. This convenience costs $40 for overnight parking till 2PM the following day. We ended up leaving the car till about 5PM the next day for an extra $12. We just didn't want to deal with parking. But, if you want to save some money, you can try other parking nearby. It will not be cheap, by any means, but it will be less expensive than leaving your car with the hotel. Or you can take the train to the hotel and ditch the car altogether. Boston, especially this area, is a walking city. The lobby was very tasteful and mellow, the four star rating showed. There was a concierge immediately available. The front desk was a place you could sit at, very nice. The employees, including the valets, were very courteous and friendly. They really added to the stay. There's a nice bar, with a special martini of the week. We peeked into the restaurant but didn't eat there. The North End called to us. I have read that the rooms vary a lot. Ours showed its age, particularly in the rug, but the furniture, drapes and such were of good quality and everything worked. There was a large floor to ceiling window. Ours was a handicapped room by chance. So there was the occasional mark on the wall from a wheel chair, nothing more. The bed was low, nice to see since it amazes me how many handicapped rooms have beds so high that it would be very difficult for a person in a wheel chair to get into bed. Everything a traveler needs was there, an easy outlet for your laptop, a safe, an extra pillow, a robe. Most surprising was that the tap water was delicious! We never drink hotel water, but always try it. This water was great! It was ice cold and nicely aerated, really a treat. Free, drinkable water! In the bath, there was a walk-in shower, a heat lamp, good brand toiletries, and very absorbent towels. I have long hair so I notice the towels. I didn't have to use the hairdryer. In the bedroom, there was a love seat with a coffee table, a desk, an entertainment center with drawers and a mini bar with snacks and drinks. The bed was just okay comfortable, but the sheets didn't set off my allergies, nice for a change. They must have been rinsed well. There were only two things I would change. The television was too old to have a video jack to plug our iPOD Touch into to watch movies. I know I am being picky, but we were looking forward to using the Touch, a Christmas present. The mini bar snacks were boring. Mostly just stuff that you could pick up at a convenience store. If there had been more upscale chocolate, like Godiva or Maine Cottage Foods, I would have sprung for the $4, but for Hersheys and M&M's, no way. A four star hotel with 1 star mini bar. In the end, we are really happy to have found this hotel. Just for the chance to stay in a great location at this price in Boston is excellent. The hotel appointments and wonderful staff make it a steal. We will be going back when cabin fever strikes again, would recommend it to friends, and will probably try one of the better rooms if they are available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Straff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: intrepid411
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there on 12/29 - 12/31. The staff was excellent, the place clean, great location directly across from Faneuil Hall. Took the T into Haymarket station (just around the corner) rather than pay the $40 /night parking. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wants to be a better hotel....”
Reviews.Author: capecodphotog
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel would be a little nicer than it was. Very noisy from bar area and upstairs function room. Thought it could be a bit cleaner. The greatest location to Quincy Market. Overpriced parking and overpriced beverages in the bar. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: cherry2
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from another wonderful stay at the bostonian. this hotel is in a great location and the staff cannot do enough for their guests. decor is a little dated but the rooms are spotless and the location out weighs the decor. will be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterfirst
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near the Quincy action and aged under 30 this might be for you. We had a room facing the market and Faneuil but it was very average and extremely noisy at night. Also the price of this hotel is way above the value you get. Breakfast was poor and cramped and there is no suitable evening dining facility that you would want to enjoy. The only excellent thing about this hotel was the concierge who was professional and did all she could to help

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: GeoBob
Reviews.Content: This property has potential, but is in bad need of a remodel. The common areas are nice. The service was good. But the rooms are worn out. Furniture, carpets and fixtures are in dire need of an upgrade for this to be considered 4 star hotel. Watch out for the hidden costs. Parking is $40.00! Hotel is only 7 stories, so don't expect a view.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LindaDallas
Reviews.Content: Check staff were helpful with restaurant recommendations. The room was disappointing for the price. Two of the four lights didn't work. The bellman said he would get them fixed, but that didn't come to pass. The dim lighting did, however, somewhat hide the dirty carpet and peeling wallpaper. A travel companion had a remodeled room that was very nice. I would recommend requesting a remodeled room or bring a flashlight.

Reviews.Title: “A Worthwhile Visit”
Reviews.Author: Laurelita42
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Millennium Bostonian on October 15th. I'd like to preface my review by letting it be known that I work at a nice hotel as a Front Desk supervisor, and have some idea of how things on this level should run. We were impressed as soon as we arrived at the hotel- there were more than enough valets on staff, so checking the car in was a breeze- we waited no more than 10 seconds before we were being helped. Check-in itself was very smooth. I had seen a few mentions about the Front Desk being two small desks, and was curious as to how that would work out. I thought it ended up being a very nice setup, it was pleasant to be able to sit rather than stand in line during check-in, and the gentleman working the desk was very polite and helpful. We had room 631, which had a small balcony overlooking the front of the hotel. I thought it was a lovely room. There were some small signs of wear and tear, carpet had a few small marks on it, as did the curtains, but it didn't bother me at all. I have a great deal of sympathy for hotels, because I know how hard it is to keep them immaculate with a constant flow of (sometimes destructive) guests coming through. There was a large basket of snacks in the room for us, and turndown service was very nice and prompt. The location absolutely cannot be beat, we were right across from Quincy Market and had a great time walking around the city- everything was so close! The concierge that I spoke to on the 15th (a nice older lady) was so helpful in showing me where things were on the walking map- I had no trouble finding everything I needed to as I walked. I had booked the hotel with a small amount of trepidation because it was quite expensive for us (we are younger than most of the crowd I saw there, in our mid 20's) and I was worried we would stand out or get treated differently due to age, but the entire staff was excellent. I would absolutely come back to this hotel- it was quite pricey, but everything in Boston is going to be. I'd be much more inclined to return during the winter season when the rates are a bit lower- as I'd book for 2 nights and would be able to do more in the city. All in all, a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMae45
Reviews.Content: The selling point for this hotel is that the location is great accessing many Boston landmarks (Quincy Market, Waterfront, North End). The rooms are spacious, but in need of major renovation. The carpets were dingy and stained and the bedding looked severely out of date. The bathroom has a sliding pocket door, which was weird. The furniture in general looked worn and dated. Hallways were depressing and dark. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service, horribly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NYtraveler62
Reviews.Content: We chose the Millenium based on location, and it couldn't have been any better: Faneuil Hall & Quincy Market literally across the street, T stop 2 blocks away, North End 5 mins' walk away, and a slew of pubs and restaurants within a block. The concierge was extremely helpful, and we stored 10 bags with the very cheerful bell desk on the last day so we could check out but spend a full day In Boston. We booked a package that included breakfast for 5 every day (including tax & gratuity, so worth $50-60 a day to us); the buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff very good. We had booked two rooms and requested that they be adjacent, as well as a rollaway bed, and all were accommodated with no fuss. Now the downside: the hotel room is nowhere near what you would hope to get when paying $300+ a night. The bathroom doors are like shutters and have no locks, so there is no privacy. The bed in our room had a rock-hard mattress that sloped in the middle. The bed in our kids' room was better, but less than the quality of a Marriott Courtyard or Hilton Garden Inn. Towels are a mixed bag, and the beds have vellux blankets rather than the fluffy comforter you'd expect from a hotel at this price. There is a $40/night charge to park your car. If I came to Boston again with my family, I might stay here again, but only after carefully considering whether the location outweighed the discomfort of the bed and the very steep price. If they do the renovation that someone else mentioned and I were able to get a good night's sleep rather than tossing and turning all night, I'd definitely strongly consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but wouldn't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Peascoot
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. The bottom line is that the location is great, and that's basically what you pay for. The front desk service people were very nice and hospitable. The front desk is just that. There are two office-sized desks with two humans sitting at them. The hotel's location is fabulous, but I was not impressed with the room. My original room was a balcony room that was beautifully decorated and had a bidet. I rarely see bidets in the U.S. I switched from this room because it had two small beds and asked to be switched to a room with a queen or king bed. I ended up staying in a room without a balcony. The room decor is pretty - very New England, however, the carpet was stained. The shower was very large but I kept worrying that water was going to spill out onto the bathroom floor. Water pressure in the shower was terrible! I didn't like the bed. It was very soft and mushy. The restaurant is very high priced. I ate across the street at Quincy Market, which is very reasonable with food prices. No ice or vending machines. If you want ice, you contact room service. This seemed inconvenient to me. The t.v. had this weird thing going on. The sound was out of sync with the mouths of the people. I didn't bother asking to get it fixed and instead learned to read lips. The final odd thing was that I put the "do not disturb" sign on the door after my first night. When I arrived back at the hotel later that evening, the sign was gone and my room had been cleaned. I specifically didn't want housekeeping in the room. I didn't complain about this but was annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler147
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston to see history and a great town. My wife and I have been to Boston several times before but this was the first time with our 9 year old. Millennium fit exactly what we wanted. Walk the Freedom Trail, take the Duck Tour, see all the historical aspects of Boston - this is a great location to do it all. The service was fantastic - late night check in, early morning help, cleaning staff - consistently nice, helpful and fast. The cookies next to the front desk helped whenever there was a short delay. We were able to book a last minute table at a high end restaurant through the front desk when no tables were available. The room was a bit tired, though it was kept nice and clean with supplies refreshed, but then were not there for a dramatic/romantic room, just sleep then off to the next adventure. I'd avoid the fixed price breakfast, the variety is nice, but it's a bit expensive. Overall I'd recommend the Millennium to any one who is going to Boston to do what we did.

Reviews.Title: “A Lesson in Customer Service is Recommended”
Reviews.Author: DianeLondon
Reviews.Content: Flew into Boston on Thursday, August 15, 2007, en route to Nantucket when we were advised the flights to Nantucket were cancelled due to fog. Contacted this hotel and arranged a reservation over the phone that was confirmed with my credit card. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were advised in the rudest manner that we were at the wrong hotel, which was not the case. Too bad, they could not, nor would they help us, despite having a reservation number. Not having a room when a reservation has been made, happens. But the manner in which we were treated, the absolute disdain and refusal to provide assistance was shocking from the front desk staff at this hotel. Fortunately, the Westin were only too happy to accomodate us and delighted to assist us. This hotel offers a great location, but their staff should take a graduate course in customer service and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy'sMom
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is great for tourists but in the same general area is the Marriott Longwharf which is far superior. The room wasn't as clean as I'd like, the carpets were indeed stained, the curtains dirty and the air conditioning unit was in need of repair as it's sputtering all night kept me awake. I didn't order room service food or eat in the restaurant for fear that the lack of cleanliness extended to the kitchen, but I did order a class of wine which set me back 22.00. Mind you, that was the least expensive wine on the list. I come to Boston every 8 weeks for business and will never stay here again.
