Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: boncelondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium after missing my flight out of Boston and having to stay an extra night. I have to say I was pleased I missed the flight. This hotel had everything, location, charm and best of all great rooms! I lost my baggage and the check in staff were fantastic helping me with everything I needed. The room was big and very comfortable with the bathroom having great towels! These things make all the difference. As I said the location of the hotel is outstanding, within 10 paces you are at Quincy Market. I had a great night out. Check out was as smooth as check in and they checked out the morning flights for me. I would definately recommend this hotel for any groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rplove5662
Reviews.Content: The Bostonian was in an excellent location to see Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, the North End, and the Freedom Trail. Our room was quiet and slightly smaller than what we're used to, but fit our needs fine. The lobby area was nice, and there was a wonderful bar and restaurant. We didn't eat at the restaurant due to budget constraints, but it is great to have that convenience if needed. McDonalds was on the corner, as well as the Union Oyster Co., and several other eateries/bars. The staff were very helpful. We did miss having an ice machine at our convenience and had to call and ask for it when desired. There was also a nice mini bar in the room, however, again not necessary as it was out of our budget. I would recommend for anyone desiring a convenient and comfortable hotel in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations! Will go back there.”
Reviews.Author: CruisingAgain
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews of this hotel, I did not expect much. Well- I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, the staff efficient and very helpful with directions and tickets, etc. There was a small stain in the carpet, but nothing major. The caution about the water temperature in the showers is warranted. They are very hard to adjust. We arrived at 10:00 a.m. and a room was available for us. The room had a queen bed and locking refrigerator stocked with liquors and beverages available for purchase. We chose to buy our own bottled water and refrigerate it. The location is the BEST. I traveled with my college age daughter and went out during the day and evening feeling completely safe in the neighborhood. There is a market set up outside of the hotel to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables daily. There is also a Dunkin Donuts next door for coffee fans like myself. We did not have our meals in the hotel since there are so many fine establishments to try in the area. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine room, very good service, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: croenenberg
Reviews.Content: I was at the Millennium Bostonian for two nights, travelling alone. The location is fantastic: restaurants and taverns galore are steps away, the downtown financial district and many historic sights are likewise an easy walk, and there's easy access to the subway. (I took the subway to the airport--I was checking in at the airport about 40 minutes after I closed the door on my hotel room.) The many food stalls in the Fanueil Hall complex across the street make it comfortable to grab a bite of something tasty in the afternoon or evening. The room was clean and spacious, with an enormous bathtub, a good value for the price, especially given the location. I was on the 7th floor. My room did not have a little balcony, but the floor had something better: a spacious funished outdoor deck where one can comfortably take in the view, read the paper, or snooze. The hotel staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. Breakfast in the hotel atrium was also excellent, with good table service, though it was a bit over-priced at $25. Overall, a fine hotel experience, a delightful Boston experience, and an easy place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, great deal”
Reviews.Author: tsp302
Reviews.Content: We got a great price for priceline for 2 nights, and were thrilled with the hotel. The location is great, the staff is friendly, the rooms are comfortable and spacious. We don't travel often, and don't usually splurge for a fantastic hotel, but this was the best of both worlds--a great price on priceline and a beautiful location that couldn't be beat. We asked for a room that didn't face Faneuil Hall, because we had heard that it could get noisy. We didn't have the (tiny) balcony, and neither did we have a good view of anything, but the room was quiet. I highly recommend it and would gladly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location..”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn037
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, fantastic location across from Faneuil Hall! In addition, it is just one block from the North End (Little Italy) which is loaded with Italian restaurants, pastry shops, Gelato, and historic sights such as the Paul Revere house and the Old North Church on the Freedom Trail. The parking is "valet" style but very efficient and fast. You are given a number to call and they bring your vehicle within 5 minutes. Parking costs $40.00 but it is unlimited in and out. Frankly, everything is within walking distance, even the MBTA station at Government Center so we only used our car once. Rooms are clean and bright and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This is a four star hotel??”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I got a good deal on Priceline. This was supposed to be a 4-star hotel but there was nothing luxurious about it. The pictures posted on their web site are from 1972 perhaps? The carpet was old and mismatched in places, rooms were dank and nothing special. That being said, the location could not be beat. Walking distance to everything. On a side note, I left an item in my room and called only a few hours later from the airport to have the item mailed to my home. Phone rang 15 times before someone answered, then I was transferred to a Lost and Found voicemail where I had to leave a message. I'm still waiting for someone to call me back... Hello? I'd like my IPod charger back please....

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusably Incompetent - Do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: jmd4w
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation for a special occasion through the hotelâ€™s website. We paid a lot extra for a room with a view of Quincy Market. Really, this was the only reason we staid at this hotel instead of the many nicer ones in Boston for that price. When we showed up, they didnâ€™t have our reservation in their system which we had made through their own site. We had to pay for internet use in their lobby to print out a copy of the reservation. After waiting in a long line again, we showed them that we had a reservation for that night and gave them the reference number. They said their system didnâ€™t have it and that sometimes their own webpage doesnâ€™t talk to the same reservation system that they use. Of course, they didnâ€™t have the room with a view of Faneuil Hall that we reserved available and put us in a really poor room at the other end of the hotel. We told them that the only reason we were staying there was to have the room with the view. After complaining, the lady at the desk said that she wouldnâ€™t charge us the rate for the room we reserved but would give us the rate for the cheaper room they put us in. You would think that would go without saying. Finally she agreed to give us a free breakfast pass. The room was nothing special. We had to take an elevator and then wander through a long hallway to another small elevator to get there. There was no view. There were extremely loud noises coming from the rooms around us. I believe there was some post wedding partying going on until 2 or 3. The breakfast showed up two hours earlier than we had scheduled it so I had a bite or two and went back to bed. If we were staying there on business, it would be okay. But if you are counting on it for a special occasion or nice vacation, you really canâ€™t rely on them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a little drab”
Reviews.Author: baswitzer
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after a long flight from Australia and found the hotel to be in an excellent location across from Quincy Market. Like other reviewers, we found the rooms to be a little drab with the carpet looking well worn and the decor was certainly behind the times (for what was supposed to be a luxury hotel). Generally we enjoyed our stay but for some reason during our stay our room key was deactivated and when we went to complain to the front desk they did not seem to be care too much which was a bit of a shame. The Hotel is relying on its location to get by but with a few upgrades around the place it would be a first class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Silverbell
Reviews.Content: Before choosing this hotel, I read the reviews here on Trip Advisor, and when staying at this hotel I found the reviews to be accurate. The fantastic location of the hotel is its best point. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Boston! The staff was also reasonably pleasant. It is a little drab for a supposedly luxury hotel. The carpet in my room didn't look very clean and the wall looked scuffed. One of my pillowcases was stained. Otherwise the room was large and comfortable. I was sorry to find that the bathroom door did not have a lock - instead it had a sliding door like a closet door. And the lighting in the room was inadequate. It was difficult to read by the little light provided. Some reviewers have complained about ice not being available, but ice buckets were brought to my room every night except the first and last night of my stay. I would have preferred to receive ice every night. I ordered room service once and the food was pretty good. There was a coffeemaker in the room, as well as an iron, a hair dryer, a safe, a daily newspaper, and bottled water. I appreciated all of this very much. Overall this hotel did not quite match my expectations for such an expensive hotel, but it was a pleasant and comfortable place to stay. I liked the staff and the low-key lobby, and I didn't feel out of place even in blue jeans. I think the price of the hotel is justified by its great location and pleasant atmosphere, and I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: jamsie65
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, very sharp, very modern. Very good service. Felt like royalty on arrival. The room was 110 USD. It was very comfy with a sofa, big TV screen, double bed with majestic cushions, 2 bathrooms with lights dimmed for extra pleasure. The breakfast was a bit pricey, though, so i ended up ordering the cheapest fare on offer - egg with toast. I have to say both items were the best i've ever tasted. The location of the hotel is superb - right beside Quincy Market. The staff are very friendly too - a breathe of fresh air from rude New Yorkers.

Reviews.Title: “A bit on the dumpy side”
Reviews.Author: Wollace
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Millenium Bostonian twice in the past couple of years through Priceline which advertises it as a 4 star. Priceline nowadays is an outlet for distressed hotel rooms so it should be no surprise that this hotel is a bit shabby. Why they insist on not replacing the carpet years after it has decayed and started to smell is beyond me. Also, there is a fair amount of noise that enters the rooms from pipes, toilets, etc. Otherwise the location is great and the staff accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Bethpen
Reviews.Content: My Mom, sister and I stayed here with our three kids. Upon arrival, only one of our rooms was available. We waited three hours, to find the second room had to have had a toilet overflow...STINKY! We refused to stay in that room so they upgraded us to a suite and a smaller room. Our smaller room's lock was not working, so we kept having to have them come in and let us in. (it happened a lot with the kids going from room to room). The staff did their best, but the hotel is a bit shabby...Our shower controls were installed improperly, so it took a little while to find the hot water. (we had to point the control to COLD). Dumb stuff, but it did grate on our nerves a bit. We loved the bellmen and valets, they couldn't have been more helpful. Wireless internet would have been nice. You had to pay for TV internet, we didn't use it. Our rooms were above the bar downstairs, it was pretty loud last night until about 10:30-11. The funny thing is, I had a bad experience here in '91, and wrote my first nastygram to a hotel. (the comped me another visit) Since that time I have written one other complain letter (to VW), so I'm not really a whiner... If they do some renovations, I'd give them another shot, but for now, they're off the list. I think the staff was great given what they had to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Craig_Woodward
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fantastic location for the Faneuil Hall restaurants and bars. We found the staff to be most helpful and accommodating. The room was clean and had everything we needed, but could do with a little 'tidy up', ie paintwork and doors. A 10 minute walk gets you to the centre on Boston and to the common which is a great place to start your Boston adventure. There is a fruit and veg market just in front of the hotel, so if youâ€™re a light sleeper you may want a room to the rear of the hotel as they get going at 6am. We didnâ€™t take advantage of the hotel restaurant but did have drinks in the comfortable bar area, which we found to be reasonably priced. All in all this is a great hotel, location and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Easter Get Away”
Reviews.Author: ResceptYourMomma
Reviews.Content: I read some negative comments about the condition of the Millenniun Bostonian Hotel on TripAdvisor but my husband and I we'd try the hotel anyway. The location is fabulous and we found the food and staff to great, certainly underrated. Yes, it could use some work but we understand that a major project will start soon to renovate just about everything in the hotel. We would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to be in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mooseconn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a few days in Boston, and had stayed at this hotel years ago. Things have changed. The hotel was OK, but it is in dire need of a renovation. The bath fixtures and tub are in need of replacement, as well as the carpets. The biggest disappointment was the restaurant, Seasons. It is advertised as a gourmet restaurant, however it was a typical hotel restaurant. Dinner was average and expensive, breakfast was awful. The hotel is in a great location, but it has really gone down hill . The only positive was that the staff was very nice. Maybe we expected too much, but we will choose another place upon our return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: killiegirl
Reviews.Content: Great room with 2 huge double beds, in an excellent location for shopping and transport.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Frank67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and had a great time. We went to Boston to see hockey game at the TD Banknorth Garden (formerly the Fleet Ctr.). Outstanding location just across the street from Faneuil Hall and within walking distance to the arena and numerous bars and restaurants. There were four of us in our party and there were no complaints. Everyone who worked at the Hotel was extremely professional. Our rooms were pretty big, spotless and comfortable. The food was good. I will stay here every time I visit the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Pipcosta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Bostonian from 1/25-1/29/07. We stayed in room 639. This room has good views of the market, and windows on two sides. The room is spacious for a city centre site, with a safe, and plenty of cupboard space. We found the room to be very comfortable and would return without hesitation to this hotel in future visits. The hotel is clean, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The light colour of the carpets may be the reason for comments from previous reviews, but then we did not cross the Atlantic to inspect carpets. Breakfast served on the fourth floor is very good with the emphasis on quality (mega buffet fans may be disappointed). The hotel is perfectly located, everything is either within walking distance, or a short trip on the T. Boston is a great city, people are friendly, and with the current exchange rates offers exceptional value. As an example a weekly unlimited ticket on the T (metro) costs only $15. The hotel is only two stops from the airport (after a short courtesy bus ride to the T). Boston is blessed with a very high number of quality restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the MIllennium Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FRANKRAFFA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millennium, Boston from 1/12-1/15/07. I was very excited to get the $109 travelzoo rate that I just discovered a week ago. It was perfect for me. The location of the hotel is incredible, directly across the street from Faneuil Hall in Boston's waterfront area. There are a number of restaurants and clubs that are right on the street below, as well as in the Faneuil Hall complex. If you are someone who does not party hard at night, having a room directly on the street(blacony rooms) might be difficult with the news and commotion that I witnessed at 1am on Friday/Saturday night. My room had no view whatsoever, but it was very quiet. The room, itself, was one of the best that i've ever had, not to mention for the price of $109. When I thinnk of the dives that I have stayed in during my trips to Manhattan, I cannot beleive the luxury and the cleanliness of the room, as well as the two-part bathroom with an incredibly big tub. There were some annoying parts of my stay. There is no shuttle to the airport. There is coffee only during the week and not on the weekend when I desperately needed it. When I quesitoned the staff about this slight imperfection, I received two different explanations(at two different times). The first was that they needed the restaurant staff for the morning breakfast,. What??!?!? The second was that, on the weekend, there is a fresh produce market in front of the hotel and people walk in off the street to have coffee. What?!?!?!?! An upscale hotel like this does not offer coffee to its clients. Why can't they put the coffee on the fourth floor where the breakfast restaurant is located? This was disappointing. Thank God for the DUNKIN DONUtS next to the hotel. A positive and a negative was the free internet wireless access only in the lobby. To have internet access in the room, there was a DSL line which was not free. Why, in 2007, is there no wireless access in a hotel room, in a luxury hotel? I did spend time in the lobby doing my business when I needed to be in my room. There is a very nice bar/restaurant off the lobby and a breakfast restaurant on the fourth floor. The buffet was not at all attractive in the breakfast restaurant and I would have expected much, much more for the high price of $24. The staff, however and the decor were excellent. The service, apart from the quality of the buffet, was otustanding with very friendly waiters. There is no gift shop and no refreshment machines, so be prepared to purchase what you need in Faneuil Hall, before reutrning to your room. The convenience of the mini-bar was nice, but I could not afford any of the products sold. Overall, the proximity to the T line and the location of the hotel made my trip an interesting one. The hotel room, bed and facilities in the room were very comfortable. The woman who served as the concierge was very helpful and the desk staff, for the most part, were wonderful. However, it's hard to find someone in the lobby in the middle of the night, and you have to call out behind the desk area to get someone. Do not expect an expanse of a lobby, if this is your thing. There is a quiet area near a fire place that is nice. My checkin was very quick, in spite of the hotel having only two desks to check in clients. I arrived at 6pm and that made it helpful. frankraffa@ aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Location is all it has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Leelee-TA
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a better review of this hotel but it was a disappointing experience. I had high hopes when the reservationist upgraded my room to a deluxe with a balcony and fireplace. The pros: Location is great. I had a great view of Quincy Market. The hotel is within walking distance to many places especially the North End. The staff was very nice. Great breakfast by room service which was included in the price of the room. The cons: The room was outdated. Bad lighting. The bathroom was OK but the bathrobes were old and hard to the touch. Very loud street noise. The heater/conditioner was next to the bed and kept my husband up all night. The canopy over the bed was broken. You have to call room service for ice. The fireplace is not electric or gas so you have to call the front desk to bring a fire log and light it and then plan on staying in the room while the fire is going ( 2 to 3 hours) or call the front desk when you leave so they can put out the fire log. It's a nice touch but too much to think about and plan during a one night stay. Parking is $40. We parked at a local garage, it was the same price but we got more hours for the same amount of money. (We stayed in Boston shopping long after check out. ) The biggest disappointment was that they ran out of hot water at 10am. My husband had to take a cold shower. When I called down to the front desk they said a pipe had burst in the basement. I told him the same thing happened the last time we stayed there a few years back ( and gave us the same story) and he accused me of calling him a liar. I told him that there was no way this could have happened AGAIN!!!! So if you stay here make sure you shower early!!!! There are many great hotels to choose from in Boston that offer great deals like breakfast and parking included in the price. Check around.

Reviews.Title: “Too much Christmas Cheer”
Reviews.Author: marysman
Reviews.Content: Living in the region, I am quite familiar with many Boston hotels. I booked the Bostonian for a romantic weekend because it is close to the great Italian resturants of the North End and across the street from the unique shopping of Quincy Market. Wanting the weekend to be special I selected the Superior room w/balcony overlooking the market. This was a $40 upcharge from the standard room. What we got was a smallish room, the furniture laid out so the person on the far side of the bed had to crawl over the other person to get out. A balcony that was approximately 2'X 5" did have a good view of the market (nicely lit for the holiday season). Stepping out of our room to go to dinner we were surprised to walk right into a Christmas cockatil party set up on the internal veranda just outside our door. It can get quite noisy on the street below the balcony rooms when the clubs let out and no one was yelling Merry Christmas. Maybe I am just being a Grinch but overall the hotel was a disapointment for the money. Next time I will pick one in Back Bay. The great food of the North End is just a T ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Badley Needs Facelift. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: GLOPURPLE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the hotel. After looking at 5 rooms finally got one that was cleaner than the others, The carpets were very dirty with stains and looked very sad and worn. Furnishing the same and looked like thay had not been decorated in years. The room that we finally took had to have a good clean, carpets and remove cob-webs fron ceiling. But on the upside the Reception Staff and Bellman on duty when we arrived could not have been more helpful to try to find us another room. The room cleaning and bed were very good. Location is great. Seasons Restaurant was very good if a bit expensive for travellers on a budget. Executive Chef was excellent and knew all about Customer Service.The Hotel Managerment were also very sorry about the state of the rooms and said that the whole hotelit is due for face lift. They did show us a mock-up room of the newdecorated one and this was realy up-market. As it is at the moment it is below the star rating it has.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY...GREAT DEAL”
Reviews.Author: TARCY2
Reviews.Content: I got a great holiday deal on the Millenium for Thanksgiving weekend through Travelzoo. I paid $119/night with breakfast included. Breakfast vouchers included $17 per person per day to be used on room service or at Seasons restaurant. This was more than enough for both of us to eat breakfast without charge. The hotel itself is perfectly located, right in the heart of the city next to Quincy Market, the North End, the T. (We walked everywhere without a problem.) Our room on the 4th floor was of decent size with a king bed and sitting area. Turndown service with chocolates was a nice touch. The only complaint I do have was with the room temp. It seemed to run a bit warm and even though we kep the A/C on all weekend, it never really seemed to cool things down. Check -in was a breeze and the concierge was very very helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. I must give props to Joe the bellman. He was wonderful! My brother and his wife had recently visited the Millenium as well and got lost driving into the city. Joe stayed on the phone with them for 25 minutes until they arrived in front of him. He really went above and beyond! This was an excellent value and a really great weekend. I look forward to returning in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite Howard Hughes”
Reviews.Author: Elton_Bear
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market locations, then this is definitely the hotel for you. We had a three night stay at the Millennium Bostonian as part of a flight/hotel package through Opodo, a European travel website operated on behalf of a number of airlines. It's really easy to get from the airport on the 'T' subway, and my recommended route at busy times on the roads. It's about 150 yards from State Street station, and right on the Freedom Trail too. Check in was most efficient, and my spirits rose when the clerk told me we were on a private floor (8) with its own elevator from floor 7. I already could see the "Howard Hughes slept here" plaque on the door to our penthouse suite. Sadly, it was not to be. Floor 8 turns out to be a 6 room section perched on the top of the annexe, and while the room was very nicely furnished, it was, in US speak, a "European size" room. Perfectly adequate, and comfortably furnished, though the bathroom was definitely one person at a time size. Clearly designed by a man too, for the dim lighting in there was definitely not putting on make-up friendly! We were also above the main a/c units for the lower function rooms, so we had steady noise which could disturb some light sleepers. That said, the hotel was fine, though terminating the complimentary coffee in the lobby at 7.15am seemed a little hasty for non business guests! The Atrium Lounge had some reasonable light food options, though the choice outside at Quincy or the Italian quarter of North End will probably interest you more. We didn't try the Seasons restaurant which has a top reputation. I would love to give a 3.5 mark to this hotel. The room location, quite far from everything in the hotel, and its size, leads me to lower the score on what would otherwise have been a very satisfactory stay in a very central and handy location of an most interesting city, and therefore a sure fire 4 score. So I end up with 3!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bmelter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Boston for a business trip. The location is great as it's right across from Quincy Market and around the corner from many local pubs, cafes and shops. My room was a bit on the small side and really dark. The bed was comfortable, the room was reasonably clean. My view was across to a glassed in atrium area of the hotel. The bathroom was very old with a brown ceramic tile floor, yellow tile vanity and older fixtures. The bathroom alone needs some serious updating. Overall, a very clean hotel, nice staff, but the rooms are just average and definitely not up to date. A good day at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “great long week-end stay”
Reviews.Author: catdill45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I meet my brother and his wife in Boston and stayed in this lovely hotel. We arrived Friday before 12pm and was suprised to see that our room was ready. Nice spacious room overlooking the market. The only disappointment in the room was the dirty carpet..other than that the room was very clean. We spend a great week-end sight seeing all of Boston and eating in great restaurants. I will definitly plan another long week-end in Boston and stay here. Very friendly and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay when in boston”
Reviews.Author: Hgood1
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels in Boston extensively. I wanted a room with a balcony as I dislike the closed in feeling you get in boxy rooms with windows that don't open and I wanted a hotel that enabled you to feel the history of Boston. I wanted casual elegance, where you can feel comfortable wearing a suit or jeans. And I got all that at the Millennium Bostonian. Room service is speedy. Some of the selections are yummy. Their cheese selections are delectable as is their flat iron steak sandwich and club sandwich. And though there is no ice machine, call for ice and you get it straight away. Everyone at this property aims to please. The maids all greet you warmly in the morning and the sit-down check-in is most civilized. The step-out balconies overlook a historic square and the hotel is in walking distance of Boston's most historic sites. It's also one of the closest hotels to Logan Airport and yet none of the plane noise is heard. The superior plus room, while a little bit more expensive, is the way to go--rustic beams on the ceiling, a huge oversized bath, and it's much more elegant than the standard rooms. If you're looking for romance, definitely spring for the superior plus room. Seasons Restaurant is where the power brokers of Boston go to breakfast. The eggs are great and the bacon is cooked to perfection. For an extra ten dollars, you can have room service breakfast. Ask for the bed and breakfast package. I've never heard of a breakfast/room package where you could get breakfast sent to the room...and for ten dollars only...what a value! I just love this property. Very homey, the address to stay at when in Boston. Whatever you do, at least, get the superior room with step-out balcony, but again, spring for the superior plus. A dear friend of mine recommended this hotel as the place to stay and I'm grateful for the recommend. He was so right! I will be staying at the Millennium Bostonian the next chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Ovarall a good stay at the Millenium Boston”
Reviews.Author: KC49
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Millenium Boston in September 2006. Overall it was a pretty good experience. The location couldn't be better. The room was a bit worn. The carpet wasn't clean, the couch was torn, and there were a bunch of wires sticking out from under the desk. The tub/shower was large. Two seperate sinks was a bonus for my wife and me. There was always something going on from our vantage point on the small balcony. There was a farmers market for two days of our stay, it was fun to watch the festivities right below our balcony. There is a bar directly across the street from where we were staying. That could be both entertaining and annoying. A large contingent of bikers who showed up at the bar one night decided to show everybody how loud they could be at 2:30 in the morning. I can't blame the hotel for this immature behavior. We were very close the the north side where there are many Italian restaurants with some of the best food I've every tasted. There are also some good dining options right across the street at the Faneuil Hall Marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bad parking experience.”
Reviews.Author: MaryHogan
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location. Couldn't be more convenient, although not a great spot if you are a light sleeper...it can be noisy. We were upgraded to a small suite on arrival when they did not have our reserved grade fo room available. The room was very pretty and the bed was extremely comfortable. The breakfast was excellent. The lounge has a great view. BAD parking experience. Dropped my car off Fri afternoon for the weekend. Was paying $40 per night for the priveledge/convenience. Thought the car would be safe. Nope. When I got the car back on Sunday both sides had been mercilessly keyed. After filling out a claim form with the valet company I was assured they would pay for it and they would contact me. It is 4 days later, I have left 3 messages and spoken with the valet account manager for the hotel. Still no word from the claims department. Hope they come through on their word. This behavior doesn't reflect well on an expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris3051
Reviews.Content: This was truly an exquisitely fine hotel. Room was beautiful, bathroom-spacious and high quality, staff/concierge were helpful and polite. Book a room with the small balcony overseeing the Marketplace. This hotel was in the perfect location for walking to all the sites. It was nice to be able to stroll around the Marketplace in the evening and then cross the street to our cozy hotel room. You won't need to use your car if you stay here, but the parking was expensive-$40 a day. I highly recommend the MB Hotel! Top notch, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & great location”
Reviews.Author: joan&mike
Reviews.Content: While not an inexpensive place go stay, nothing in Boston is particularly inexpensive, which makes this place a good value. The rooms are very nice. Our room had a small balcony overlooking Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall. We were within walking distance of so many historic sites, shopping and restaurants making this a most excellent location. And a free breakfast came with our room - not a bagel and coffee but a complete breakfast in their restaurant, complete with cloth napkins. We were not expecting this. The parking service is run by a different company. They tried to charge me $70 instead of $35 because I arrived before noon (I got there at 11:45). Because they did not inform me of such an "extra" charge when I arrived, I refused to pay it and they agreed to deduct it from my bill.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: mdray
Reviews.Content: While its location is great, the hotel itself leaves a lot to be desired. For starters, there is no lobby in this hotel. That is right, you walk in an there are a couple of desks, you are greeted, get checked in, and up you go to your room, nowhere to "hang". We had an 'upgraded" suite, and other than a (terrible) sleeper sofa, and a double door to divide the two rooms, nothing about this place was impressive. Amenities were average, and the noise level a problem, late into the evening (being across from Fannueil Hall, and Market Place). We needed directions to the hotel, and when I called the hotel, the concierge person cut me off, and hung up on me because I could not write fast enough for him, he was too busy to wait for me. All in all, this mostly stems from the price of the room, at over $300 a night, you'd expect much better. Also buyer be aware, there is a whoping $40 a night parking fee!!! OUCH!!!

Reviews.Title: “Speechless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. We stayed their twice. Both times we were more than satisified. Excellent staff, great rooms and excellent location. It is a very posh hotel. Our biggest complaint is the noise issue from Faneuil Hall. We were on the 6th floor and we could hear all the reveling at FH/QM at all hours on the weekend. Very annoying when you are paying $300/night. Their restaurant indeed is known all over town. Big wigs like Phillip DeNormandie (large east coast real estate developer) frequent it. The food is excellent and the wait staff very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A Tourist's Best Pick”
Reviews.Author: paintchipgirl
Reviews.Content: Hey, all these good reviews can't be wrong. The Bostonian really is the best location for tourists visiting Boston. I've stayed at the Prudential Center, too, and like this spot better. Good access to the T, easy walking to the National Parks Visitors Center, North End restaurants very close, and that Quincy Marketplace right across the street for eats and shopping -- it's all right here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: annasmom73
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, like all the other reviews. Nice place, our room was right over the street, and directly across from Quincy Market, but exceptionally quiet. The hotel is expensive! Parking is expensive, and I feel if I pay $40 to park I shouldn't have to tip the valets $20 too, in order to get my car quicker. Another weird thing is that you have to call room service for ice. I can get my own, thank you; because next thing you know, you are tipping for ice that is free, and tipping for someone to come light the fireplace, etc, etc, etc. The bathroom looked a little Holiday Inn-ish...the paint was cracking onto the floor, the bath rug was torn, and the toiletries were generic. When I pay well over $300 for a room, I expect brand names and un-torn rugs. We liked the Onyx much better, for over $100 less. This was a nice place, though, great location, like I said. You can walk to anywhere, and the market on a Saturday is a great place to people watch!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the tourist. Close to the "T" (the local Boston underground), the main part of town and the harbour for those whale watch tours. The hotel itself is nice and fairly compact. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful so no complaints really. The rooms are nice and kept clean. I would really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with easy access to downtown and the North end. Subways are very close which is an additional bonus. You can get there on the blue line for $1.25 from the Airport, and quicker than a cab ride. On the negative side, like most Millenium hotels it is a little shabby; carpet was heavily worn and cheap to begin with, no coffee maker and no tub. Since I got the room discounted on priceline I didn't have super high expectations. Mostly a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nce property, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: Goneonvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium last week, and we were very pleased. The staff is very good, the rooms well appointed, and the location is great. The property is next to Fanueil Hall and Quincy market, and two blocks from the North End. The Quincy market has tremendous food kiosks and pubs, and there is a comedy club upstairs. The North End has some of the best Italian restaurants that you will ever find. The North End is also very historic, with Old North Church, the Revere House,... A piece of advice - don't bother with a car. We had been skiing, so we had a car with us. We should have returned it, as the location of the hotel makes it easy to walk, and parking is $40 per night. I enjoyed the Millenium, and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ziggyhughes
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a four night stay in Boston at the Millenium Hotel. In all we were very pleased with the hotel. We had a lovely big room on the seventh floor with a balcony and sofa and a separate dressing area. The view on this side of the hotel was not fantastic as it overlooked what is left of the Big Dig however it was quiet. Service was very good and rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day. Having read previous reviews some customers have commented on decor and carpets etc - while it may be quite chintzy in places I dont go on holiday to check out the standard of the carpets as I have more important things to do like enjoy myself!! Lounge was very nice altho drinks were a bit pricey and the one morning we had breakfast at the hotel the pancakes were off ( very disappointed - I had flown the Atlantic for genuine pancakes with maple syrup!!!) Location is fab - Quincy mkt and Faneuil Hall over the road and T station within 5 mins walk. Did all the tourist stuff - best bits observation deck at Prudential tower, Freedom trail, Sunday brunch at Joels bar on Newbury Street and tickets for Blue Man Group at the Charles Playhouse. Very safe city to walk in and much friendlier then NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: flower1126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millennium for 3 nights and it was the perfect location. I had never been to Boston and was ready to see everything, the hotel location allowed us to do that. Short walk to the T that took us all around the city with no problems. Close to some of the best restaurants in town. A short walk to the North End where we discovered Regina's Pizza, Giacomo's, and Mike's Pastry some of the best food I've ever had in my life. Right across the street from Quincy Market & Feneuil Hall which was great. The room was small and for sure was not sound proof. There was construction right outside of our room so we had a nice view of a crane. Which woke us up fairly early the next morning. Also there was a bar across the alley that we were above that played loud music into the early hours of the morning. However, what do you expect in a large city where their buildings are very old. I did have an issue with no ice machines in sight. I found out that you must call room service if you want ice. Housekeeping was always late in coming to clean our rooms, and only once did they leave me ice in my room. We tried calling several times for a wake up call but they never answered their phones or the line was always busy. We also tried calling housekeeping and that line never worked as well. I would stay here again only because the location was so perfect. The rooms were clean and the conceirge was always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Needs Work Despite Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Manoavalley
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that the Millennium Bostonian was once a premier hotel. The basic structure of the hotel and rooms are well laid out despite being small. The staff was always courteous, prompt to handle our requests, friendly and efficient. However, the rooms really needed updating. The carpets were stained, bedspread worn, curtains worn and dusty and furniture dated. We were moved to a larger suite when we reported our top floor room had hot water problems. The best thing about this hotel is it's location to the North End and Quincy Markeplace for tourists and a good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Millennium Hotel and Surrounding Area”
Reviews.Author: pahhobbs
Reviews.Content: August 2005 brought us the luxury of spending the night at the Millennium Hotel in Boston. With a view of the North Church, Fanuiel Hall, and Quincy Market we were ready to re-discover Boston the capital of our home state. The "big dig" has allowed the city to do away with the old, ugly overpasses that literally broke the city into pieces. Now you can see the North End and the Boston Garden (new name--can't remember!). Everything seems within walking distance. We walked to the North End where there are no less than 100 restaurants (maybe a small exaggeration) to choose from. There was a parade in the streets the night we were there, which made it even more festive. Food galore and everything was delicious. Boston is a great city for all kinds of visits. Great for children, lots of history, excellent shopping, catch a sports game, just lots of fun. No limit of things to do and see. Just within the walking distance of the hotel, actually seems like a circle, there are restaurants and bars that really give you the flavor of Boston and New England. They LOVE their sports teams and you can catch the fever at anyone of these places while having a cold beer and a cup of chowder. You can stop and have a drink at a high class joint, or stop in a the dive next door. There really is something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money...Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very, very disappointed. Electrical outlet in wall didn't work so lamps and tv and other items all running off extension strip. Appalled at the limited selection of tv channels. I have gotten a better selection at a Holiday Inn or even a Motel 6. There wasn't even a coffee maker in the room and I never did find an ice machine, even though there is an ice bucket in the room. If I had to pay the bill myself I would have moved to another hotel, but the meetings I was in Boston for booked the room. I also repeatedly informed the front desk that I would contact them if, and when I needed the room serviced but kept getting notices about needing to call housekeeping and then one day they went in the room even though I had the do not disturb sign on the door. Also the pillows and bed were very lumpy. About the only thing going for it was the location and the concierge was very nice...but I don't think all that money was worth it when I could have stayed elsewhere for less money and easily taken the T into town. Next time I'll know better and I'll go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “My Boston Favourate”
Reviews.Author: DowntownMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I started staying at the Millennium Bostonian a few years ago, and now I stay there exclusively. The staff has gotten to know me very well and I get upgraded to really nice rooms (balconies/big tubs/floor to ceiling windows/free breakfasts - way up on 7th floor) I'm a fan of the convenient location - McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, Martignetti's Wine & Liquor Store, Naked Fish are all there, besides overlooking the Quincy Market. I usually get rooms for $139/169, unless there's some type of convention in town then it could go up to $289 or more. Sure some of the rooms could be re-furbished, the carpet in some rooms could be replaced - but I can look past it. There are way more positives than negatives. Check out the deck up on 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kittykai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights having "won" a Priceline bid. Apparently, this was a very busy weekend in Boston and we paid a lot more than we normally would want to pay - $225. The good news was that the hotel has an excellent location and we had a very nice room. I called ahead and asked if we could be upgraded. When we checked in, the front desk clerk indicated that she did upgrade us. Our room overlooked the street in front of Quincy Market. It was a little bit loud, but not bothersome. We had a very small balcony, but it was nice to be able to open up the doors and look around. The bathroom had a seperate dressing area with an extra sink. The bathtub was huge, too bad it wasn't a jacuzzi. The room itself had a kingsize bed, nice linens, and a loveseat and extra chair. The staff was very nice. We dropped our bags off early, made a couple special requests, etc and all were met with positive attitudes. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a couple on nights”
Reviews.Author: DSS-Bombay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 16th to 18th September, The staff were extremely helpful - After a 19 hour flight trip, I left my phone in the cab, The front desk tried really hard to contact the Taxi company to get it back. (ultimately I did get it). Few issues - charged for an international call which I did not make - they took it right of the bill - no questioned asked (Careful- there is a 65% mark up on all international calls). Small room and pricy but I guess you pay for the location - right opposite quincy market and 3 blocks away from Washington Street (Great for shopping Filene's, Filene's Basement, Marshall's & Macy's). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: tripprf
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed in a single room at the Millinnium the weekend of Sept 16th. We booked and payed for the room on Orbitz and payed $350.00 per night, which wasn't bad considering there was a Boston College - Florida State football game that weekend and several large conventions were in town. The hotel is in an outstanding location - located right next to Faneuil Hall with views of the Quincy Market and the old State House up the street. We had an elegantly decorated deluxe room with french doors overlooking Quincy Market/Faneuil Hall and although you could hear the Boston traffic, it wasn't too bad. The staff, particularly the bellmen, were very helpful and friendly. There was a farmer's market set up right outside the hotel entrance with a wonderful selection of produce and the hotel is in easy walking distance to the north end for Italian food, the long wharf for the Aquarium and trolleys, and the downtown, historic areas in Boston. We don't usually pay $350 a night for a hotel, but this hotel was worth it based on location alone. I would recommend it for occasions like honeymoons and anniversaries and not so much for families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: pahhobbs
Reviews.Content: I found the location of this hotel to be excellent. It is convenient to everything within walking distance of the North End, Fanieul Hall, Quincy Market, and waterfront. We had requested early check in and it did take a little longer than we had hoped. They took our luggage and held it for us while we explored the city. It was delivered promptly to our room when we checked in by an extremely pleasant bellman. The hotel staff was beyond my expectations reading the previous reviews. We found everyone we came in contact with to be very personable and helpful. We stayed in a corner balcony room on the 7th floor with two different views which included the North Church and the Holocost Memorial. The balcony was very tiny and I wouldn't pay the extra money for it again. The room was very clean and not run down at all. It was beautifully decorated and the bed was comfortable with nice sheets and pillows. We did have breakfast in the restaurant the following morning and although a little pricey, you are in downtown Boston, the food was excellent as was the service. The restrooms on the first floor are very convenient when walking around and may be accessed only with a room key which is nice. There are places to have a drink right around the corner, a Dunkin Donuts and McDonalds right outside the lobby for something quick in the a.m. if you choose. The Old Time Trolley station was right there too. There is a concierge in the lobby who will help you with just about anything your heart desires with a smile. I would stay here again if I had the chance to come to Boston. The city is just getting better and better. I would challenge anyone to find a better rate for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: THN2006
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for one of the best hotel locations in Boston - look no further than the Millennium. Bordering on Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market, it is absolutely central to everything. If you are looking for a clean simple room - again this is the hotel for you. What lets this hotel down is the way they keep the common areas. The hallways look very sad and the carpeting looks like it should have been repaired/cleaned/replaced some time ago. The lobby is small and nondescript and the hotel staff, although efficient and courteous, lacked warmth. There are a lot of deals on the internet and as long as you don't pay the list price - and you want to see and enjoy as much of Boston as you can in a short while - this Hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble Times Five!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Millennium Bostonian in the past and liked it very much. It has been two years since our last stay. We experienced unbelievable problems during this stay. We should have been tipped off when the front desk staff, who were normally friendly in the past, did not even acknowledge us when we entered. And we were the only ones waiting. One front desk person was busy with a guest but the other one was just chatting to another employee. 1. The first room we stayed in had a shower that did not work. Unfortunately, we discovered this the morning after arrving and spending our first night there. As a result, we had to be moved to another room that morning. 2. After being out and about all day we arrived back to find out we had no clean towels nor housekeeping service. 3. When we tried to call to report this, the room phones were not working (they worked that morning.) 4. Then the lock to the room failed and took them over an hour to fix!! They offered to move us to another room but we were leaving the next morning and did not want to change rooms again. They solved all of the repair problems and made an allowance on our bill. 5. But the next morning, upon checking out, we noticed a minibar charge on our bill when we never used the minibar. All this in only 2 days!!!!!! The decor in the hotel and rooms is lovely. And the location is wonderful. The lounge is beautiful. The bartenders and waitresses are the friendliest people in the hotel. The hotel certainly did not meet up to its prior standards. We never had problems in the past. This time the stay was almost a disaster. We are afraid to return as guests of this hotel. Who knows? The next stay could be Trouble Times Ten!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better choices for travelers”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_Boston
Reviews.Content: Well, it all comes down to location when in Boston. Driving is not a recommended activity for a new tourist from outside the east coast. Boston has poor signage, and some angry drivers. And if someone flips you the bird, they are really saying ... "Welcome to Boston" it is just custom here ... So what does this mean for this hotel? Stay at a hotel in Boston that is centrally located to where you want to visit. If you are interested in Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, North Station ... then this is the place. It is where I always book friends traveling from out of state .. and I often stay here as well. It is located at the Government Center transportation stop, so you can pretty much get anywhere in Boston .. The rooms are small, but quaint with nice decor, toiletries, etc ... I would recommend looking for a rate under $200/night ...anything above would be pushing the quality/price ratio. Call the hotel direct and ask for their best rate ... they sometimes will drop below their internet rates ... There is plenty of food, and nightlife here ... all within steps. It is the closest and only hotel directly in Quincy Market ... I give it an A for Beantown.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tallymebanana
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; excellent location, booked through auction type site for $100 per night double room in August (in 2003), was lucky I guess. Probably wouldn't pay much more though. Room was small but everything else was perfect. I would definitely try to stay at this hotel (at a similar price) next time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good for location”
Reviews.Author: Chickynyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business travel on June 1st. I've been to Boston before and normally stay at the Marriott hotel on the wharf. This hotel is great for tourists; you are right in the midst of the vicinity of the marketplace and can pick up the freedom trail, etc. Room was very nice, concierge and front desk all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: idonthave1
Reviews.Content: Great location, right in front of Faneuil Hall. Unfortunately, the building is a bit old and not too well maintained. Our room was a "superior room" with a view of Quincy Market. Nice little balcony and view, but you hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience.”
Reviews.Author: WHH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at The Bostonian. The room was very well appointed, in fact, one of the nicest I've stayed in. The staff was pleasant and professional. The restaurant is very pricey and may not be a good value considering the other excellent places in the immediate neighborhood. It is now easy-off, easy-on to the highway with little travel in the congestion. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Historic Location”
Reviews.Author: celem
Reviews.Content: Good location right in the historic area. Room was good with a huge shower. We used a package deal of $149 including full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business in Boston. It has a great location right next to Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market which I can imagine could be quite noisy during summer so get a room facing towards the back. The rooms were pleasant enough although hardly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium Hotel disaster!”
Reviews.Author: pwalsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days at the Millenium Hotel Fanuel Hall Hotel spending about $1.100 on the room bill and were stunned that a four star hotel was so dirty! The entire hotel including the room, had carpets that were filthy. The hair dryer was hanging from the bathroom wall with exposed electrical connections, the towels were harder and rougher than any hotel I have ever been in and there was only towels for one person. The TV could not be made to work, and the wooden window frame was all rotted out and moldy. To top it off, my letters to the management were never responded to! While this review is written some months later, my anger and disappointment at this appalling experience has not diminished one bit. If there had been a room available anywhere nearby we would have immediately checked out. We were trapped!

Reviews.Title: “Inflated Price for a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 2002 for one night while I was in town for a function and I found it to be a nice hotel convienently placed near Fanieul Hall. I walked in after an evening function and there was no one to be seen in the front desk area, finally someone came out to help check me in. The room was nice it was large and clean and it had some nice amenities such as the dual rain forest shower head in the bathroom and clean crisp linens. The entrance was was nice but it wasn't incredible everything was somewhat average looking within the hotel. The location is wonderful the confort of the rooms is wonderful. The service was very mediocre and the common rooms were ordinary. Nice hotel if you get a great deal, it was not worth the $450.00 dollars it cost me to stay there but that is what I get for staying in the city in the summer, you pay for location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dogcabo
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location - across the street from Fanueil Hall, short stroll to the North end and all of the fabulous italian restaurants, one block from Downtown crossing with great shopping, farmers market right outside the front door, across the street from the T, and easy access on and off the highway which is a challenge these days with the big dig. Have stayed several times at this hotel, it is showing some wear and tear, can be noisy at night, and rooms are on the small side, and parking is high - 35.00 per night. However, staff all very friendly and eager to be helpful, and the location make this a good choice for beantown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: janeknows
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite with a fireplace which was lovely. This hotel is a bit run down for the price, but the service was excellent. It is incredibly noisy, but after a lavendar soak in the jacuzzi, we really didn't care. I reccommend this hotel, but if you are used to super luxury hotels; you will be sorely dissappointed. Oh and stay away from the mini-bar and hotel bar--incredibly expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. It's the heart of EVERYTHING! Steps away from Faneuil Hall, Cheers, and State Street T. I came to Boston on business and the hotel staff could not have been more accomodating. They start each morning with a newspaper at your door and end each night with turndown service, including ice brought to each room and candies for your pillow. The room itself was clean and spacious, and the bathroom was HUGE!! Take my advice, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “VERY Noisy”
Reviews.Author: kbalfe
Reviews.Content: This is a tough review to write because there were both good and bad things about the stay. PROS: Location...the hotel literally overlooks Fanueil Hall and there are tons of restaurants, bars, etc. within a 5 minute walk. Service...I thought the staff was very helpful and prompt. CONS: If you get a room overlooking Fanueil Hall (Quincy Market) and it's a Friday or Saturday night, be prepared to not sleep from 1:30-3:30. That's when the bars get out. Since Boston has a bit of a cab shortage at that time, the kids basically stand in the street screaming for taxis, while the taxis drive by and lay on their horns. It's a time honored tradition that is fun if you're not trying to sleep 50 feet away. Parking...it's already been noted that valet is $35 Overall, if you can stay for under $200, it's a pretty good value, just get a room not facing the market.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Musarion
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium Hotel our last night in Boston. The location is great, but the hotel was a disappointment. Our non-smoking floor smelled of cigar smoke, the room was small and dingy with stains on the carpet, the bed and pillows were uncomfortable and the hotel certainly needs some remodeling. I would have expected this from an older hotel outside the city, but not for the high price we paid. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on this site, I had asked for a high-level room to avoid street noise, and was given one on the sixth floor. The room was great - large, attractive, comfortable, luxurious bathroom and added touches etc. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I was undisturbed, although I could see what other users meant about the rooms above the fruit market, and would recommend asking for higher-level rooms. Some rooms of this hotel also seemed to look out directly onto the "Big Dig" construction going on in Boston - that may also have been pretty noisy. I didn't eat in the hotel - the restaurant is apparently renowned in the city, and is expensive. But Quincy Market across the street has more than enough affordable places to get good food and drink. The location was great for both walking and access to the T. Although my stay was totally fine, I still don't feel totally enthused about the hotel - partly because it is very expensive. I got a good internet deal on Hotwire, but I would not pay full price to stay here. As the T service seems to be so effective I may even choose to stay further out of the city if I come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, nice bright room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston with my 9 year old on October 9 for 3 nights. We booked our entire trip through Priceline. When we checked in I requested a balcony room if available. Thinking that due to Priceline we would be sent to a crappy room, I was pleasantly surprised when our room turned out to be lovely! The "balcony" is a little misleading because it is tiny, but it was great to have french doors that opened, as well as windows on either side. Our room over looked Faneuil Hall, which gave us a wonderful view, but which also proved very noisy about 2 am Sunday morning. The hotel itself was quiet, it was just the location by all of the bars. The staff was very accomodating and friendly and we used the concierge service several times. There are several subway stops close by and plenty of shops and restaurants. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ctribbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millenium from 10/6-10/10 and had a great time. I verified my reservation a week before arrival and after some glitches were cleared I ended up w/ a king suite overlooking Quincy Market. The room was very large and the amenities were plenty. We asked for extra bathroom toiletries and loofahs and they were there upon our return. The ice we called up for was delivered within 5 minutes every time. The check in staff, the concierge, and the bell staff were very helpful w/ directions and suggestions. The best part of this hotel is definitely its location. You can't beat being right across the street from Quincy Market. You can shop, eat, start tours, etc. from there. You are also very close the the North End (5 minute walk) and their shops, bakeries and restaurants are all very good. You are also a 5 minute walk from the Aquarium and the wharf. I will admit that there was a lot of noise from the market on Saturday night from about 1:30-2:30 am as people were leaving the bars and hailing cabs. You can avoid this if you want by having a room in back of the hotel. Would I have paid $589/nt for the suite? No way, but I wouldn't pay that for any room anywhere. But hey it was an upgrade and I got a free fruit and cheese tray upon my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Parking $35.00 per day! Rooms $369.00 per night ouch!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware of this place! Tourist trap!! Hotel is an old building that has never ending work going on! Drunks , homeless people! The Sea port or Hyatt is much nicer and only a mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the millenium”
Reviews.Author: ajc817
Reviews.Content: we pricelined this hotel for a 5 day stay in sept 04 and got a great deal of Â£80 night. we were excited about the location since fanuiel hall is a great base for exploring boston. all the staff we encountered, from the check in woman to the people who delivered ice to our room, were very friendly. we managed to get a 7th floor (top floor) room so we didn't hear hardly any noise from down below, although sometimes i heard a little before i fell asleep. (nothing that would wake me up and i'm a light sleeper) i would suggest requesting the top floor,though, just in case. the bed was soft and comfy, the tub was a massive oval one and they had a nightly turn down service, which included chocolates and weather forecast for the next day. also, there are home made cookies at the desk for guests every night. i found the hotel to overall be very accomodating and highly customer service oriented. one of my best hotel experiences and you can't beat the shopping and restaurant options right at your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but parking price is steep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the varied submissions concerning this hotel I was curious about what this hotel looked like. It is a nice hotel. Our room was clean and bright. It was small, but cozy. No noise preoblems whatsoever. The location of the hotel is convenient, close to both the North End and the historical places. The support staff was mostly considerate, except for one woman at the front desk who was cold to us. My major complaint was the cost of the parking at the hotel. Boston is a walking city and a car is not only unnecessary, but also not a good idea. So we parked at the hotel. It was $35 a night! I knew this going in, but knew of no cheaper alternatives. That amount seems ridiculous to me. If you drive to this hotel try and find alternative parking arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and in walking distance of everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Tim_with_Suitcase
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend there as a solo traveller. Superb, clean, comfortable and large rooms. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are a bit on the expensive side, but then you're bang in the middle of things, near Fanueil Hall. The Freedom Trail can be picked up just outside, and there are plenty of bars and restaurants on the doorstep to complete your Bostonian experience. The harbour is a short walk away, and you can get fast boats over to Provincetown on the Cape from there. There's a market alongside on Saturdays, with a great seafood/oyster stall where you can just turn up and slurp as many of the slippery blighters as you like, 3 for $2 ! Very relaxing hotel - faultless.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: spikeHenryville
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a beautiful hotel directly in the heart of the city. The location cannot be beat! The staff was great. I particularly enjoyed the Seasons Restaurant staff. They were friendly and great with our kids. The room was spotless and the bathroom was beautiful. You are directly at the street fruit market which is very colorful. Request a higher floor hotel for a great view!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 4th of July weekend. After reading some of the earlier reviews on this hotel I was nervous and considered changing to a different hotel. I'm glad that I didn't. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were nicely appointed and the carpet was just fine. The location certainly could not be beat. It's right off of the walking tour and across from Fanuiel Hall. While I could hear some of the noise from the street it was nothing like what I expected. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. Directly across from Quincy Mkt & Fanuel Hall. Short walk to North End and more than one T stop. Had a room overlooking Quincy market with the balcony..it was abit noisy---but think about where you are located and what would you expect. Upon check-in they gave us a pent-house room even though we had reserved the "balcony" when I called to Complain they immediately changed the room to a front balcony and apologized. My only complaint was with the restaurant and that was a matter of somewhat slow service, However, they had the best English muffin I've ever tasted.

HotelInfo.Name: Millennium Bostonian Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 26 North Street, Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Boston, MA 02109-1509
